column2: Asymptomatic: people who are infected but never go on to develop symptoms Pre-symptomatic: people who are infected but have not yet developed symptoms Symptomatic: people who are infected and showing symptoms #COVID19 #coronavirus Learn more
#COVID19 is caused by a new virus. We are still learning about the disease every day. We need more data to better understand transmission. #coronavirus Learn more
Live on #COVID19 transmission with @DrMikeRyan & Dr @mvankerkhove. #AskWHO
Wash your hands for 40 seconds and sing along "Wash Wash Wash Your Hands" with @peppapig and and her friends, Rebecca Rabbit and Mr Badger! Washing your hands can help to stop the spread of #COVID19
The @Minions & Gru are supporting WHO in making sure people of all ages stay safe and healthy during this #COVID19 pandemic: physically distancing being active at home being kind to each other
WHO has joined forces with the #UnitedKingdom government to run ‚ÄúStop The Spread‚Äù, an awareness campaign about the risks of incorrect and false information regarding the #COVID19 pandemic

False information on #COVID19 is spreading & putting people in danger. Make sure to double-check everything you hear against trusted sources. For accurate information on #coronavirus find official advice from your country's public health authority & WHO!

Make your own avatar using @Genies and spread WHO‚Äôs #HealthyAtHome messages with personalised stickers that you can use on messaging & social media! To make your own, simply download the Genies app from App Store or Play Store. #COVID19 #coronavirus
The full briefing on #COVID19 by @DrTedros

"More than six months into the #COVID19 pandemic, this is not the time for any country to take its foot off the pedal. This is the time for countries to continue to work hard, on the basis of science, solutions and solidarity"-@DrTedros

"So far, WHO has shipped more than 5 million items of personal protective equipment (PPE) to 110 countries. We are now in the process of shipping more than 129 million items of PPE to 126 countries"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"The platform also includes the #COVID19 Supply Portal, enabling countries to request critical supplies of diagnostics, protective equipment and other essential medical provisions"-@DrTedros

"This online tool enables countries to enter planned activities for which they need support & donors to match their contributions to these activities. So far, 105 natl. plans have been uploaded & 56 donors have entered their contributions, totalling USD 3.9B"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"As part of our commitment to coordinating the global response, WHO is also running the #COVID19 Partners Platform, an online tool that enables countries to match needs with resources"-@DrTedros

"We emphasise that digital tools do not replace the human capacity needed to do contact tracing. Starting tomorrow, WHO is convening an online consultation on #COVID19 contact tracing, to share technical & operational experience, incl. innovations in digital technology"-@DrTedros

"More evidence is needed about the effectiveness of these tools for contact tracing. We encourage countries to gather this evidence as they roll out these tools, and to contribute that evidence to the global knowledge base"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"But they can also pose challenges to privacy, lead to incorrect medical advice based on self-reported symptoms, and can exclude those who do not have access to modern digital technologies"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"As part of a comprehensive approach, digital contact-tracing tools offer the opportunity to trace larger numbers of contacts in a shorter period of time, and to provide a real-time picture of the spread of the virus"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Others use GPS or Bluetooth technology to identify those who may have been exposed to an infected person. And still others can be used by people to self-report signs and symptoms of #COVID19"-@DrTedros

"Some are designed for use by public health personnel, like WHO‚Äôs http://Go.Data application, which has been used successfully to trace contacts during the ongoing Ebola outbreak in DRC"-@DrTedros #COVID19 https://bit.ly/30mR8vo

"WHO has also published new guidelines on the use of digital tools for contact tracing. Many digital tools have been developed to assist with contact tracing and case identification"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Last week we published guidance that describes how existing polio surveillance networks can be used in the #COVID19 response, and outlines the measures that should be put in place to maintain an effective level of surveillance for polio"-@DrTedros
"Contact tracing remains an essential element of the response. In some countries, there is already a strong network of #healthworkers for polio who are now being deployed for #COVID19"-@DrTedros

"We also encourage countries to strengthen the fundamental public health measures that remain the basis of the response: find, isolate, test and care for every case, and trace and quarantine every contact"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"As much as possible, keep at least 1 metre from others, clean your hands, cover your cough and wear a mask if you attend a protest. We remind all people to stay home if you are sick and contact a health care provider"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"WHO fully supports equality and the global movement against racism. We reject discrimination of all kinds. We encourage all those protesting around the world to do so safely"-@DrTedros
"We continue to urge active surveillance to ensure the virus does not rebound, especially as mass gatherings of all kinds are starting to resume in some countries"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"In these countries, the biggest threat now is complacency. Results from studies to see how much of the population has been exposed to the virus show that most people globally are still susceptible to infection"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We also see increasing numbers of #COVID19 cases in parts of Eastern Europe and central Asia. At the same time, we‚Äôre encouraged that several countries around the world are seeing very positive signs"-@DrTedros

"Most countries in the African region are still experiencing an increase in the number of #COVID19 cases, with some reporting cases in new geographic areas, although most countries in the region have less than 1000 cases"-@DrTedros

"More than 100,000 #COVID19 cases have been reported on 9 of the past 10 days. Yesterday, more than 136,000 cases were reported, the most in a single day so far. Almost 75% of yesterday‚Äôs cases come from 10 countries, mostly in the Americas and South Asia"-@DrTedros
"Almost 7 million cases of #COVID19 have now been reported to WHO, and almost 400,000 deaths. Although the situation in Europe is improving, globally it is worsening"-@DrTedros

"We want to thank those who have continued to ensure that people can access safe food throughout the #COVID19 pandemic. WHO is proud to work with the @FAO in ensuring all people have access to safe, nutritious food for healthy living"-@DrTedros #FoodSafety
"Yesterday marked #WorldFoodSafetyDay. #FoodSafety is everyone‚Äôs business, every day. In times of crisis, it‚Äôs more important than ever"-@DrTedros
Media briefing on #COVID19 with @DrTedros

Make your own avatar using @Genies & support WHO‚Äôs #StaySafe initiative with personalized stickers you can use on messaging & social media! To make your Genie, simply download the Genies app from App Store and Android #COVID19 #coronavirus

Latest snapshot of WHO's activities & work with partners in the #COVID19 response, covering: Support to countries to prepare & respond Acceleration of research & development Coordination https://bit.ly/2UmaLj0 #WHOImpact
Share the ‚ÄúDo the Five to stop the spread of #coronavirus‚Äù filter and stickers with your friends on @Snapchat ! And subscribe to WHO on Snapchat https://snapchat.com/add/who #COVID19

Say ‚ÄúThank you!‚Äù with WHO-Viber Medical Superheroes sticker pack to show your appreciation for #HealthWorkers who are working around the clock in time of #COVID19! http://vb.me/e120c9 #coronavirus
WHO lead expert on infection prevention and control, @allegranzib, is answering your questions on the who, when and how of mask use during #COVID19 #AskWHO
Stay connected with your loved ones during #COVID19: Send air high five & celebrate our medical heroes using WHO-@WhatsApp 'Together At Home' sticker pack! #coronavirus
Live Q&A on the use of masks during #COVID19! #AskWHO
Get latest & accurate information about #COVID19 with WHO Viber interactive chatbot. Available in multiple languages http://bit.ly/2R3QgGf #coronavirus
WHO Health Alert on #COVID19 is also on Messenger http://messenger.com/t/WHO Stay informed and get accurate information about #Coronavirus!
Stay informed on the latest information about #COVID19 from trusted sources. Try WHO WhatsApp service http://bit.ly/who-covid19-whatsapp Start by typing ‚Äòhi‚Äô. #coronavirus

#FoodSafety = Everyone's business! It's a shared responsibility between governments, producers & consumers. Everybody has a role to play to ensure the food we consume is safe and will not cause damages to our health. Happy #WorldFoodSafetyDay!

Foodborne illnesses are usually infectious or toxic in nature and caused by bacteria, viruses, parasites or chemical substances entering the body through contaminated food or water. Take action to ensure #FoodSafety. https://bit.ly/SafeFood2020
What precautions should one take when shopping for food during #COVID19? Ensure your hands are clean Keep physical distance (at least 1m) #FoodSafety https://bit.ly/SafeFood2020

Access to sufficient amounts of safe & nutritious food is key to sustaining life and promoting good health. Teach your children early about how to handle & prepare food safely. #FoodSafety https://bit.ly/SafeFood2020

The value of trade in food is US$1.6 trillion, approx. 10% of total annual trade globally. Recent estimates indicate that the impact of unsafe food costs low- & middle-income economies around US$95 billion in lost productivity each year. https://bit.ly/SafeFood2020

DYK An estimated 600M - almost 1 in 10 people in the world - fall ill after eating contaminated food and 420,000 die every year Children under 5 carry 40% of the foodborne disease burden, with 125,000 deaths every year More facts in pictures: https://bit.ly/2U7JRM0

During crises, access to safe & healthy food is more at risk. While food is not known to transmit #COVID19, we can ensure #FoodSafety by following the tips below. Q&A on COVID-19 & food businesses https://bit.ly/3dBUPAQ

Unsafe food containing harmful bacteria, viruses, parasites or chemical substances can cause 200+ diseases! Vendors at markets/restaurants should also practise the WHO 5 Keys to Safer Food. https://bit.ly/SafeFood2020

You can ensure #FoodSafety at home by practising the @WHO 5 Keys to Safer Food: Keep clean Separate raw & cooked Cook thoroughly Keep food at safe Use safe water & raw materials https://bit.ly/SafeFood2020

All players from farm to fork, we invite you to join WHO/@FAO & take action to: -Ensure it‚Äôs safe Governments -Grow it safe Agriculture & food producers -Keep it safe Business operators -Eat it safe Consumers -Team up for #FoodSafety All https://bit.ly/SafeFood2020

#COVID19 put a spotlight on the role of online learning to respond to health emergencies. Find out how #OpenWHO, WHO‚Äôs free platform is identifying, transforming, translating & transferring knowledge to be accessible for all during the #pandemic: https://bit.ly/2ByRBjr

Happy #WorldFoodSafetyDay! #FoodSafety is everyone's business. Whether you grow, process, transport, store, distribute, sell, prepare, serve or consume food, you have a role to play in keeping it safe. https://bit.ly/SafeFood2020
People should make informed and wise food choices and adopt adequate behaviors. They should know common food hazards and how to handle #FoodSafety. http://bit.ly/2U7JRM0

Achieving #FoodSafety requires expertise from various disciplines: toxicology, microbiology, parasitology, nutrition, health economics, human & veterinary medicine. Local communities, women‚Äôs groups & school education also play an important role. #FoodSafety

Overuse & misuse of antimicrobials in agriculture & animal husbandry is one of the factors leading to the emergence & spread of #antimicrobialresistance. Antimicrobial-resistant bacteria in animals may be transmitted to humans via food. http://bit.ly/2U7JRM0 #FoodSafety

Food contamination has far reaching effects beyond direct public health consequences ‚Äì it undermines food exports, tourism, livelihoods of food handlers and economic development, both in developed and developing countries. http://bit.ly/2U7JRM0 #FoodSafety

To improve #FoodSafety, different governmental departments and agencies, encompassing public health, agriculture, education and trade, need to collaborate and communicate with each other and engage with the civil society including consumer groups. http://bit.ly/2U7JRM0

WHO updated guidance on the use of masks for control of #COVID19: https://bit.ly/2AJYSMS The new guidance is based on evolving evidence and provides updates on: who should wear a mask when a mask should be worn what a mask should be made of
The full remarks on #COVID19 by @DrTedros
"WHO will continue to provide the world with advice based on the most up-to-date evidence, as part of our commitment to serving the world with science, solutions and solidarity"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"The cornerstone of the response in every country must be to find, isolate, test and care for every case, and to trace and quarantine every contact. That is what we know works. That is every country‚Äôs best defense against #COVID19"-@DrTedros

"I cannot say this clearly enough: masks alone will not protect you from #COVID19. Masks are not a replacement for physical distancing, hand hygiene and other public health measures. Masks are only of benefit as part of a comprehensive approach"-@DrTedros
"Masks can also create a false sense of security, leading people to neglect measures such as hand hygiene and physical distancing"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Our guidance also explains how to use a mask safely. People can potentially infect themselves if they use contaminated hands to adjust a mask, or to repeatedly take it off and put it on, without cleaning hands in between"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Based on this new research, WHO advises that fabric masks should consist of at least three layers of different material. Details of which materials we recommend for each layer are in the guidelines. We also provide guidance on how to wash and maintain a fabric mask"-@DrTedros
"Our updated guidance contains new information on the composition of fabric masks, based on academic research requested by WHO"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"In light of evolving evidence, WHO advises that governments should encourage the general public to wear masks where there is widespread transmission & physical distancing is difficult, such as on public transport, in shops or in other confined or crowded environments"-@DrTedros
"Third, WHO has also updated its guidance on the use of masks by the general public in areas with community transmission"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Second, in areas with community transmission, we advise that ùóΩùó≤ùóºùóΩùóπùó≤ ùóÆùó¥ùó≤ùó± 60 ùòÜùó≤ùóÆùóøùòÄ ùóºùóø ùóºùòÉùó≤ùóø, or those with underlying conditions, should wear a medical mask in situations where physical distancing is not possible"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"That means, for example, that when a doctor is doing a ward round on the cardiology or palliative care units where there are no confirmed #COVID19 patients, they should still wear a medical mask"-@DrTedros

"Here‚Äôs what‚Äôs new: In areas with widespread transmission, WHO advises medical masks for all people working in clinical areas of a health facility, not only workers dealing with patients with #COVID19"-@DrTedros
"And WHO continues to advise that #healthworkers use medical masks and other protective equipment when dealing with suspected or confirmed #COVID19 patients"-@DrTedros
"WHO continues to advise that people caring for an infected person at home should wear a medical mask while they are in the same room as the sick person"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Here‚Äôs what has not changed: People confirmed to have #COVID19 should be isolated & cared for in a health facility & their contacts should be quarantined. If it is absolutely necessary for a sick person or a contact to leave the house, they should wear a medical mask"-@DrTedros
"Here‚Äôs what has not changed: WHO continues to recommend that people who are sick with symptoms of #COVID19 should remain at home, and should consult their health care provider"-@DrTedros

"I wish to be very clear that the guidance we are publishing today is an update of what we have been saying for months: that masks should only ever be used as part of a comprehensive strategy. Masks on their own will not protect you from #COVID19"-@DrTedros
"WHO has developed this [mask] guidance through a careful review of all available evidence, and extensive consultation with international experts and civil society groups"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Today WHO is publishing updated guidance on the use of masks for control of #COVID19. This guidance is based on evolving evidence, and provides updated advice on who should wear a mask, when it should be worn and what it should be made of"-@DrTedros
"WHO looks forward to working with @gavi to make realise the power of vaccines for everyone, everywhere"-@DrTedros #VaccinesWork

"I‚Äôd like to thank all donors who stepped up yesterday to fully fund @gavi for its next 5-year cycle. This is a vital investment in saving millions of lives from vaccine-preventable diseases"-@DrTedros #VaccinesWork
Media briefing on #COVID19 with @DrTedros

Globalization of food production and trade is making the food chain longer and complicates foodborne disease outbreak investigation and product recall in case of emergency. http://bit.ly/2U7JRM0 #FoodSafety
Ahead of the #WorldFoodSafetyDay, WHO and @FAO experts are responding your questions about #FoodSafety. #AskWHO
Join WHO/@FAO Q&A on #FoodSafety, Ask your questions!

The food supply is complex and involves a range of different stages including: on-farm production slaughtering or harvesting processing storage transport distribution before the food reaches the consumers. https://bit.ly/2U7JRM0 #FoodSafety
The consequences of foodborne disease are usually more severe and may be fatal for infants, pregnant women, the sick and the elderly. https://bit.ly/2U7JRM0 #FoodSafety

The most common symptoms of foodborne disease are stomach pains, vomiting & diarrhoea. Food contaminated with heavy metals or with naturally occurring toxins can also cause long-term health problems including cancer & neurological disorders. #FoodSafety

DYK: 1 in 10 people fall ill every year from eating contaminated food and 420,000 die each year as a result. Children under-5 are at particularly high risk. 125,000 young children die from foodborne diseases every year. https://bit.ly/2U7JRM0 #FoodSafety
Seasonal influenza, pertussis & tetanus can be deadly. Vaccinating pregnant women against these diseases is safe and helps protect #VaccinesWork for all

Vaccines are safe! Any licensed vaccine undergoes many tests, involving thousands of healthy people for many years before it‚Äôs approved. Vaccines are continuously monitored to make sure they are safe and effective. #VaccinesWork

Q: When should I get vaccinated? A: Vaccines protect us throughout life. Don‚Äôt wait until you are exposed to a serious illness like during an outbreak. There may not be enough time to receive all the doses needed to keep you safe. #VaccinesWork

You are far more likely to be seriously harmed by a vaccine-preventable disease than by a vaccine. Vaccine-preventable diseases can cause: Blindness Deafness Paralysis Brain damage Infertility Malnutrition Birth defects Death #VaccinesWork for all!
Vaccines are one of the best investments we can make in human health & potential. Thanks to the polio vaccine, the has seen a . % reduction in polio cases since 1988. #VaccinesWork
Nurses & midwives are vaccine champions for parents and parents-to-be. They are also trusted and credible sources of information about vaccines. #VaccinesWork #SupportNursesAndMidwives
The #GVS2020 also highlighted how important a safe, effective and equitably accessible vaccine will be in controlling #COVID19. #VaccinesWork

The backdrop of the #COVID19 pandemic is a sobering reminder of how much individual health depends on collective health and the critical role that vaccines play in keeping the global population safe and healthy. #VaccinesWork http://bit.ly/2ADEZam

The bold funding commitments mean that the @gavi Alliance will be better able to maintain immunization in lower-income countries, mitigating the impact of the #COVID19 pandemic. They will also help strengthen health systems. #GVS2020 #VaccinesWork http://bit.ly/2ADEZam

The new pledges will enable @gavi to protect the next generation and reduce disease inequality by reaching an additional 300 million children with vaccines by 2025. #GVS2020 #VaccinesWork https://bit.ly/2ADEZam

WHO welcomes funding commitments made at today‚Äôs #GVS2020, hosted virtually by the #UnitedKingdom government. The Summit is @gavi, the Vaccine Alliance‚Äôs third pledging conference and follows the successful Berlin summit in January 2015: https://bit.ly/2ADEZam

During emergencies like #COVID19, risk of outbreaks like measles & polio increases. #VaccinesWork to help keep us safe, keep us out of hospitals and protect our health workers. Make sure you & your family are protected through vaccines.

As we respond to #COVID19, now more than ever, we must ensure the continuation of essential health services like immunization , to stop vaccine-preventable diseases like measles, polio & meningitis. #VaccinesWork

Millions of children around the will likely miss out on lifesaving due to #COVID19. To combat the resurgence of other deadly diseases, we must continue delivering vaccines where we can and immunization once this outbreak is under control. #VaccinesWork
WHO Clinical Management Lead for Emergencies, @diazjv, is answering your questions about #COVID19 clinical care. #AskWHO
Q&A on #COVID19 clinical care. #AskWHO
Vaccines are safe. The most common vaccines - like measles & tetanus - have been in use for decades. Millions of people receive vaccines safely every year. #VaccinesWork

"Now is the moment for the to come together in solidarity to realise the power of vaccines for everyone Now is the moment for all of us to fully fund @gavi to ensure it continues to prevent, protect and prosper"-@DrTedros #GVS2020 #VaccinesWork
#Smallpox was not ended by a vaccine alone. There was one other key ingredient: solidarity"-@DrTedros #GVS2020 #VaccinesWork
"#COVID19 is a devastating reminder that life is fragile & that in our global village, our individual health depends on our collective health"-@DrTedros #GVS2020
"The immunization infrastructure that the @gavi has helped build over the past 20 years will be essential for fulfilling that duty"-@DrTedros #GVS2020 #VaccinesWork

"That‚Äôs why WHO and our partners have established the Access to #COVID19 Tools Accelerator and the COVID-19 Technology Access Pool. Our shared duty is to ensure that once a vaccine is available, it is available to everyone"-@DrTedros #GVS2020
"A vaccine will be essential for controlling #COVID19. But vaccines only realise their true power when they are deployed to protect the poorest and most vulnerable"-@DrTedros #GVS2020

"The #COVID19 pandemic is unraveling many of the gains we have made. Vaccination campaigns for polio, cholera, measles, meningitis and HPV have been disrupted, putting hundreds of millions of people at risk"-@DrTedros #GVS2020

"Thanks to vaccines, hundreds of millions of deaths have been prevented. Polio has been pushed to the brink of eradication, and just in the past few years new vaccines have become available for Ebola and malaria"-@DrTedros #GVS2020 #VaccinesWork

"This towering public health achievement was only possible because of the world‚Äôs first vaccine, developed by Edward Jenner in 1796. Dr Jenner gave birth to one of the most powerful tools in the history of medicine"-@DrTedros #VaccinesWork #GVS2020
"This year marks 40 years since #smallpox became the first ‚Äì and to date the only ‚Äì human disease to be eradicated"-@DrTedros #GVS2020 #VaccinesWork

"Thank you for the opportunity to speak today, and I‚Äôd especially like to thank the #UnitedKingdom for hosting #GVS2020, and Prime Minister @BorisJohnson for his leadership in this vital area of public health"-@DrTedros #VaccinesWork

Q: What‚Äôs in a vaccine? A: All ingredients in a vaccine help ensure they are safe & effective. Vaccine ingredients can look unfamiliar on a label, but they occur naturally in the human body, the natural environment and the food we eat. #VaccinesWork

Vaccines protect us against harmful diseases like polio & measles, by: Using our body‚Äôs natural defenses to protect against infections Training our immune system to create antibodies This prevents us from getting sick. http://bit.ly/2Ya4NEZ #VaccinesWork

Immunization is a shared responsibility. If only some people are vaccinated, diseases can still spread, especially to those at highest risk: Infants who are too young to receive vaccines Older adults at risk of serious diseases People with low immunity #VaccinesWork

#COVID19 is confronting families globally with the deadly & devastating impacts of disease outbreaks. In the midst of this crisis, we must also work to ensure all people are protected against diseases for which we have vaccines to prevent. #VaccinesWork
Nurses & midwives - every check-up is an opportunity to check in on vaccination for people of all ages: children, youth, adults and older people. #VaccinesWork #SupportNursesAndMidwives
Vaccines: reduce child deaths and disease protect against outbreaks prevent malnutrition defend against antimicrobial resistance #VaccinesWork for all!

Vaccine-preventable diseases include: Cervical cancer Cholera Diphtheria Ebola Hep B Influenza Japanese encephalitis Measles Meningitis Mumps Pertussis Pneumonia Polio Rabies Rotavirus Rubella Tetanus Typhoid Varicella Yellow Fever Yes, #VaccinesWork!

For many, is more than a sport or hobby, it can allow you to: make a living commute socialize gain access to education support mental health & much more. Let's make sure everyone can enjoy riding their bike! #WorldBicycleDay

Lack of pedestrian crossings, sidewalks, & separate bike lanes, as well as excessive speed make cycling and walking risky. It is time to make walking & cycling safe by prioritizing #RoadSafety in urban planning. http://bit.ly/2JTuHq0 #WorldBicycleDay
The full remarks by @DrTedros

"WHO is committed to accelerating the development of effective therapeutics, vaccines and diagnostics as part of our commitment to serving the world with science, solutions and solidarity"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"The Data Safety and Monitoring Committee will continue to closely monitor the safety of all therapeutics being tested in the Solidarity Trial. So far, more than 3500 patients have been recruited in 35 countries"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"The Executive Group will communicate with the principal investigators in the trial about resuming the hydroxychloroquine arm of the trial"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"The Executive Group received this recommendation and endorsed continuation of all arms of the Solidarity Trial, including hydroxychloroquine"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"On the basis of the available mortality data, the members of the committee recommended that there are no reasons to modify the trial protocol"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"This decision was taken as a precaution while the safety data were reviewed. The Data Safety and Monitoring Committee of the Solidarity Trial has been reviewing the data"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"As you know, last week the Executive Group of the Solidarity Trial decided to implement a temporary pause of the hydroxychloroquine arm of the trial, because of concerns raised about the safety of the drug"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"In the past week, we launched #COVID19 courses in Amharic, Arabic, French, Hausa, Macedonian, Odia, Spanish and Vietnamese"-@DrTedros

"We have added two new courses: one on decontamination and sterilization of medical devices, and another on environmental cleaning and disinfection. In total, we now offer 12 courses in 27 languages"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"WHO continues to train millions of #healthworkers all over the world to apply our guidance. Our http://OpenWHO.org online learning platform has now registered 3 million enrolments for our courses on #COVID19"-@DrTedros

"It includes a #COVID19 care pathway, which describes the steps followed by a patient from screening to discharge, to ensure delivery of safe and quality care while stopping onward transmission"-@DrTedros
"... And updated guidelines on the clinical management of patients with #COVID19. This is an update of the guidance we published in March"-@DrTedros

"... Planning recommendations for mass gatherings; A protocol for surveillance of infections among health workers; Ethical considerations for the use of digital technologies in tracking #COVID19"-@DrTedros

"Just in the past week, WHO has released a new case report form for suspected cases of multisystem inflammatory syndrome in children; Operational guidance on maintaining essential health services; Guidance on controlling the spread of #COVID19 at ground crossings"-@DrTedros
"WHO continues to provide the world with new and updated technical guidance, based on the most up-to-date evidence"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"WHO continues to work through our regional and country offices to monitor the #COVID19 pandemic, to support countries to respond and to adapt our guidance for every situation"-@DrTedros
"Meanwhile, the number of #COVID19 cases in Europe continues to decline. Yesterday saw the fewest cases reported in Europe since the 22nd of March"-@DrTedros

"We are especially worried about Central and South America, where many countries are witnessing accelerating epidemics. We also see increasing numbers of cases in the Eastern Mediterranean, South-East Asia and Africa, although the numbers are much smaller"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"More than 100,000 cases of #COVID19 have been reported to WHO for each of the past 5 days. The Americas continues to account for the most cases. For several weeks, the number of cases reported each day in the Americas has been more than the rest of the put together"-@DrTedros
"This is an important reminder that even as WHO focuses on responding to the #COVID19 pandemic, we continue to monitor and respond to many other health emergencies"-@DrTedros #Ebola #DRC

"Today almost 50 responders from WHO and partners arrived in Mbandaka, #DRC, plus 3600 doses of #Ebola vaccine and 2000 cartridges for lab testing. The government is now sequencing the virus to see whether or not it is related to a previous outbreak"-@DrTedros

"The latest person confirmed with #Ebola attended the burial of one of the first cases, but was detected in the town of Bikoro, #DRC, 150 kilometers away from Mbandaka. This means that two health zones are now affected"-@DrTedros

"However, it is on the other side of the country to the #Ebola outbreak that WHO and partners have been fighting for almost 2 years in the provinces of North Kivu and Ituri, in eastern #DRC"-@DrTedros
"To be clear, this #Ebola outbreak is in the same area as a previous outbreak in #DRC in 2018, which was stopped in just 3 months"-@DrTedros

The full remarks by @DrTedros

The contribution and generosity towards global health over many decades has been immense, and it has made a great difference in public health all around the world. It is WHO‚Äôs wish for this collaboration to continue"-@DrTedros

"I will conclude by saying that we have received questions about Friday‚Äôs announcement by the @POTUS. The world has long benefited from the strong, collaborative engagement with the government and the people of the #UnitedStates "-@DrTedros

"In the recent Clinical Management of #COVID19, Interim Guidance, WHO has outlined the appropriate use of antibiotic therapy for medical professionals to treat patients. Therefore, both tackling #antimicrobialresistance, while also saving lives"-@DrTedros

"The #COVID19 pandemic has led to an increased use of antibiotics, which ultimately will lead to higher bacterial resistance rates that will impact the burden of disease and deaths during the pandemic and beyond"-@DrTedros #AntibioticResistance
"As well as finding new models to incentivize sustainable innovation, as seen with the #COVID19 solidarity trial, we must find ways to accelerate viable candidates"-@DrTedros #AntibioticResistance

"On the supply side, there is essentially very little market incentive to developing new antibiotics and antimicrobial agents, which has led to multiple market failures of very promising tools in the past few years"-@DrTedros #AntibioticResistance
"However, in many low- and middle-income countries these lifesaving medicines are out of reach for those that need them, leading to needless suffering and death"-@DrTedros #AntibioticResistance

"As we gather more evidence, it‚Äôs clear that the is losing its ability to use critically important antimicrobial medicines all over the world. On the demand side, in some countries there is an overuse of antibiotics & antimicrobial agents in both humans & animals"-@DrTedros
"But the data they provide reveals that a worrying number of bacterial infections are increasingly resistant to the medicines we have traditionally treated them with"-@DrTedros #AntibioticResistance
"I‚Äôm glad to say a record number of countries are now monitoring and reporting on #antibioticresistance - marking a major step forward in the global fight against drug resistance"-@DrTedros
"Just as we continue to respond to well-known health threats like tobacco, we‚Äôre also responding to one of the most urgent challenges of our time: the threat of #antimicrobialresistance"-@DrTedros

"Even during the global #COVID19 pandemic, where we know tobacco puts users at a higher risk of severe disease & death, the tobacco & nicotine industry persist with their dangerous marketing tactics that aim to attract new users"-@DrTedros #TobaccoExposed

"One of the main causes of noncommunicable diseases is tobacco. This year‚Äôs WHO‚Äôs #WorldNoTobaccoDay focused on reaching young people to educate them on tobacco industry tactics used to manipulate them into using deadly products that kill 8 million people every year"-@DrTedros

"Rehabilitation services have been disrupted in almost 2/3 of countries. The #COVID19 response must therefore be inclusive of the health-care needs of people living with noncommunicable diseases"-@DrTedros

"The results show that: -over half of the countries surveyed have partially or completely disrupted services for treatment of hypertension -half for treatment of diabetes & related complications -42% for cancer treatment -31% for cardiovascular emergencies"-@DrTedros
"WHO conducted a rapid assessment of service delivery for noncommunicable diseases during the #COVID19 pandemic with 155 countries submitting data"-@DrTedros

"We already know that people living with noncommunicable diseases are more vulnerable to becoming severely ill or dying from #COVID19. At the same time, many people living with NCDs are no longer able to access the medicines that they need"-@DrTedros

"One of the areas in which health services have been particularly affected is in care for people with noncommunicable diseases including diabetes, cancer, cardiovascular disease or a chronic respiratory disease"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"This means using digital technologies to deliver some routine services remotely, and expanding the amount of medications delivered to the home"-@DrTedros #COVID19 https://bit.ly/3dr9tuE

"Ensuring coordination and development of new ways to deliver care while limiting visits to health facilities is key to keeping people safe and ensuring health systems are not overburdened"-@DrTedros #COVID19 https://bit.ly/3dr9tuE

"Building on previous guidance on maintaining essential health services through the #COVID19 pandemic, today we are providing operational guidance on how best to put that into practice"-@DrTedros https://bit.ly/3dr9tuE

"We all know that the impacts of #COVID19 extend well beyond the death and disease caused by the virus itself. The pandemic has forced countries to make difficult choices about suspending some health services"-@DrTedros
"While we all want sporting events to restart, we want to make sure that it is done as safely as possible"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"WHO has updated its risks assessment tool so that organisations can score each risk factor & control measure, which results in an overall risk score. Ultimately WHO advises on the risk assessment & then organizations make the decision on how best to proceed"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"For example, WHO has worked closely with several sporting organizations including @FIFAcom, @ChampionsLeague, @F1 and religious groups including @OIC_OCI, which oversees the Hajj, as they conduct risk assessments around mass gatherings"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"To assist groups planning such gatherings, WHO released updated guidance to help organisations determine how and when mass gatherings can safely resume"-@DrTedros #COVID19 https://bit.ly/2Xob2nu

"Every week, WHO continues to provide the world with new and updated technical guidance, based on the best evidence. During the #COVID19 pandemic, we have seen that mass gatherings have the potential to act as super spreading events"-@DrTedros

"The announcement follows a complex #Ebola outbreak in eastern #DRC, which seems to be in its final phase. WHO will continue supporting DRC in tackling Ebola, as well as responding to #COVID19 and the world‚Äôs largest measles outbreak"-@DrTedros
"The Government of the #DRC announced today that a new outbreak of #Ebola virus disease has been detected near the city of Mbandaka in √âquateur province"-@DrTedros

"As we work with governments across the to suppress the virus and accelerate science around diagnostics, therapeutics and vaccines, we also continue to respond to other health emergencies and new disease outbreaks"-@DrTedros
"We now have more than 6 million cases of #COVID19 across the and have lost more than 370,000 people to the virus"-@DrTedros

The #COVID19 Technology Access Pool was first proposed in March by President @CarlosAlvQ of #CostaRica
The Medicines Patent Pool is a @UN-backed public health body that works to increase access to & facilitate the development of, life-saving medicines for low- and middle-income countries.
key elements to the #COVID19 Technology Access Pool initiative: Promotion of open innovation models & technology transfer that increase local manufacturing & supply capacity https://bit.ly/2XcQePN
key elements to the #COVID19 Technology Access Pool initiative: Licensing any potential treatment, diagnostic, vaccine or other health technology to the Medicines Patent Pool https://bit.ly/2XcQePN

key elements to the #COVID19 Technology Access Pool initiative: Governments & other funders are encouraged to incl. clauses in funding agreements with pharmaceutical companies & other innovators about equitable distribution, affordability & the publication of trial data
key elements to the #COVID19 Technology Access Pool initiative: Public disclosure of gene sequences & data Transparency around the publication of all clinical trial results https://bit.ly/2XcQePN

The #COVID19 Technology Access Pool will be voluntary and based on social solidarity. It will provide a one-stop shop for scientific knowledge, data and intellectual property to be shared equitably by the global community. https://bit.ly/2XcQePN

The #COVID19 Technology Access Pool aims to: Accelerate the discovery of vaccines, medicines & other technologies through open-science research Fast-track product development by mobilizing additional manufacturing capacity https://bit.ly/2XcQePN

30 countries & multiple international partners and institutions have signed up to support the #COVID19 Technology Access Pool in a bid to make vaccines, tests, treatments and other health technologies to fight COVID-19 accessible to all. https://bit.ly/2XcQePN
The full remarks by @DrTedros

"#COVID19 has highlighted the inequalities of our world. But it‚Äôs also offering us an opportunity to bridge those inequalities and build a fairer world ‚Äì a world in which health is not a privilege for the few, but a common good"-@DrTedros

"Tools to prevent, detect and treat #COVID19 are global public goods that must be accessible by all people. Science is giving us solutions, but to make those solutions work for everyone, we need solidarity"-@DrTedros

"C-TAP is voluntary, and builds on the success of the Medicines Patent Pool in expanding access to treatments for HIV and hepatitis C. WHO recognizes the important role that patents play in fuelling innovation. But this is a time when people must take priority"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Through C-TAP, we are inviting companies or governments that develop an effective therapeutic to contribute the patent to the Medicines Patent Pool, which would then sub-license the patent to generic manufacturers"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"C-TAP has priorities: promoting open innovation models and technology transfer that increase local manufacturing and supply capacity"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"C-TAP has priorities: encouraging govts & research funders to include clauses in contracts with pharmaceutical companies about equitable distribution & publication of trial data licensing treatments and vaccines to large and small producers"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"The Solidarity Response Fund will continue to receive donations to support WHO‚Äôs work on #COVID19, while the WHO Foundation will help to fund all elements of WHO‚Äôs work and be fully aligned with our priorities"-@DrTedros

"To further promote the Solidarity Response Fund, WHO has partnered with Illumination to launch a public service announcement today aimed at children featuring the beloved animated characters the @Minions & Gru, voiced by the actor @SteveCarell"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"These funds have been used to buy lab diagnostics, personal protective equipment, and to fund research and development, including for vaccines. The #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund is powerful proof of concept for the WHO Foundation"-@DrTedros

"In just two-and-a-half months, this fund has raised more than USD 214M from more than 400,000 individuals and companies, including 55 million dollars from the ‚ÄúOne World: #TogetherAtHome‚Äù virtual concert"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"The WHO Foundation was not ready to launch when the #COVID19 pandemic began, so with the support of the @unfoundation, the Swiss Philanthropy Foundation and several other partners, we launched the COVID-19 Solidarity Response Fund"-@DrTedros
"This is a historic step for WHO, as an integral part of our resource mobilization strategy to broaden the contributor base"-@DrTedros
"Since February 2018 we have been hard at work supporting the establishment of the WHO Foundation and today it gives us enormous pleasure to launch it officially"-@DrTedros

"But for WHO to fulfil its mission and mandate, there is a clear need to broaden our donor base, and to improve both the quantity and quality of funding we receive ‚Äì meaning more flexibility"-@DrTedros

"We have been working hard to encourage Member States to increase the proportion of flexible funds they give us & we‚Äôve very grateful for those countries that have given us greater flexibility in recent years"-@DrTedros
"In effect, that means WHO has little discretion over the way it spends its funds"-@DrTedros

"One of the greatest threats to WHO‚Äôs success is the fact that less than 20% of our budget comes in the form of flexible assessed contributions from Member States, while over 80% is voluntary contributions, which are usually tightly earmarked for specific programmes"-@DrTedros
"Until now, WHO has been one of the few international organizations which has not received donations from the general public. I immediately recognized the enormous potential in this idea"-@DrTedros

"At one of the first meetings, a staff member proposed the creation of a WHO Foundation. The idea was to establish a way to generate funding for WHO from sources we haven‚Äôt tapped before, including the general public"-@DrTedros

"These ideas became the basis of the transformation process we have been implementing over the past few years, and I would like to thank all staff who contributed their ideas that are now changing the face of WHO"-@DrTedros
"One of the ways I did that was by instituting ‚ÄúOpen Hour‚Äù, where any staff member can come to talk to me about any issue they want, every Thursday"-@DrTedros

"When I started as Director-General almost three years ago, one of the first things I did was to put out a call to all staff to contribute ideas for how to transform WHO and make it more effective"-@DrTedros

"As some countries start to re-open their societies & economies, the question we must answer is whether we will just return to the way things were, or whether we will learn the lessons the #COVID19 pandemic is teaching us about our relationship with our planet"-@DrTedros

The full remarks by @DrTedros
"WHO will provide further updates as we know more. And we will continue to work night and day for solutions, science and solidarity"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"The other arms of the trial are continuing. This concern relates to the use of hydroxychloroquine and chloraquine in #COVID19. I wish to reiterate that these drugs are accepted as generally safe for use in patients with autoimmune diseases or malaria"-@DrTedros
"The Executive Group has implemented a temporary pause of the hydroxychloroquine arm within the Solidarity Trial while the data is reviewed by the Data Safety Monitoring Board"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"The review will consider data collected so far in the Solidarity Trial and, in particular robust randomised available data, to adequately evaluate the potential benefits and harms from this drug"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"The Executive Group of the Solidarity Trial, representing 10 of the participating countries, met on Saturday and has agreed to review a comprehensive analysis and critical appraisal of all evidence available globally"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"The authors reported that among #COVID19 patients receiving the drug, when used alone or with a macrolide, they estimated a higher mortality rate"-@DrTedros
"On Friday, @TheLancet published an observational study on hydroxycholoroquine & chloraquine & its effects on #COVID19 patients that have been hospitalised"-@DrTedros
"Over 400 hospitals in 35 countries are actively recruiting patients & nearly 3500 patients have been enrolled from 17 countries"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"As part of our continued response to the pandemic globally, WHO continues to work aggressively on R&D. As you know, more than two months ago we initiated the Solidarity Trial, to evaluate the safety and efficacy of four drugs and drug combinations against #COVID19"-@DrTedros
"And disruption to essential health services, such as vaccination campaigns and care for malaria, HIV and other diseases pose a huge risk"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"However, we still see gaps and vulnerabilities. Only 19% of countries in the region have an infection prevention and control programme and standards for water, sanitation and hygiene in health facilities"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"WHO continues to support Africa with other life-saving supplies. As of last week, we've shipping millions of personal protective equipment & lab tests to 52 African countries. In the coming weeks we plan further shipments of PPE, oxygen concentrators & lab tests"-@DrTedros

"48 countries in the region have a community engagement plan in place, compared with only 25 countries 10 weeks ago. And 51 have lab testing capacity for #COVID19, compared with 40 countries 10 weeks ago"-@DrTedros

"With WHO support, many African countries have made good progress in preparedness. All countries in Africa now have a preparedness and response plan in place, compared with less than a dozen in the first few weeks of the #COVID19 pandemic"-@DrTedros

"For many years and from the outset of the #COVID19 pandemic, WHO has been working through our country offices to support nations in health emergency preparedness & developing comprehensive national action plans to prevent, detect & respond to the virus"-@DrTedros
"Furthermore, health clinicians, scientists, researchers and academics from across Africa are collectively contributing to the worldwide understanding of #COVID19 disease"-@DrTedros
"And beyond that they worked together with @AfricaCDC & WHO to extend training for laboratory technicians for detection of #COVID19 and to build up the national capacity across the region"-@DrTedros

"Africa‚Äôs knowledge & experience of suppressing infectious diseases has been critical to rapidly scaling up an agile response to #COVID19. There has been solidarity across the continent. Labs in & were some of the first in the to implement diagnostic testing"-@DrTedros
"Countries across Africa have garnered a great deal of experience from tackling infectious diseases like polio, measles, Ebola, yellow fever, influenza and many more"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"The early set-up of a leaders coalition led by the @_AfricanUnion, under the chairmanship of President @CyrilRamaphosa were key to rapidly accelerating #COVID19 preparedness efforts and issuing comprehensive control measures"-@DrTedros
"But even so, Africa appears to have so far been spared the scale of outbreaks we have seen in other regions"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Africa has just 1.5% of the world‚Äôs reported cases of #COVID19 & less than 0.1% of the world‚Äôs deaths. Of course, these numbers don‚Äôt paint the full picture. Testing capacity in Africa is still being ramped up & there is a likelihood that some cases may be missed"-@DrTedros

"So far, although around half of the countries in the @WHOAFRO region have community transmission, concentrated mainly in major cities, Africa is the least-affected region globally in terms of the number of #COVID19 cases and deaths reported to WHO"-@DrTedros
"Today, on #AfricaDay 2020, we mark the successes and progress made throughout the African continent This year, celebrations are more muted because of the #COVID19 pandemic"-@DrTedros

"Today is #AfricaDay ‚Äì an opportunity to celebrate Africa‚Äôs vitality & diversity & to promote African unity. Africa Day celebrates the birthday of the Organisation of African Unity, which was established on 25 May 1963 & its successor organization is the @_AfricanUnion"-@DrTedros

Some crises never made the headlines due to successful prevention efforts. #Cholera cases declined by 60% in 2018 thanks to the delivery of 18M vaccines. Mass vaccination against #yellowfever protected over 100M people in 2018‚Äì2019. 500M people were vaccinated for flu in 2019.

In November 2019, the Global Preparedness Monitoring Board published its first report, which warned that the was dangerously unprepared for a ‚Äúvery real threat of a rapidly moving, highly lethal pandemic of a respiratory pathogen‚Äù ‚Äì a risk that remains today. #COVID19

Following the #Ebola outbreak in #DRC, WHO coordinated a huge and complex operation, made more difficult by violence, a mobile population and a dearth of health facilities. Thousands of front-line responders braved considerable risks to defeat the virus.

Significant progress has been made in ramping up the capacity to #BeatNCDs within #primaryhealthcare, in particular those for hypertension, heart disease, childhood cancer and mental health. https://bit.ly/2yabnR1 #WHOImpact

Expanded coverage and access to quality healthcare have helped many countries -decrease maternal mortality -eliminate a neglected tropical disease -eliminate mother-to-child transmission of HIV and congenital syphilis. https://bit.ly/2yabnR1 #WHOImpact #HealthForAll

In 2019, WHO launched a pilot programme for the world‚Äôs first #malaria vaccine that may save many children‚Äôs lives in future; some 200 000 children have now been vaccinated in Ghana, Kenya and Malawi. WHO Results Report 2018-2019: https://bit.ly/2yabnR1 #WHOImpact

WHO supported the dramatic price reductions of antivirals, enabling more people to afford #hepatitis B & C medicines & more countries to strive for hepatitis C elimination. WHO Results Report 2018-2019: https://bit.ly/2yabnR1 #WHOImpact

Availability of accessible, affordable medicines is key to achieving #HealthForAll. WHO prequalified 213 products in 2018‚Äì2019, including: -biosimilar life-saving drug for #breastcancer -#Ebola vaccine -biosimilar insulin https://bit.ly/2yabnR1

Although access to health services has expanded, the is still far short of the 1B target & financial protection has weakened. SO WHO has created a special programme on primary health care to provide more broad-based support to countries. https://bit.ly/2yabnR1

The new guidance recommends countries make specific risk assessments based on: -local dynamics of #COVID19 transmission -health system capacities -public health benefit of conducting preventive & outbreak response vaccination campaigns https://bit.ly/3ghfEDp

In March 2020, WHO recommended temporary suspension of preventive campaigns while assessing risk & effective measures for reducing #COVID19 transmission. WHO has now issued guidance to help countries determine how/when to resume mass campaigns: https://bit.ly/3ghfEDp

Many countries have temporarily suspended preventive mass vaccination campaigns against diseases like cholera, measles, meningitis, polio, tetanus, typhoid & yellow fever, due to transmission risk & need to maintain physical distancing during early stages of #COVID19 pandemic.

Since March 2020, routine childhood immunization services have been disrupted on a global scale. Over 50% of the 129 countries, where data were available, reported moderate-to-severe disruptions, or a total suspension of vaccination services in Mar-Apr. https://bit.ly/3bOuOg8

According to data collected by WHO, @UNICEF, @gavi & @sabinvaccine, provision of routine immunization services is substantially hindered in at least 68 countries, likely to affect approximately 80M children under the age of 1. https://bit.ly/3bOuOg8

This stark warning precedes the Global Vaccine Summit on 4 Jun 2020, at which world leaders will come together to help maintain immunization programmes & mitigate the impact of #COVID19 in lower-income countries. https://bit.ly/3bOuOg8 #HealthForAll

WHO, @gavi & @UNICEF issue joint warning today that at least 80M children under 1 are at risk of diseases like diphtheria, measles & polio, as #COVID19 disrupts routine vaccination efforts. https://bit.ly/3bOuOg8 #HealthForAll

The donation follows the inclusion of #insulin in WHO‚Äôs prequalification programme, which accelerates & increases access to critical medical products that are quality-assured, affordable and adapted for low- & middle-income countries http://bit.ly/2QdOVNB #HealthForAll

To fight #diabetes, WHO works to: -ensure regular, affordable insulin supply -provide guidance on diagnosis, classification & management of type 2 diabetes -promote healthy diets & physical activity to lower people‚Äôs risk of developing type 2 diabetes http://bit.ly/2Kkqkmm
To meet the long-term needs of people with #diabetes, it will be vital to assure a sustainable supply of insulin, provided at prices that countries can afford. https://bit.ly/2A2j7Fe #BeatNCDs
Full remarks by @DrTedros
"WHO and @UNICEF have been working closely from the start of this outbreak to ensure essential supplies are reaching #healthworkers, patients and children across the world"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"In June, the Government will host the Global Vaccine Summit and we ask world leaders to commit to fully funding @gavi for its lifesaving work"-@DrTedros #VaccinesWork #HealthForAll

"The epidemic of misinformation has also harmed vaccination in recent years and we call on everyone to do more to prevent rumours and pseudo-science from undermining public health efforts that save millions of lives"-@DrTedros #VaccinesWork

"Any suspension of childhood vaccination services is a major threat to life. WHO is working with governments around the world to ensure supply chains remain open and lifesaving health services are reaching all communities"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #HealthForAll

"Initial analysis suggests the provision of routine immunization services is substantially hindered in at least 68 countries and is likely to affect approximately 80 million children under the age of 1 living in these countries"-@DrTedros #HealthForAll

"As the world comes together to develop a safe and effective vaccine for #COVID19, we must not forget the dozens of lifesaving vaccines that already exist and must continue to reach children everywhere"-@DrTedros

"This risks putting tens of millions of children ‚Äì in rich and poor countries ‚Äì at risk of killer diseases like diphtheria, measles and pneumonia"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #HealthForAll https://bit.ly/2XjNKhz

"However, we‚Äôre here today to collectively reinforce the warning that #COVID19 threatens to undermine life-saving immunization services around the world"-@DrTedros #HealthForAll https://bit.ly/2XjNKhz

"I am pleased to be joined by @UNICEF Executive Director @unicefchief Henrietta Fore & @GaviSeth Berkley, CEO of @gavi. Since the turn of the century, child mortality has been halved, in large part because of the power of safe & effective vaccination"-@DrTedros #VaccinesWork

"WHO, @UNICEF and @gavi, the Vaccine Alliance and other partners are working to ensure that the #COVID19 pandemic does not reverse decades of progress against vaccine preventable childhood diseases"-@DrTedros #HealthForAll

"One of the most essential services that has been disrupted is routine childhood immunisation. Today, WHO is publishing new guidance on implementing mass vaccination campaigns in the context of #COVID19"-@DrTedros #HealthForAll https://bit.ly/2XjNKhz

"Initiatives to secure the supply of essential #diabetes medicines are very welcome and reinforce the multiple ways that the private sector can get involved in fostering global solidarity"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #BeatNCDs

"People with #diabetes are vulnerable to developing severe disease from #COVID19 and struggle with the day-to-day problems of disrupted access to medication, equipment and health care"-@DrTedros #BeatNCDs
"This is the first donation in WHO‚Äôs history of a medicine for a noncommunicable disease, and comes at a critical point"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #BeatNCDs

"WHO has previously released guidance for maintaining these services during an outbreak. I would like to thank @novonordisk for its donation of insulin and glucagon, which will help to support treatment for people with diabetes in 50 low- and middle-income countries"-@DrTedros

"Maintaining people‚Äôs trust in the ability of health systems to provide essential services safely is crucial to ensure people continue to seek care when needed and follow public health advice"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #HealthForAll
"When health systems are overwhelmed, deaths from outbreaks and from preventable and treatable conditions increase dramatically"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #HealthForAll
"A key part of this week‚Äôs landmark #WHA73 resolution was that as well as fighting #COVID19, governments need to also ensure that essential health services are maintained"-@DrTedros

"The was already off-track for the ‚Äútriple billion‚Äù targets & the @GlobalGoalsUN & there is no question that the #COVID19 pandemic threatens to set us back even further. That makes our task even bigger & we must all redouble our efforts as a global community"-@DrTedros #EB147

"The #COVID19 pandemic has taught and reinforced many lessons: Health is not a cost; it‚Äôs an investment. To live in a secure world, guaranteeing quality #HealthForAll is not just the right choice; it‚Äôs the smart choice"-@DrTedros

"This was critical to the Republic of #Korea curtailing the first wave and now quickly identifying and containing new outbreaks. However, we‚Äôre very concerned about the rising numbers of cases in low- and middle-income countries"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We still have a long way to go in the #COVID19 pandemic. In the last 24h, there have been 106,000 cases reported to WHO ‚Äì the most in a single day since the outbreak began. Almost two thirds of these cases were reported in just four countries"-@DrTedros
"That roadmap has now given rise to the solidarity trials, which now include 3,000 patients in 320 hospitals across 17 countries and to the Access to #COVID19 Tools Accelerator"-@DrTedros
"I am glad we are making progress on the research and development agenda, which was mapped out in February at the R&D meeting convened by WHO"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"An important collaborative response to the #WHA73 resolution will be the #COVID19 technology platform proposed by , which we will launch on the 29th of May, which aims to lift access barriers to effective vaccines, medicines & other health products"-@DrTedros

"This includes critical points from the #WHA73 resolution: that collaboration to promote both private sector & govt-funded R&D should be encouraged. This includes open innovation across all relevant domains & the sharing of all relevant information with WHO"-@DrTedros
"This includes critical points from the #WHA73 resolution: that #COVID19 vaccines should be classified as a global public good for health in order to bring the pandemic to an end"-@DrTedros
"This includes critical points from the #WHA73 resolution: that relevant international treaties should be harnessed where needed, including the provisions of the TRIPS agreement"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"This includes critical points from the resolution: that there is a global priority to ensure the fair distribution of all quality essential health technologies required to tackle the #COVID19 pandemic"-@DrTedros

"The landmark #WHA73 resolution underlines WHO‚Äôs key role in promoting access to safe, effective health technologies to fight the #COVID19 pandemic. I welcome Member States‚Äô commitment to lift all barriers to universal access to vaccines, diagnostics and therapeutics"-@DrTedros
"If implemented [#WHA73 resolution], this would ensure a more coherent, coordinated and fairer #COVID19 response that saves both lives and livelihoods"-@DrTedros

"It [#WHA73 resolution] assigns responsibilities for both the WHO and its member states, and captures the comprehensive whole of government and whole of society approach we have been calling for since the beginning of the #COVID19 outbreak"-@DrTedros

"The #WHA73 resolution sets out a clear roadmap of the critical activities and actions that must be taken to sustain and accelerate the #COVID19 response at the national and international levels"-@DrTedros

The healthcare system of a nation determines that of an entire globe. This is where I see WHO taking a strong lead in redefining our efforts to global healthcare systems. - Prime Minister Lotay Tshering at #WHA73

In times like this #COVID19 pandemic, we are once again asked to reflect on the efforts and importance we have placed on public healthcare systems, mainly the universal healthcare system for all. - Prime Minister Lotay Tshering at #WHA73

For #Bhutan, we always believe that a nation can only grow on the strong foundation of a good healthcare system. For decades, our kings have always ensured free & quality healthcare for all the Bhutanese. - Prime Minister Lotay Tshering at #WHA73

We are living in extraordinary times. But as much as there are challenges, we are inspired by incredible stories of the kindness and bravery of health care workers across the globe. -#Bhutan Prime Minister Lotay Tshering at #WHA73

This #COVID19 pandemic has also put us at a crossroads where leaders have to determine which road to take ‚Äì the road to promote health, or the road to protect the economy. We have to do both. -#Paraguay President @MaritoAbdo at #WHA73

All of us are equal. The #coronavirus certainly thinks we are all equal. It also taught us that all of us can do something to help others to find a solution to the problems we now face. -#Paraguay President @MaritoAbdo at #WHA73

I would like to express my recognition, my gratitude, my admiration to the ordinary citizens of our countries, the emergencies services, the health workers and to all the unnamed people who helped others. -#Paraguay President @MaritoAbdo at #WHA73

"Dark & difficult days may lie ahead. But guided by science, together we will overcome. Let hope be the antidote to fear. Let solidarity be the antidote to division. Let our shared humanity be the antidote to our shared threat. Now, more than ever"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73
"For everything #COVID19 has taken from us, it has also given us something: A reminder of what really matters; And the opportunity to forge a common future"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"We may speak different languages, but we share the same DNA. We may adhere to different faiths, but we share the same aspirations for a peaceful and harmonious world; We may have different cultures and traditions, but we share the same planet"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73
"But #COVID19 has also reminded us that for all our differences, we are one human race, and we are stronger together"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"#COVID19 has robbed us of people we love; It‚Äôs robbed us of lives and livelihoods; It‚Äôs shaken the foundations of our world; It threatens to tear at the fabric of international cooperation"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"We‚Äôll continue supporting countries to build resilient health systems, based on primary health care, to progress towards our shared goal of universal health coverage"-@DrTedros #HealthForAll #WHA73

"We‚Äôll continue to work day and night to support the most vulnerable countries and populations; We‚Äôll continue supporting countries to achieve the ‚Äútriple billion‚Äù targets and the @GlobalGoalsUN"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"We‚Äôll continue working with countries & partners to ensure equitable access to the tools to prevent, detect & treat #COVID19; We‚Äôll continue supporting countries to prepare & respond; We‚Äôll continue working with countries to sustain essential health services"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"We‚Äôll continue bringing together leading experts from around the to develop technical advice, based on the best science; We‚Äôll continue driving research and development to develop evidence about vaccines, diagnostics and therapeutics"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73

"We‚Äôll continue to keep the informed and give people and communities the information they need to keep themselves and each other safe; We‚Äôll continue shipping diagnostics, personal protective equipment and other medical supplies all over the world"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73
"We will continue providing strategic leadership to coordinate the global #COVID19 response; We‚Äôll continue providing the with epidemiological information and analysis"-@DrTedros #WHA73
"WHO‚Äôs focus now is fighting the #COVID19 pandemic with every tool at our disposal. Our focus is on saving lives"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"I will initiate an evaluation at the earliest appropriate moment. We welcome any initiative to strengthen global health security & to strengthen WHO. WHO remains fully committed to transparency, accountability & continuous improvement"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"I thank Member States for adopting the #COVID19 resolution, which calls for an independent and comprehensive evaluation of the international response ‚Äì including, but not limited to, WHO‚Äôs performance"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"I offer my deep thanks to the many Member States who have expressed their support & solidarity you have demonstrated at #WHA73 & throughout the pandemic. I‚Äôve been impressed and inspired by the commitment of so many countries to fighting the virus and saving lives"-@DrTedros

Protecting health is a fundamental right for all & working together with all govts will make the difference. I call on WHO & all Member States to face this #COVID19 with a better sense of intl cooperation -#Colombia President @IvanDuque at #WHA73

I believe that WHO is called on to ensure that all of us make efforts so we don‚Äôt think as individuals but as a major collective: to develop a vaccine, find treatments, work aligned with science. -#Colombia President @IvanDuque at #WHA73

If we are sufficiently disciplined, work together sufficiently joined, we will be able to face this with success. That is what we tried to do in #Colombia. We have taken difficult, drastic decisions. This has helped us. - President @IvanDuque at #WHA73
We know that this #COVID19 pandemic brings serious social-economic effects because to face up to its exponential growth, we had to take draconian measures. -#Colombia President @IvanDuque at #WHA73

#Barbados investment in & preparedness of public health officials over the decades has permitted us to do the type of public health surveillance to detect cases, trace & quarantine contacts, isolate & treat the ill. - PM, @miaamormottley #WHA73

Health is such a precious commodity. Healthy people can learn, work & support themselves & their families. When people are sick, they struggle & families & communities fall behind. WHO is committed to achieving better health for everyone, everywhere #WHA73

We must, first of all, combat this #COVID19 pandemic. We need to put in place a solution that everyone can stand behind. I am convinced that we will be able to overcome this pandemic when we work together. -Chancellor of #Germany , Angela Merkel at #WHA63

WHO is the legitimate world organization for the area of health, so we should continue to work to improve procedures within the WHO. We also need to also look at the financing to ensure it is sustainable. -Chancellor of #Germany , Angela Merkel at #WHA63

In the face of crisis human kind must choose solidarity & cooperation over the pursue of individual interest. The world must unite under the banner of mutual trust & inclusiveness in the face of deepening #COVID19 crisis. - @moonriver365 at #WHA73

My utmost respect and gratitude go to the medical and quarantine professionals in each country putting themselves at risk to protect the health and safety of humanity. -Republic of #Korea President @moonriver365 at #WHA73

Only if we join forces will we beat this #COVID19 pandemic. We need WHO for its irreplaceable coordinating role, scientific expertise, knowledge of the situation on the ground. We need a strong WHO & the WHO is us: Member States. - @EmmanuelMacron #WHA73

Together with WHO, we achieved life expectancy, reduced child mortality, eradicated fatal diseases e.g. smallpox, waging against TB, malaria & HIV, access to medical treatment, vaccination, strengthen health systems - @EmmanuelMacron #WHA73

The #COVID19 pandemic has of course turned our lives & our societies upside down. It‚Äôs reminded us - if we needed such a reminder, of how valuable human health is, and how valuable those who work to protect it are. - President @EmmanuelMacron #WHA73

This is one of the most important assemblies in the history of the WHO. It must be a moment for unity, solidarity, clear thought & action in the face of what is an unprecedented global crisis affecting all of us -#France President @EmmanuelMacron #WHA73

I saw the courage & determination of WHO personnel working to end the #Ebola outbreak in #DRC. It is largely thanks to their efforts in very difficult & dangerous conditions that new infections have been contained & we are counting down to end the outbreak -@UN @antonioguterres

The WHO is irreplaceable - it needs immense resources particularly to provide support to developing countries which must be our greatest concern. We are strong as the weakest health systems. -@UN Secretary-General @antonioguterres at #WHA73

The entire @UN family stands with the thousands of our WHO colleagues, who are working around the world to support Member States in saving the lives and protecting the vulnerable. We thank you for your service. -@UN Secretary-General @antonioguterres at #WHA73

From nurses, doctors & midwives to technicians & administrators, millions of healthcare workers are putting themselves in harm's way every day to protect us. We owe them our deepest appreciation and solidarity. - @UN Secretary-General @antonioguterres at #WHA73
