The full opening remarks by @DrTedros at the virtual #WHA73
Here are few photos of @DrTedros delivering opening remarks at the virtual #WHA73

"Now more than ever, we need a healthier world. Now more than ever, we need a safer world. Now more than ever, we need a fairer world. And now more than ever, we need a stronger WHO. There is no other way forward but together"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"The #COVID19 pandemic is asking us two fundamental questions: What sort of world do we want? And what sort of WHO do we want? The answer to the first question will determine the answer to the second"-@DrTedros #WHA73
"The #COVID19 pandemic has tested, strengthened and strained the bonds of fellowship between nations. But it has not broken them"-@DrTedros #WHA73
The #COVID19 pandemic is posing a similar threat ‚Äì not just to human health, but to the human spirit. We have a long road ahead in our struggle against this virus"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"40 years ago, the nations of the world came together under the banner of WHO to rid the world of #smallpox. They showed that when solidarity triumphs over ideology, anything is possible"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"More than ever, #COVID19 illustrates why investing in health must be at the centre of development. Health is not a reward for development; it‚Äôs a prerequisite. Health is not a cost; it‚Äôs an investment. Health is a pathway to security, prosperity and peace"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"#COVID19 is not just a global health emergency, it‚Äôs a vivid demonstration of the fact that there is no health security without resilient health systems, or without addressing the social, economic, commercial and environmental determinants of health"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"However, much work remains to be done. Even before #COVID19, the world was off track for the @GlobalGoalsUN. The pandemic threatens to set us back even further. It exploits and exacerbates existing gaps in gender equality, poverty, hunger and more"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"In the coming year, we will launch the WHO Academy to provide training for millions more #healthworkers around the . The WHO Foundation will be launched, to broaden WHO's donor base. I am proud of the #WHOImpact made in these & many other areas"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"We‚Äôve expanded access to prevention, testing and treatment for HIV, tuberculosis, malaria, hepatitis C, hypertension, diabetes, cancer and more. To keep the safe, WHO has investigated, when necessary, & responded to more than 900 events in 141 countries"-@DrTedros #WHOImpact
"On universal health coverage, the world came together last year to endorse the political declaration on UHC ‚Äì an unprecedented commitment to the ideal of #HealthForAll"-@DrTedros #WHOImpact #WHA73

"On healthy populations, we‚Äôve made important progress to improve the air people breathe, the food they eat, the water they drink, the roads they use, and the conditions in which they live and work"-@DrTedros #WHOImpact #WHA73
"The WHO Results Report, launched today, provides a comprehensive picture of what WHO, its Member States and partners have achieved in the past two years"-@DrTedros #WHOImpact #WHA73

"At its heart are the ambitious ‚Äútriple billion‚Äù targets: 1 billion more people enjoying better health and well-being. 1 billion more people benefiting from universal health coverage; And 1 billion more people better protected from health emergencies"-@DrTedros #HealthForAll

"Since my election at this assembly three years ago, I have made a priority of transforming WHO into an organization that is agile and responsive, focused on outcomes and impact"-@DrTedros #WHA73 #HealthForAll

"To be successful, we must all commit to mutual ownership & accountability. One way to do that, proposed by the Africa Group, is through a system of universal periodic review, in which countries agree to a regular & transparent review of each nation‚Äôs preparedness"-@DrTedros

"I am calling on all nations to invest in strengthening and implementing the many tools at our disposal ‚Äì especially the global treaty that underpins global health security: the International Health Regulations"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73
"Today I am calling on all nations to resolve that they will do everything it takes to ensure that the 2020 #COVID19 pandemic is never repeated"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"The does not lack the tools, the science, or the resources to make it safer from pandemics. What it has lacked is the sustained commitment to use the tools, the science and the resources it has. That must change, and it must change today"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73
"The time has come to weave together the disparate strands of global health security into an unbreakable chain ‚Äì a comprehensive framework for epidemic & pandemic preparedness"-@DrTedros #WHA73
"The can no longer afford the short-term amnesia that has characterised its response to health security for too long"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"The world doesn‚Äôt need another plan, another system, another mechanism, another committee or another organization. It needs to strengthen, implement and finance the systems and organizations it has ‚Äì including WHO"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"And the #Ebola outbreak of 2014 and 15 led to the establishment of the Pandemic Emergency Financing Facility, the WHO Emergencies Programme and the Independent Oversight Advisory Committee"-@DrTedros #WHA73
"The SARS outbreak gave rise to the revision of the International Health Regulations, in 2005; The H1N1 pandemic saw the creation of the Pandemic Influenza Preparedness Framework"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"Reviews after SARS, the H1N1 pandemic & the West African Ebola epidemic highlighted shortcomings in global health security & made numerous recommendations for countries to address those gaps. Some were implemented; others went unheeded"-@DrTedros #WHA73
"If there is anything positive to come from the #COVID19 pandemic, it must be a safer and more resilient world"-@DrTedros #WHA73
"Whatever lessons there are to learn from the #COVID19 pandemic, the greatest failing would be to not learn from them & to leave the in the same vulnerable state it was before"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"One thing is abundantly clear. The must never be the same. We do not need a review to tell us that we must all do everything in our power to ensure this never happens again"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73

"I will initiate an independent evaluation at the earliest appropriate moment to review experience gained & lessons learned & to make recommendations to improve national & global pandemic preparedness and response"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"We welcome the proposed resolution before #WHA73, which calls for a step-wise process of impartial, independent & comprehensive evaluation. To be truly comprehensive, such an evaluation must encompass the entirety of the response by all actors, in good faith"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"In fact, the existing independent accountability mechanisms are already in operation. The Independent Oversight Advisory Committee has today published its 1st report on the #COVID19 pandemic, with several recommendations for both the Secretariat & Member States"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"We all have lessons to learn from the #COVID19 pandemic. Every country and every organization must examine its response and learn from its experience. WHO is committed to transparency, accountability and continuous improvement"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"We‚Äôve: -informed, engaged & empowered people -fought the infodemic, combating myths with reliable information -called consistently for the two essential ingredients for conquering #COVID19: national unity & global solidarity"-@DrTedros #WHA73
"We've: driven research and development, through the Solidarity Trial -called for equitable access to vaccines, diagnostics and therapeutics through the ACT Accelerator"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73
"We've -shipped diagnostics, personal protective equipment, oxygen & other medical supplies to 120+ countries -trained more than 2.6 million #healthworkers, in 23 languages"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73
"We‚Äôve: -provided technical guidance & strategic advice, based on the latest science & experience. -supported countries to adapt & implement that guidance"@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73

"We notified countries, issued guidance for #healthworkers within 10 days & declared a global health emergency, our highest level of alert, on the 30th of Jan. At the time, there were less than 100 cases & no deaths outside "-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73
"Since day one, WHO has stood shoulder-to-shoulder with countries in these darkest of hours. WHO sounded the alarm early, and we sounded it often"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73
"It takes hard work, fidelity to science, learning and adapting as you go, and difficult decisions"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73

"The countries that have done well have done it all. This is the comprehensive approach that WHO has called for consistently. There is no silver bullet. There is no simple solution. There is no panacea. There is no one-size-fits-all approach"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73

"We've learned an enormous amount about how to prevent infections & save lives. There is no single action that has made the difference. Not testing alone. Not contact tracing alone. Not isolation, quarantine, hand hygiene or physical distancing alone"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73

"Early serology studies are painting a consistent picture: the proportion of the population with tell-tale antibodies is no more than 20% & in most places less than 10% In other words: the majority of the ‚Äôs population remains susceptible to the virus"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73

"Some are now assessing how to ease the restrictions that have exacted such a heavy social & economic toll. Moving too fast, without putting in place the public health architecture to detect & suppress transmission, runs a real risk of handicapping their own recovery"-@DrTedros

"Some countries: -are succeeding in preventing widespread community transmission -have issued #StayHome orders & imposed severe social restrictions to suppress community transmission -are still bracing for the worst"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73

"Low-income countries, small island developing states and those suffering from violence and conflict are trying to confront this threat in the most challenging of circumstances"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73
"In less than 5 months, the #COVID19 pandemic has encircled the globe. All countries have faced challenges in coming to grips with this virus, rich and poor, large and small"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"6 months ago, it would've been inconceivable to most that: -the ‚Äôs biggest cities would fall eerily quiet -shops, restaurants, schools & workplaces would be closed -global travel would grind to a standstill -simply shaking hands could be life-threatening"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"For all the economic, military and technological might of nations, we have been humbled by this very small microbe. If #COVID19 is teaching us anything, it‚Äôs humility"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"Any efforts to make our safer are doomed to fail unless they address the critical interface between people & pathogens & the existential threat of #climatechange that is making our earth less habitable"-@DrTedros #WHA73 #COVID19
"The #COVID19 pandemic is a reminder of the intimate & delicate relationship between people and planet"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"#COVID19 has highlighted our strengths and our vulnerabilities. Science has been hailed and scorned. Nations have come together as never before and geopolitical divisions have been thrown into sharp relief"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"The #COVID19 pandemic has brought out the best ‚Äì and worst ‚Äì of humanity: Fortitude and fear; solidarity and suspicion; rapport and recrimination. This contagion exposes the fault lines, inequalities, injustices and contradictions of our modern world"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"Lives and livelihoods have been lost or upended. Hundreds of millions of people have lost their jobs. Fear and uncertainty abound. The global economy is headed for its sharpest contraction since the Great Depression"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73
"The health impacts of the #COVID19 pandemic extend far beyond the sickness & death caused by the virus itself. And yet this is so much more than a health crisis"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"More than 4-and-a-half million cases of #COVID19 have now been reported to WHO & more than 300,000 people have lost their lives. But numbers don‚Äôt even begin to tell the story of the pandemic. Each loss of life leaves a scar for families, communities & nations"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"#COVID19 can operate in the dark, spread silently if we‚Äôre not paying attention, then suddenly explode if we aren‚Äôt ready. We‚Äôve seen the same pattern repeated in cities & countries the over"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"The has confronted several pandemics before. This is the first caused by a coronavirus. This a dangerous enemy, with a dangerous combination of features: efficient, fast and fatal"-@DrTedros #WHA73 #COVID19

"We've come together as the nations of the to confront the defining health crisis of our time. We come in grief for those we've lost with concern for those fighting for their lives with determination to triumph over the common threat with hope for the future"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"Nurses & midwives have been on the frontlines of the fight against #COVID19, putting themselves in harm‚Äôs way. Many have made the ultimate sacrifice in service of humanity. Please join me, wherever you are, in standing to show your appreciation for these health heroes"-@DrTedros

The full remarks on #COVID19 by @DrTedros
"I call on clinicians worldwide to work with your national authorities and WHO to be on the alert and better understand this syndrome in children"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"Together with our global clinical network for #COVID19, WHO has developed a preliminary case definition and a case report form for Multisystem Inflammatory Syndrome in Children"-@DrTedros

"Initial reports hypothesise that this syndrome may be related to #COVID19. It is critical to urgently and carefully characterise this clinical syndrome, to understand causality and to describe treatment interventions"-@DrTedros

"In the past weeks, reports from Europe & North America have described a small number of children being admitted to intensive care units with a multisystem inflammatory condition with some features similar to Kawasaki‚Äôs disease and toxic shock syndrome"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"This evening, WHO will release a Scientific Brief on Multisystem Inflammatory Syndrome in Children"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"To maximise effectiveness and ensure that no one is left behind, tackling the pandemic requires a gender-responsive, equity-oriented and human rights-based approach"-@DrTedros #COVID19 https://bit.ly/2z3xFEq

" encourage availability & access to sexual & reproductive health services protect & support all #healthworkers, approx. 70% of the whom are women ensure equitable access to testing & treatment for #COVID19 ensure responses are inclusive & non-discriminatory"-@DrTedros

"It includes key asks for governments: when recording cases, collect both age & sex-disaggregated data prevent & respond effectively to issues of domestic violence, which have been exacerbated by the #COVID19 pandemic"-@DrTedros https://bit.ly/2z3xFEq
"Yesterday, WHO released a policy brief on gender and #COVID19, which encourages countries to incorporate a gender focus into their responses"-@DrTedros https://bit.ly/2z3xFEq

"Funding quality #HealthForAll, doesn‚Äôt just save lives; it means children are healthy and can go to school; people can go to work to earn a living and societies and economies are both stronger and more sustainable"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73

"The #COVID19 pandemic has shown again & in the strongest way possible, that investing in health is not just the right thing to do; it‚Äôs the smart thing to do. There‚Äôs no trade off between investing in health & economy. Health is an investment in our collective future"-@DrTedros

"Over the past few months, across the world, we have shown that when countries implement a comprehensive strategy they can effectively contain and suppress the spread of the #coronavirus, while minimizing the impact on lives and livelihoods"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73
"I am looking forward to greeting and working with leaders from across the to ensure that together we optimise the #COVID19 response and build back stronger health systems"-@DrTedros #WHA73
"Next week, one of the most important World Health Assembly's will take place since we were founded in 1948"-@DrTedros #WHA73 #COVID19
"Global solidarity will accelerate science and expand access so that together we can overcome the #coronavirus. Until everyone is protected, the will remains at risk"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"WHO has accepted this visionary proposal and will, in the next few weeks, launch a platform for open, collaborative sharing of knowledge, data and intellectual property on existing and new health tools to combat #COVID19"-@DrTedros

"At the beginning of the pandemic, President @CarlosAlvQ asked me to set up a health technology repository for vaccines, medicines, diagnostics and any other tool that may work against #COVID19"-@DrTedros

"WHO recognizes the wide-ranging efforts and initiatives aimed at incentivizing innovation while also ensuring access for all. These will be important topics next week at the #WHA73"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We're seeing some good examples where companies are coming out with solidarity approaches from open licensing & support, to tech transfer via the new Tech Access Partnership, to commitments not to increase prices in times of shortages"-@DrTedros #COVID19 https://www.un.org/technologybank/content/launch_tech_access_partnership

"Now is the moment where leaders must come together to develop a new global access policy and an operational tool, which will turn the many good intentions expressed in recent weeks into reality"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Traditional market models will not deliver at the scale needed to cover the entire globe. Solidarity within and between countries and the private sector is essential if we are to overcome these difficult times"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"In these extraordinary circumstances, we need to unleash the full power of science, to deliver innovations that are scalable, usable, and benefit everyone, everywhere, at the same time"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"These tools provide additional hope of overcoming #COVID19, but they will not end the pandemic if we cannot ensure equitable access to them"-@DrTedros
"The Access to #COVID19 Accelerator is uniting efforts on many fronts to ensure we have safe, effective and affordable therapeutics and vaccines in the shortest time possible"-@DrTedros
"Researchers are working at breakneck speed both to understand the virus and also to develop potential vaccines, medicines and other technologies"-@DrTedros #COVID19
I am honoured to be joined by President @CarlosAlvQ of #CostaRica and President @sebastianpinera of #Chile for today‚Äôs press briefing"-@DrTedros #COVID19

The full briefing by @DrTedros
"Learning together is key to building national unity and global solidarity so that together we accelerate progress faster and build a better world for us all to live in"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Everyday we learn more & more about #COVID19 & new apps & courses for #healthworkers and the general public allow us to disseminate information quickly and effectively. Sharing experience & best practices is critical for strengthening our response to the pandemic"-@DrTedros

"It now has more than 2.5 million enrolments and hosts free trainings on 10 different topics across 22 languages to support the coronavirus response, including our first course in Swahili this week"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"In response to #COVID19, WHO has utilized our http://OpenWHO.org platform and translated guidance into training, including 68 online courses to improve the response to health emergencies"-@DrTedros

"The #WHOAcademy app provides #healthworkers with mobile access to a wealth of #COVID19 resources, developed by WHO, that include up-to-the-minute guidance, tools, training, and virtual workshops that will help them care for COVID-19 patients and protect themselves"-@DrTedros
"With these new mobile apps, the WHO is putting the power of learning and knowledge-sharing directly into the hands of #healthworkers and people everywhere"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Furthermore, today the WHO announced the launch of the #WHOAcademy app designed to support #healthworkers, and the WHO Info app designed to inform the general public during #COVID19. The apps are available in all @UN languages"-@DrTedros https://bit.ly/2Ti4Knl

"We urge political leaders to ensure that #COVID19 preparedness and responses in closed settings are identified and implemented in line with fundamental human rights and are guided by WHO guidance and recommendations to protect human health"-@DrTedros
"Overcrowding in prisons undermines hygiene, health, safety and human dignity, a health response to #COVID19 in closed settings alone is insufficient"-@DrTedros

"Along with WHO‚Äôs own guidance on prisons, I urge political leaders to enhance all prevention and control measures in respect to vulnerable populations in places of detention"-@DrTedros #COVID19 https://bit.ly/2Lpk5xV

"Today, I joined leaders from global health, human rights & development institutions to draw the attention of political leaders to the heightened vulnerability of prisoners during the #COVID19 pandemic"-@DrTedros https://bit.ly/2Lpk5xV

"Health systems and health security are two sides of the same coin. If we don‚Äôt invest in both, we will face not just health consequences but the social, economic and political fallout that we‚Äôre already experiencing in the #COVID19 pandemic"-@DrTedros

"#COVID19 has made it crystal clear that we are one that has more in common with each other than we‚Äôd ever dare to believe. The best defense against outbreaks & other health threats is preparedness, investing in building strong health systems & #PrimaryHealthCare"-@DrTedros

"We have a once in a lifetime opportunity to prove that the is more than just a collection of individual countries with colourful flags. We are one that has more in common with each other than we‚Äôd ever dare to believe"-@DrTedros
"During #WHA73 next week we will discuss with health leaders from across the world not only how to defeat #COVID19 but also how we can build back stronger heath systems everywhere"-@DrTedros

"While #COVID19 is an unprecedented shock to the ; through national unity & global solidarity, we can save both lives & livelihoods & ensure that other health services for neglected diseases, child vaccination, HIV, TB & malaria continue to both function & improve"-@DrTedros

"The answer is that the has not done enough to deliver on the promise of #HealthForAll. The #COVID19 pandemic is causing significant loss of life, disrupting livelihoods, and threatening to undo much of the progress we‚Äôve made"-@DrTedros

"How is that in 2020: -over 55% of countries have fewer than 40 nursing & midwifery personnel per 10,000 people? -because of a failure to invest in preparedness, we now risk backsliding on childhood immunization, malaria, neglected tropical diseases & HIV?"-@DrTedros

"The new statistics shine a light on one of the key drivers of the #COVID19 pandemic: inequality. How is it that in 2020, approximately 1 billion people are spending at least 10% of their household budgets on health care?"-@DrTedros #WorldHealthData
"However, the report reflects that the rate of progress is too slow to meet @GlobalGoalsUN and will be further thrown off track by #COVID19"-@DrTedros #WorldHealthData

"Furthermore, lower-income countries dramatically scaled up access to services to prevent and treat HIV, malaria and tuberculosis, as well as a number of neglected tropical diseases such as guinea worm"-@DrTedros #WorldHealthData
"Better maternal and child healthcare has led to a halving of child mortality since the year 2000. An extraordinary achievement for the "-@DrTedros #WorldHealthData http://bit.ly/2T0JH8i
"The biggest gains were reported in low-income countries, which saw life expectancy rise by more than a fifth since the turn of the Millennium"-@DrTedros #WorldHealthData
"Today, the 2020 World Health Statistics were published by WHO. There is good news that overall people around the world are living both longer and healthier lives"-@DrTedros #WorldHealthData

"In the time of a global #COVID19 pandemic, I urge all stakeholders to put aside politics and prioritize peace, a global ceasefire and ending this pandemic together. Everyday without a ceasefire, more people are dying unnecessarily"-@DrTedros

"Civilians & #healthworkers should never be a target & as my colleague & friend @DrMikeRyan said last week, the weaponisation of health is not helping anywhere. We need health & peace. We need peace for health & health for peace. We need it now!"-@DrTedros

"Yesterday was #InternationalNursesDay and a moment to celebrate those critical frontline health workers saving the lives of people with #COVID19, #Ebola and many other diseases"-@DrTedros

To ensure the continuity of HIV prevention & treatment services during #COVID19, countries should: Prioritize shoring up supply chains Adopt policies such as multi-month dispensing of antiretroviral therapy More in WHO & @UNAIDS joint statement: http://bit.ly/2SVBsdJ

Health service disruptions during #COVID19 could see new child #HIV infections rise by as much as 37% in Mozambique 78% in Malawi 78% in Zimbabwe 104% in Uganda Together, we can prevent this http://bit.ly/2SVBsdJ

Some potential impacts of #HIV health service disruptions could cause: Sporadic interruptions of antiretroviral therapy supply less adherence to treatment spread of HIV drug resistance More could happen if countries don't act now http://bit.ly/2SVBsdJ

Over 25M people living with #HIV in sub-Saharan Africa are now at risk having their treatment interrupted due to overwhelming needs to support #COVID19 response. WHO & @UNAIDS suggest ways to mitigate this http://bit.ly/2SVBsdJ
During #COVID19 pandemic, the must ensure that global supplies of #HIV tests & treatments continue to flow to the countries that need them. This is what would happen otherwise

Health service & supply disruptions during #COVID19 could cause half a million extra deaths from #HIV in sub-Saharan Africa. Countries, communities & partners need to take action now More in WHO & @UNAIDS joint statement: http://bit.ly/2SVBsdJ

Tobacco smoking is a known risk factor for many respiratory infections & the severity of respiratory diseases, including #COVID19. Smokers should take immediate steps to quit by using: toll-free quit lines mobile text-messaging programmes nicotine replacement therapies

There is currently insufficient information to confirm any link between tobacco or nicotine in the prevention or treatment of #COVID19. Researchers, scientists & the media are urged to be cautious about amplifying such unproven claims. https://bit.ly/3dEpz41

Smoking impairs lung function making it harder to fight off coronaviruses & other diseases. Tobacco is also a major risk factor for cardiovascular disease, cancer, respiratory disease & diabetes and other NCDs which put people at higher risk for developing severe #COVID19 illness
A review of studies by public health experts convened by WHO on 29 April 2020 found that smokers are more likely than non-smokers to develop severe disease with #COVID19. https://bit.ly/3dEpz41
The full briefing on #COVID19 by @DrTedros
"Only together can we get through the #COVID19 pandemic. In national unity and global solidarity"-@DrTedros

"This new partnership is another great example of solidarity that builds on the solidarity flights, solidarity trials and Access to #COVID19 Tools Accelerator, which all aim to ensure the latest health innovations are reaching those communities that need them most"-@DrTedros

"#COVID19 has exposed the uneven distribution of life-saving medical equipment across the world. Tomorrow, the Tech Access Partnership will be launched to increase local production of essential health technologies ‚Äì like masks and ventilators - in developing countries"-@DrTedros
"Even relatively short-term interruptions to treatment pose a significant threat to a person‚Äôs health and potential to transmit #HIV"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Despite attention being focused on the #COVID19 pandemic, we must still ensure that global supplies of tests and treatments for both #HIV and #tuberculosis reach the countries and communities that need them most"-@DrTedros https://bit.ly/2SVBsdJ

"This could effectively set the back by more than decade to 2008, when 950K+ #AIDS deaths were observed in the region. This is an avoidable worst-case scenario & not a prediction. The model acts as a wake-up call to identify ways to sustain all vital health services"-@DrTedros

"The group‚Äôs worst case scenario, a 6-month disruption of antiretroviral therapy, suggests that there could be 500,000 extra deaths from #AIDS-related illnesses, including from #tuberculosis, in sub-Saharan Africa over the next year"-@DrTedros #COVID19 https://bit.ly/2SVBsdJ

"Today saw the release of new modeling on #HIV by the WHO and @UNAIDS. It highlights the importance of taking immediate steps to minimise interruptions in health services and supplies of antiretroviral drugs during the COVID-19 pandemic"-@DrTedros https://bit.ly/2SVBsdJ

"Workplaces should develop action plans for prevention & mitigation of #COVID19 as part of their overall business plan. The plan should also include measures for protecting health, safety & security in re-opening, closing & modifying workplaces"-@DrTedros

"WHO issued detailed new workplace guidelines, which recommend all places of work carry out a risk assessment for workers potential exposure to #COVID19. This includes the implementation of measures to prevent the spread of the virus"-@DrTedros https://bit.ly/2SWRS5H
"Last week, I also spoke to the @ilo and the @ioevoice about the reopening of work places and how to do this safely"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"When reflecting on the decision to reopen schools, the local government should assess the capacity of the schools to maintain infection, prevention and control measures"-@DrTedros #COVID19
" the epidemiology of #COVID19 where the school is geographically located needs to be considered the ability to maintain COVID-19 prevention and control measures within the school setting"-@DrTedros

"On children going back to school, decision makers should reflect on a number of key factors when deciding on whether and how to reopen schools: a clear understanding about current #COVID19 transmission and severity of the virus in children is needed"-@DrTedros
"In this vein, new guidance was released over the weekend regarding both school and work places reopening"-@DrTedros #COVID19 https://bit.ly/2YQO0XK https://bit.ly/2SWRS5H

"WHO is working closely with governments to ensure that key public health measures remain in place to deal with the challenge of lifting lockdowns. Until there is a vaccine, the comprehensive package of measures is our most effective set of tools to tackle #COVID19"-@DrTedros
"Early serological studies reflect that a relatively low percentage of the population has antibodies to #COVID19, which means most of the population is still susceptible to the virus"-@DrTedros

"In Wuhan, the 1st cluster of #COVID19 cases since their lockdown was lifted was identified. has also reported an increase in cases since an easing of restrictions. Fortunately all 3 countries have systems in place to detect and respond to a resurgence in cases"-@DrTedros

"However, even with three positive answers, releasing lockdowns is both complex and difficult. Over the weekend we saw signs of the challenges that may lie ahead. In , bars and clubs were shut as a confirmed #COVID19 case led to many contacts being traced"-@DrTedros

"... Is the public health surveillance system able to detect and manage the cases and their contacts, and identify a resurgence of #COVID19 cases? These three questions can help determine whether a lockdown can be released slowly or not"-@DrTedros

"Further guidance was published that outlines the key questions countries should ask prior to the lifting of lockdowns: Is the epidemic under control? Is the health system able to cope with a resurgence of cases that may arise after relaxing certain measures?"-@DrTedros
"I‚Äôve previously outlined the six criteria countries need to consider before lifting #StayHome orders and other restrictions"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Therefore, to protect lives and livelihoods, a slow, steady, lifting of lockdowns is key to both stimulating economies, while also keeping a vigilant eye on the virus so that control measures can be quickly implemented if an upswing in cases is identified"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"The good news is that there has been a great deal of success in slowing the virus & saving lives. Such strong measures have come at a cost & we recognize the serious socio-economic impact of the lockdowns, which have had a detrimental effect on many people‚Äôs lives"-@DrTedros

"Many have used the time to ramp up their ability to test, trace, isolate and care for patients, which is the best way to track the virus, slow the spread and take pressure off health systems"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"Countries put these stringent measures in place, sometimes called lockdowns, in response to intense transmission"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"There have now been more than four million cases of #COVID19 across the world. Over the past week several countries have started lifting #StayHome orders and other restrictions in a phased way"-@DrTedros

After #smallpox was eradicated, WHO and @UNICEF launched the Expanded Programme on Immunization, which has ensured 85% of the world‚Äôs children are vaccinated and protected from debilitating diseases. https://bit.ly/2SNzrR4 #VaccinesWork

The world got rid of #smallpox thanks to an incredible demonstration of global solidarity, and because it had a safe and effective vaccine. Solidarity plus science equalled solution! https://bit.ly/2SNzrR4
The world spent US$300m on eradicating #smallpox. That now saves the world well over US$1 billion every year. https://bit.ly/2SNzrR4

#Smallpox was ended, thanks to a 10-year global effort, spearheaded by the World Health Organization, that involved thousands of #healthworkers around the world who administered half a billion vaccinations to stamp out the disease. https://bit.ly/2SNzrR4

Commemorating #Smallpox Eradication ‚Äì a legacy of hope, for #COVID19 and other diseases https://bit.ly/2SNzrR4 On 8 May 1980, the 33rd World Health Assembly officially declared: ‚ÄòThe world and all its peoples have won freedom from smallpox.'
The full briefing by @DrTedros
"I especially want to thank my friend Mr Atul Khare, @UN Under-Secretary-General for Operational Support, for making this commemorative stamp possible"-@DrTedros #smallpox

"To commemorate the 40th Anniversary of #smallpox eradication, the @UN Postal Administration and WHO are releasing a commemorative postage stamp to recognize global solidarity in fighting smallpox"-@DrTedros
"When WHO‚Äôs #smallpox eradication campaign was launched in 1967, one of the ways countries raised awareness about smallpox was through postage stamps"-@DrTedros

"Like #smallpox, #COVID19 is giving us an opportunity not only to fight a single disease, but to change the trajectory of global health, and to build a healthier, safer, fairer world for everyone"-@DrTedros

"It gave us the confidence to pursue the eradication of other diseases like polio and guinea worm. Like smallpox, #COVID19 is a defining challenge for public health. Like #smallpox, it‚Äôs a test of global solidarity"-@DrTedros
The legacy of smallpox was not only the eradication of one disease; it was the demonstration that when the unites, anything is possible"-@DrTedros
"As we reflect today on the eradication of #smallpox, we‚Äôre reminded of what is possible when nations come together to confront a common foe"-@DrTedros
"In certain fragile settings and countries with weaker health systems, WHO will continue its operational work as a provider of essential health services"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"To support these objectives, WHO will continue to provide technical, operational and logistics support to countries, and we will continue to update and adapt our guidance according to local needs"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"It is built on five strategic objectives (2): to reduce mortality through appropriate care to develop safe & effective vaccines & therapeutics"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"It is built on five strategic objectives (1): to mobilize all sectors & communities to control sporadic cases & clusters by rapidly finding & isolating all cases to suppress community transmission through infection prevention & control & physical distancing"-@DrTedros
"Our updated strategic plan takes into account the lessons we have learned so far, strengthening WHO‚Äôs role in global and regional coordination"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"WHO is deeply grateful to the countries and donors who responded to WHO‚Äôs initial Strategic Preparedness & Response Plan, and to the hundreds of thousands of individuals, corporations and foundations who have contributed to the #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund"-@DrTedros

"This estimate includes the funds that WHO has already received to date, leaving WHO‚Äôs #COVID19 response with a funding gap of USD 1.3B for 2020. To be clear, this estimate only covers WHO‚Äôs needs, not the entire global need"-@DrTedros
"The updated plan estimates that WHO requires USD 1.7B to respond to #COVID19, across the three levels of the organization, between now and the end of 2020"-@DrTedros
"Yesterday, I announced the resources WHO estimates it needs to deliver our updated Strategic Preparedness and Response Plan for #COVID19"-@DrTedros

"The short-listed films can be seen on WHO‚Äôs @YouTube channel, and we invite everyone to join us on our social media channels next Tuesday, for the announcement of the winners"-@DrTedros #HealthForAll #Film4Health

"Next Tuesday, the 12th of May, WHO will announce the five winners of our inaugural #HealthForAll Film Festival. The winning films were chosen by a distinguished panel of jurors from almost 1,300 entries from 110 countries"-@DrTedros #Film4Health

"That same solidarity, built on national unity, is needed now more than ever to defeat #COVID19. Stories like the eradication of #smallpox have incredible power to inspire. But there are many more untold stories about health around the world"-@DrTedros

"The decisive factor in the victory over #smallpox was global solidarity. At the height of the Cold War, the Soviet Union and the United States of America joined forces to conquer a common enemy. They recognized that viruses do not respect nations or ideologies"-@DrTedros

"But although a vaccine was crucial for ending #smallpox, it was not enough on its own. After all, the vaccine was first developed by Edward Jenner in 1796. It took another 184 years for smallpox to be eradicated"-@DrTedros
"As you know, WHO is now working with many partners to accelerate the development of a vaccine for #COVID19, which will be an essential tool for controlling transmission of the virus"-@DrTedros
"The #smallpox eradication campaign had one crucial tool that we don‚Äôt have for #COVID19 ‚Äì yet: a vaccine; in fact, the world‚Äôs first vaccine"-@DrTedros #VaccinesWork

"Many of the basic public health tools that were used successfully then are the same tools that have been used to respond to #Ebola, and to #COVID19: disease surveillance, case finding, contact tracing, and mass communication campaigns to inform affected populations"-@DrTedros

"Its eradication stands as the greatest public health triumph in history. As the confronts the #COVID19 pandemic, humanity‚Äôs victory over #smallpox is a reminder of what is possible when nations come together to fight a common health threat"-@DrTedros

"#Smallpox is the first and, to date, the only human disease to be eradicated globally. Until it was wiped out, smallpox had plagued humanity for at least 3000 years, killing 300 million people in the 20th century alone"-@DrTedros
"Exactly 40 years ago today, on the 8th of May 1980, the World Health Assembly officially declared that ‚Äúthe world and all its peoples have won freedom from #smallpox‚Äù-@DrTedros
Media briefing on #COVID19 with @DrTedros.

Working from home with your kids around? You and your family can stay #HealthyAtHome by: -Doing some physical exercises together to destress -Having a 10-minute dance with the song your kids choose! You might even impress them with your moves!

#OnThisDay 40 years ago, #smallpox was made history. It's the only human disease to be eradicated so far. A lesson we must take is: when the unites behind science and public health measures we can defeat diseases and protect lives and livelihoods.
Quarantine can feel lonely, but you‚Äôre not alone. Connecting with other people is good for everyone‚Äôs #MentalHealth. #HealthyAtHome #COVID19 #coronavirus
Stay #HealthyAtHome by finding time to relax during the day. Consider meditating and deep breathing exercises along with other relaxation techniques that can help to reduce stress. #COVID19

During #COVID19, looking after your #mentalhealth is vital. ‚Ä¢Pay attention to your own needs & feelings ‚Ä¢Engage in healthy activities ‚Ä¢Exercise regularly ‚Ä¢Keep regular sleep routines & eat healthy food Share with us what you are doing to stay #HealthyAtHome !

If you are at home because of #coronavirus, it's important to stay active every day as much as you can. WHO recommends that all healthy adults do 30 mins/day of physical activity, and children should be physically active for 1 hour/day. #HealthyAtHome #COVID19
Working from home means people are sitting longer. It is important for your health to get up often, for at least 3 minutes, to stretch your muscles. What are you doing to be #HealthyAtHome ?

The full briefing on #COVID19 by @DrTedros
"The antidote for this pandemic is national unity and global solidarity. Together, we will defeat #COVID19"-@DrTedros

"If we learn anything from #COVID19, it must be that investing in health now will save lives later. History will judge all of us not only on whether we got through this pandemic, but also on the lessons we learned and the actions we took once it was over"-@DrTedros

"As we work on responding to the #COVID19 pandemic, we must also work harder to prepare for the next one. Now is an opportunity to lay the foundations for resilient health systems around the . That includes systems to prepare, prevent & respond to emerging pathogens"-@DrTedros
"The #COVID19 pandemic will eventually recede, but there can be no going back to business as usual. We cannot continue to rush to fund panic but let preparedness go by the wayside"-@DrTedros

"The spends around $7.5T on health each year ‚Äì almost 10% of global GDP. But the best investments are in promoting health & preventing disease at the #PrimaryHealthCare level, which will save lives & save money. Prevention is not only better than cure, it‚Äôs cheaper"-@DrTedros
"Gaps like these don‚Äôt just undermine the health of individuals, families and communities; they also put global security and economic development at risk"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #HealthForAll

"And yet, on current trends, more than 5 billion people will lack access to essential health services by 2030 ‚Äì including the ability to see a health worker, access to essential medicines, and running water in hospitals"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #HealthForAll

"Strong and resilient health systems are the best defence not only against outbreaks and pandemics, but also against the multiple health threats that people around the world face every day"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"The #COVID19 pandemic has highlighted the importance of strong national and sub-national health systems as the foundation of global health security and universal health coverage"-@DrTedros
"The risk of returning to lockdown remains very real if countries do not manage the transition extremely carefully"-@DrTedros #COVID19

" that preventive measures are in place in workplaces, schools and other places where it‚Äôs essential for people to go that importation risks can be managed that communities are fully educated, engaged and empowered to adjust to the ‚Äúnew norm‚Äù"-@DrTedros #COVID19

" that health system capacities are in place to detect, isolate, test and treat every #COVID19 case and trace every contact that outbreak risks are minimized in special settings like health facilities and nursing homes"-@DrTedros

"As more & more countries consider how to ease so-called lockdown restrictions, I want to reiterate the criteria that WHO recommends countries consider: that surveillance is strong, #COVID19 cases are declining & transmission is controlled"-@DrTedros
"Importantly, the framework takes a ‚Äúhealth first‚Äù approach, recognizing that strong and resilient health systems must be the foundation of recovery in all countries"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Today‚Äôs guidance complements the @UN framework for socio-economic response to #COVID19, published last week. The framework lays out a ‚Äúrecovery roadmap‚Äù for countries to: -protect lives & livelihoods -get businesses & economies up & running again as soon as possible"-@DrTedros

"We must address this now & in the long-term by prioritizing diagnosis & care for those who are most at risk. This is not only the right thing to do, it‚Äôs the smart thing to do. We cannot end the #COVID19 pandemic until we address the inequalities that are fueling it"-@DrTedros

"It‚Äôs also vital that countries pay careful attention to the most vulnerable members of their societies. Crises can exacerbate existing inequalities, which is demonstrated in higher rates of hospitalization & death among certain populations in many countries"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"For example, it suggests using telemedicine wherever possible, and leaving insecticide-treated nets for #malaria at the door of households, instead of asking people to collect them from a central location"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"It includes practical recommendations for countries on sustaining essential services at the community level, leveraging community #healthworkers for the response to #COVID19 while keeping them safe & advice for how to adapt services for specific diseases & age groups"-@DrTedros
"Today, WHO, @UNICEF and the @ifrc have published guidance for countries on how to maintain community-based health care in the context of #COVID19"-@DrTedros

"Although professional #healthworkers play crucial roles, in many countries trained members of the community play a vital role in delivering essential health services like vaccination, pre-natal screening & the detection, prevention & management of many diseases"-@DrTedros
"Around the world, the pandemic has caused severe disruption to essential health services ‚Äì including to community-based health care"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"However, even within regions and within countries we see divergent trends. Every country and every region needs a tailored approach. But the impact of the #COVID19 pandemic goes far beyond the numbers of cases and deaths"-@DrTedros

"Although the number of #COVID19 cases reported from Western Europe is declining, more cases are being reported every day from Eastern Europe, Africa, South-East Asia, the Eastern Mediterranean and the Americas"-@DrTedros
"But these are not just numbers ‚Äì every single case is a mother, a father, a son, a daughter, a brother, sister or friend"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"More than 3.5 million cases of #COVID19 and almost 250,000 deaths have now been reported to WHO. Since the beginning of April, an average of around 80,000 new cases have been reported to WHO every day"-@DrTedros

"I‚Äôd like to welcome all Hindi-speaking journalists, and we look forward to your questions. In total, WHO press conferences are now available in 8 languages ‚Äì all six @UN languages, plus Portuguese and Hindi, plus closed captions for people with hearing loss"-@DrTedros
Media briefing on #COVID19 with @DrTedros.

The full briefing on #COVID19 by @DrTedros

"We‚Äôre also grateful to the more than 300,000 individuals, corporations and foundations who have contributed to the #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund, which has generated more than USD 210M in the past 6 weeks"-@DrTedros
"WHO is grateful to the many countries and donors who supported the first Strategic & Preparedness & Response Plan"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Later this week, WHO will launch its updated Strategic Preparedness and Response Plan, which will provide an update of the resources WHO needs to support the international response and national action plans to the end of 2020"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"But of course, today‚Äôs event only covers one part of the response ‚Äì for R&D in vaccines, diagnostics & therapeutics. In the weeks & months ahead, we will need much more to meet the demand for personal protective equipment, medical oxygen & other essential supplies"-@DrTedros

"But just as the number of new cases & deaths is declining in some countries, it is mounting in others. That‚Äôs why today‚Äôs pledging event is so important. This virus will be with us for a long time & we must come together to develop & share the tools to defeat it"-@DrTedros

"Nor can the commitment to the tools that are the foundation of the response: to find, isolate, test and care for every case, and trace every contact. And to ensure health systems have the capacity they need to provide safe and effective care for all"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Several countries are now starting to ease so-called lockdown & #StayHome orders. But our common commitment to basic measures such as cleaning hands and physical distancing cannot be relaxed"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"To mark #HandHygiene Day and the International Day of the #Midwife, we are calling all people to stop what they‚Äôre doing at noon tomorrow to clap for nurses and midwives, and to thank them for their role in delivering safe and effective care"-@DrTedros #ThanksHealthHeroes

"Childbirth can be one of the most precious moments in a woman‚Äôs life, but it can also be one of the most dangerous. Midwives are essential for guiding and caring for women through their entire pregnancy & the critical moment of childbirth"-@DrTedros #SupportNursesAndMidwives
"Research shows that interventions delivered by midwives can avert over 80% of all maternal deaths, stillbirths, and neonatal deaths"-@DrTedros #SupportNursesAndMidwives

"Tomorrow also marks the International Day of the #Midwife. This is an opportunity to remember the vital role that midwives play all over the world in providing safe and effective care for women and newborns"-@DrTedros

"If we are to stop #COVID19 or any other source of infection, and keep #healthworkers safe, we must dramatically increase investments in soap, access to water, and alcohol-based hand rubs"-@DrTedros #HandHygiene

"Around the world, less than two-thirds of health care facilities are equipped with hand hygiene stations, and 3 billion people lack soap and water at home. This is an old problem that requires new and vastly increased attention"-@DrTedros #HandHygiene #COVID19

"Tomorrow is #HandHygiene Day - a reminder of the importance of clean hands for #healthworkers, and for all of us. At the same time, we must remember that millions of people around the world are not able to practice this most basic of precautions"-@DrTedros

"The simple act of cleaning hands can be the difference between life & death & remains one of the most important public health measures for protecting individuals, families & communities against #COVID19 & many other diseases"-@DrTedros #HandHygiene
"But one of the best tools is also one of the most basic: clean hands"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #handhygiene

"This is an opportunity for the world to come together to confront a common threat, but also to forge a common future; a future in which all people enjoy the right to the highest attainable standard of health ‚Äì and the products that deliver that right"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"WHO remains committed to working with all countries and partners to accelerate the development and production of vaccines, diagnostics and therapeutics, and to ensure their equitable distribution"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"The potential for continued waves of infection of #COVID19 across the globe demands that every single person on the planet be protected from this disease"-@DrTedros
"None of us can accept a world in which some people are protected while others are not. Everybody should be protected. None of us are safe until all of us are safe"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Recent advances in science are enabling the world to move at incredible speed to develop these tools. But the true measure of success will not only be how fast we can develop safe and effective tools ‚Äì it will be how equally we can distribute them"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"Today, countries came together not only to pledge their financial support, but also to pledge their commitment to ensuring all people can access life-saving tools for #COVID19"-@DrTedros

"During today‚Äôs event, some 7.4 billion euros was pledged for research and development for vaccines, diagnostics and therapeutics. This was a powerful and inspiring demonstration of global solidarity"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Today, leaders from 40 countries all over the world came together to support the ACT Accelerator through the #COVID19 Global Response International Pledging Event, hosted by the @EU_Commission"-@DrTedros

"Ten days ago, I joined President @EmmanuelMacron, President @vonderleyen and @melindagates to launch the ACT Accelerator, to support the development, production and equitable distribution of vaccines, diagnostics and therapeutics against #COVID19"-@DrTedros
LIVE on #Periscope: Media briefing on #COVID19 with @DrTedros.

"This is an opportunity not only to defeat a common enemy, but to forge a common future; a future in which all people enjoy the right to the highest attainable standard of health ‚Äì and the products that deliver that right"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #UnitedAgainstCoronavirus

"But the ultimate measure of success will not be how fast we can develop tools ‚Äì it will be how equally we can distribute them. None of us can accept a world in which some people are protected while others remain exposed"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #UnitedAgainstCoronavirus
"The ACT Accelerator represents a unique commitment to work together at record speed to develop essential tools to prevent, detect and treat #COVID19"-@DrTedros #UnitedAgainstCoronavirus

"Within 2 weeks of the first #COVID19 cases being reported to WHO, the knew the genetic sequence of this virus. The first diagnostics followed within days. We already have early results from some trials of therapeutics. And several vaccines are now in human trials"-@DrTedros
"The is facing an unprecedented public health crisis. But we are better positioned than any humans in history to confront it"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #UnitedAgainstCoronavirus

"Ten days ago, President @vonderleyen, President @EmmanuelMacron, @melindagates and I launched the ACT Accelerator, a call to action to work together in an unprecedented way to tackle this unprecedented crisis"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #UnitedAgainstCoronavirus
Live: @DrTedros addressing the @EU_Commission pledging conference on #COVID19
"At this critical juncture of the #COVID19 pandemic, all countries and stakeholders, including those from the private sector, must work together to ensure that no one is left behind"-@DrTedros

"The #COVID19 pandemic has also underlined the importance of strong national and sub-national health systems as the foundation of global health security and universal health coverage"-@DrTedros #HealthForAll

"The #COVID19 pandemic has highlighted the critical importance of local, national and global emergency preparedness. The pandemic has reminded us of some simple truths as well: we are one humanity. We share the same planet, the same hopes and dreams, and the same fears"-@DrTedros
"In the face of this global emergency, the spirit of solidarity must be at the centre of our efforts to unite peoples and nations"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"Close partnership between countries is essential for building transparency, trust and coordination, and for the governance and financing of emergency preparedness and response"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Now more than ever, your continued multilateral engagement - and your longstanding commitment to peace - are vital for tackling #COVID19"-@DrTedros at the Non-Aligned Movement Online Summit on COVID-19

"As Non-Aligned Movement marks the 65th anniversary of the Ten Bandung Principles this year, it's clear that multilateral & diplomatic cooperation are needed to ensure countries can respond effectively to #COVID19, while strengthening preparedness for other emergencies"-@DrTedros

DYK? There is no cure for #herpes. Antiviral medications can help to reduce the severity & frequency of symptoms but cannot cure the infection. Development of better treatment and prevention interventions is needed, particularly HSV vaccines. https://bit.ly/2KRW7eh

Around 67% of the population aged 0 to 49 had #Herpes HSV-1 infection in 2016 ‚Äì an estimated 3.7 billion people. Most of these infections were oral; however, between 122 to 192 million people were estimated to have genital HSV-1 infection. https://bit.ly/2KRW7eh

#Herpes HSV-2 likely plays a substantial role in the spread of #HIV globally. Women are more susceptible to both HSV-2 & HIV. Women living in @WHOAFRO Region have the highest HSV-2 prevalence & exposure to HIV - increasing their risk of HIV infection. https://bit.ly/2KRW7eh
DYK? Having #herpes HSV-2 infection makes you at least 3-times more likely to become infected with #HIV, if exposed. https://bit.ly/2KRW7eh

About 13% of the population aged 15 to 49 lived with #herpes simplex virus type 2 (HSV-2) infection in 2016. HSV-2 is almost exclusively sexually transmitted, causing genital herpes. Infection can lead to recurring, often painful, genital sores in up to 1/3 of people infected.

New estimates show billions of people living with #herpes, incl. about half a billion with genital herpes, & several billion with an oral herpes infection. Raising awareness & investment to scale up services are essential to prevent & treat herpes. https://bit.ly/2KRW7eh

Here is the #COVID19 Emergency Committee statement: https://bit.ly/3fcaVCm The committee unanimously unanimously agreed that the outbreak still constitutes a public health emergency of international concern.

"We look forward to seeing how that type of innovative financing could deliver real results for global health when WHO is advocating #HealthForAll. All roads should lead to universal health coverage. WHO is deeply grateful to the @EIB for its support and collaboration"-@DrTedros

"The @EIB has rich experience in innovative financing. I learned from my friend, Werner Hoyer, today that the @EIB were pioneers of so-called ‚Äúgreen bonds‚Äù 30 years ago, to generate funds for climate and environmental projects"-@DrTedros

" we will work together to study market failures in other areas of public health, to examine how innovative financing could help overcome investment barriers and increase access to lifesaving products and services"-@DrTedros

" @EIB and WHO are exploring how the EIB could support the #COVID19 Supply Chain System, to facilitate the distribution of diagnostics, personal protective equipment and other medical supplies to countries that need them most"-@DrTedros

"WHO has grave concerns about potential impact #COVID19 could have as it starts to accelerate in countries with weaker health systems. With the @EIB, we will work urgently to invest in health infrastructure & #healthworkers in 10 countries in Africa & the Middle East"-@DrTedros

" we will work together to strengthen #PrimaryHealthCare and build resilient health systems. The #COVID19 crisis has illustrated that even the most sophisticated health systems have struggled to cope with a pandemic"-@DrTedros

"To address this challenge, WHO and @EIB are working on a fund to invest in the development of new antibiotics for priority pathogens. WHO and EIB now are in discussions with potential investors and other stakeholders on this initiative"-@DrTedros #StopDrugResistance
"Very few new antibiotics are in the pipeline. Most of them offer little benefit over existing treatments, and very few target the most critical resistant bacteria"-@DrTedros #StopDrugResistance

"Investment in antibiotic development has continued to decline. Some small antibiotic companies went bankrupt in 2019 because of the limited profitability of new antibiotics"-@DrTedros #StopDrugResistance
"It threatens to unravel a century of medical progress, and leave us defenceless against infections that were previously easily treated"-@DrTedros #StopDrugResistance
" our two organizations will work together to foster the development of new innovative antibacterial treatments. #AntibioticResistance is one the most urgent health challenges of our time"-@DrTedros

"Both reports called for increased investment in research and development to deliver new tools. With WHO‚Äôs technical expertise and the @EIB‚Äôs financial muscle, we are confident of accelerating the development of those new tools"-@DrTedros #EndMalaria

"Last year, WHO‚Äôs Strategic Advisory Group on Malaria Eradication and the Lancet Commission on Malaria Eradication both concluded that we will need new tools if we are to achieve the dream of eradicating malaria"-@DrTedros #EndMalaria

"Although #malaria deaths have fallen by more than half since the year 2000, progress has stalled in recent years, and may even reverse if the #COVID19 pandemic disrupts malaria control programmes"-@DrTedros #EndMalaria
" WHO and @EIB will collaborate on a new EU Malaria Fund, to address market failures in developing more effective vaccines, drugs and diagnostics for #malaria"-@DrTedros #EndMalaria
"Today we are deepening our relationship with the European Union , by signing a new Memorandum of Understanding with the @EIB. This agreement covers five main areas of work"-@DrTedros
"This coming Monday, the @EU_Commission will host a pledging conference to generate funds for investment in vaccine research"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"As you remember, last Friday we joined the @EU_Commission & other partners to launch the ACT Accelerator, to ensure all people enjoy access to all the tools to prevent, detect & treat #COVID19"-@DrTedros
"In accordance with the International Health Regulations, I will reconvene the #COVID19 Emergency Committee again in 90 days, or sooner if needed"-@DrTedros

"We encourage countries to follow WHO‚Äôs advice, which we are constantly reviewing and updating as we learn more about the virus, and as we learn more from countries about best practices for responding to it"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"As Professor Houssin explained, the committee has also made recommendations for countries, and we encourage countries to pay careful attention to that advice"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We will continue working with countries and partners to enable essential travel needed for pandemic response, humanitarian relief and cargo operations, and for countries to gradually resume normal passenger travel"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"As we have done clearly from the beginning, we will continue to call on countries to implement a comprehensive package of measures to find, isolate, test and treat every case, and trace every contact"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We will continue supporting countries to sustain essential health services, including vaccination, care for women during pregnancy and childbirth, and care for non-communicable diseases, including mental health conditions"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We accept the committee‚Äôs advice that WHO works to identify the animal source of the #coronavirus through international scientific & collaborative missions, in collaboration with the @OIEAnimalHealth & the @FAO of the @UN"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"WHO will continue supporting all countries with technical and logistical support, especially those that need it most"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"I would like to make a few remarks about the committee‚Äôs advice for WHO. We appreciate the confidence & trust expressed by the committee in WHO to continue to lead & coordinate the global response to the #COVID19 pandemic, in collaboration with countries & partners"-@DrTedros
The Emergency Committee on #COVID19 unanimously agreed that the outbreak still constitutes a public health emergency of international concern.
"Of course, the #COVID19 pandemic remains a public health emergency of international concern"-@DrTedros

"Yesterday, I reconvened the Emergency Committee to review the evolution of the #COVID19 pandemic and advise me accordingly. The committee consists of independent, international experts, representing all regions and the full range of relevant expertise"-@DrTedros

"Three months ago, I convened the Emergency Committee under the International Health Regulations, and after receiving their advice, I declared #COVID19 a global health emergency ‚Äì WHO‚Äôs highest level of alarm"-@DrTedros

The full briefing on #COVID19 by @DrTedros

"I have said it before: this virus can wreak havoc. It‚Äôs more than any terrorist attack. It can bring political, economic & social upheavals. But the choice is ours & the choice should be unity at the natl level. The choice should be glbl solidarity, standing in unity"-@DrTedros
"One thing that we would ask is unity at the national level and solidarity at the global level. More than ever, the human race should stand together to defeat this virus"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"WHO is now working to provide the critical strategies, solutions and supplies that countries will need in the coming weeks and months"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"Our commitment remains to serving all the people of the world with science, solidarity and solutions, but above all with humility and respect to all people and nations"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We share the grief and pain of so many people around the world, and we share the hope that we will overcome the #COVID19 pandemic together. There‚Äôs one thing we haven‚Äôt done: we haven‚Äôt given up. And we will not give up"-@DrTedros

"We‚Äôve brought together entertainers to provide music & laughter, even in these dark times, using this opportunity to thank @Hughcevans from @GlblCtzn & @ladygaga. And we‚Äôve watched with admiration as the world has come together in solidarity to fight this common enemy"-@DrTedros
"We‚Äôve worked with tech companies to fight the infodemic. We‚Äôve kept the world informed in multiple ways, including these regular press conferences, answering your questions"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We‚Äôve shipped millions of test kits & tons of protective gear all around the , focusing on those countries who need our support most. We‚Äôve trained 2M+ #healthworkers ‚Äì to be exact, 2.3M health workers around the . We don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs enough, we will train more"-@DrTedros

"We‚Äôve launched a large intl trial to find answers fast about which drugs are the most effective. We‚Äôve brought together a consortium of countries & partners to accelerate the development & equitable distribution of vaccines, diagnostics & therapeutics"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"We‚Äôve brought together thousands of experts to analyze the evolving evidence & distil it into guidance. We‚Äôve convened researchers to identify priorities, from all over the "-@DrTedros #COVID19

"In the 3 months since the Emergency Committee last met, WHO has worked day in, day out to sound the , support countries & save lives. We‚Äôve worked with countries to help them prepare & respond. We‚Äôve brought countries together to share experiences & lessons learned"-@DrTedros

"It‚Äôs almost 3 months since we declared the highest emergency and that‚Äôs what was suggested by the Emergency Committee ‚Äì to evaluate the evolution of the pandemic, and to advise on updated recommendations"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"WHO is committed to transparency and accountability. In accordance with the International Health Regulations, I will reconvene the Emergency Committee tomorrow"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We started our early press conference. People were saying the world will be tired of you if you‚Äôre making a press conference every day, but we didn‚Äôt mind. We wanted to make sure the world understands what WHO is saying"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"From the beginning, WHO has acted quickly & decisively to respond & to warn the world. We sounded the alarm early & we sounded it often. We said repeatedly that the world had a window of opportunity to prepare & to prevent widespread community transmission"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"On the 30th of Jan, I reconvened the Emergency Committee & after receiving their advice, declared a global public health emergency, WHO‚Äôs highest level of alarm. At the time, there were less than 100 cases & no deaths outside #China"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We discussed the seriousness of the situation and agreed that an intl. team of scientists should travel to #China to look into the outbreak and the response, incl. experts from , , , , , , and "-@DrTedros #COVID19

"On the 27th of January, I traveled to Beijing with WHO‚Äôs chief of emergencies @DrMikeRyan other senior WHO staff, and met with President Xi Jinping and other leaders to learn more about the response and offer WHO‚Äôs assistance"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"The Emergency Committee was divided in its opinion & did not advise that I declare a public health emergency of international concern. The Committee asked to be reconvened in 10 days or less to allow time for more information to be collected & considered"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"On the 22nd and 23rd of January, I convened the Emergency Committee, consisting of 15 independent experts from around the world. At the time, 581 cases had been reported, and only 10 cases outside #China"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"On the 20th and 21st of January, WHO staff visited Wuhan, , and on the 22nd, reported that the evidence suggested human-to-human transmission was occurring"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"Earlier the same day, WHO held a press briefing at which we said that, based on our past experience with coronaviruses, human-to-human transmission was likely"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"14 Jan, WHO tweeted reports from that preliminary investigations by authorities had found no clear evidence that H2H transmission was occurring. This is in line with our practice of reporting to the info that countries report to us"-@DrTedros

"On the 13th of January, the first case was reported outside #China, in #Thailand. That day, working with partners, WHO published the first instructions for how to make PCR-based diagnostic test kits, enabling the world to find cases"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"On the 11th of January, #China shared the genetic sequence of the virus for countries to use in developing testing kits. On the same day, China reported the first death from the new #coronavirus"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We also published a readiness checklist to help countries assess their capacities & gaps for detection & response. Because Wuhan, is a major domestic & intl. transport hub, WHO advised that the risk of cases being reported from outside Wuhan was increased"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"10th & 11th of Jan, WHO published a comprehensive package of guidance on how to detect, test for and manage cases & protect #healthworkers from potential human-to-human transmission, based on our previous experience with coronaviruses"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"On the same day, WHO also issued its first public Disease Outbreak News, publishing technical information for the scientific and public health communities, as well as the world‚Äôs media"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Jan 5, WHO shared detailed technical info thru its Event Info System. This incl. advice to all Member States & IHR contact points to take precautions to reduce risk of acute respiratory infections ‚Äì providing guidance on the basis that there could be H2H transmission"-@DrTedros
"On the 4th of January, WHO reported the cluster of cases on Twitter. At that stage, no deaths were reported"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"On the 3rd of January, #China provided information to WHO through a face-to-face meeting in Beijing, and through WHO‚Äôs Event Information System established under the International Health Regulations"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Yesterday was GOARN‚Äôs 20th birthday, and I‚Äôd like to take this opportunity to say thank you and congratulations to every single GOARN member for their commitment to responding to the #COVID19 pandemic and many other emergencies"-@DrTedros
"On the 2nd of January, WHO informed the Global Outbreak Alert and Response Network ‚Äì or GOARN ‚Äì which includes more than 260 institutions in more than 70 countries"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"The following day, New Year‚Äôs Day, WHO asked #China for more information under the International Health Regulations, and activated our Incident Management Support Team, to coordinate the response across headquarters, and our regional and country offices"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"On the 31st of December [2019], WHO‚Äôs Epidemic Intelligence System picked up a report about a cluster of cases of pneumonia of unknown cause in Wuhan, "-@DrTedros #COVID19
"Today I‚Äôd like to take a few moments to look back at the period preceding that announcement, to be clear about what WHO knew, and what we did"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"As of tomorrow, it will be three months since I declared a public health emergency of international concern over the outbreak of novel #coronavirus"-@DrTedros #COVID19
Media briefing on #COVID19 with @DrTedros.

"We will work with @IPUparliament on the development of concrete asks for parliamentarians, to synthetize lessons learned today & to give them a practical tool for advocacy, legislation, budget allocation & accountability to address the #COVID19 pandemic"-@DrTedros

"WHO has a longstanding collaboration with the @IPUparliament. In 2018 we signed a Memorandum of Understanding, which identifies global health security as one of our three priority areas, together with universal health coverage and promoting health"-@DrTedros #HealthForAll
