The full briefing on #COVID19 by @DrTedros

"I continue to call for the world to come together in solidarity and national unity to confront the #COVID19 pandemic, but also to prevent the next one, and to build a healthier, safer, fairer world for everyone, everywhere"-@DrTedros

"Tomorrow I will be participating in a webinar for parliamentarians hosted by WHO, the @IPUparliament & the @UNDRR, to discuss the role parliaments can play to reduce risks, strengthen emergency preparedness and increase resilience"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We have a long road ahead of us, and a lot of work to do. WHO is committed to doing everything we can to support all countries. But political leadership is also essential, including the vital role of parliaments"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We‚Äôre also grateful to the more than 280,000 individuals, corporations & foundations who have contributed to the Solidarity Response Fund, which has now generated more than USD 200M. And I thank @TheFluLab for its contribution of USD 10M"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Later this week WHO will launch its second #COVID19 Strategic Preparedness & Response Plan, with an estimate of the resources needed for the next stage of the global response. I would like to thank , & for their recent contributions"-@DrTedros

"Globally, WHO has shipped millions of items of personal protective equipment to 105 countries, and lab supplies to more than 127 countries. And we will ship many millions more in the weeks ahead"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We are continuing to support these countries with technical assistance through our regional and country offices & with supplies through Solidarity flights. In the past week, we have delivered supplies to more than 40 countries in Africa & more are planned"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"The pandemic is far from over. WHO continues to be concerned about the increasing trends in Africa, Eastern Europe, Latin America & some Asian countries. As in all regions, cases & deaths are underreported in countries in these regions because of low testing capacity"-@DrTedros

"As lockdowns in Europe ease with declining numbers of new #COVID19 cases, we continue to urge countries to find, isolate, test and treat all cases and trace every contact, to ensure these declining trends continue"-@DrTedros

"But that doesn‚Äôt have to happen, and we are working with countries and partners to support them to put measures in place to ensure that services for #malaria continue even as #COVID19 spreads"-@DrTedros

"Saturday was #WorldMalariaDay. A new modelling analysis published last week estimates the potential disruption to #malaria services from #COVID19 in 41 countries in sub-Saharan Africa (sSA). In the worst-case scenario, the number of malaria deaths in sSA could double"-@DrTedros
"Just as immunization has been disrupted in some countries, so have services for many other diseases that afflict the poorest and most vulnerable people ‚Äì including #malaria"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"We call on the global community to ensure @gavi is fully funded for this life saving work This is not a cost, it‚Äôs an investment that pays a rich dividend in lives saved"-@DrTedros #VaccinesWork

"@gavi has set an ambitious goal to immunize 300 million more children with 18 vaccines by 2025. To reach this goal, Gavi will require USD 7.4 billion in its upcoming replenishment"-@DrTedros #VaccinesWork

"The tragic reality is that children will die as a result. Since 2000, @gavi and partners including WHO have helped vaccinate more than 760 million children in the world‚Äôs poorest countries, preventing more than 13 million deaths"-@DrTedros #VaccinesWork

"So far, 14 vaccination campaigns supported by @gavi against polio, measles, cholera, human papillomavirus, yellow fever and meningitis have been postponed, which would have immunized more than 13 million people"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"@gavi has estimated that at least 21 low- and middle-income countries are already reporting vaccine shortages as a result of border closures and disruptions to travel"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"When vaccination coverage goes down, more outbreaks will occur, including of life-threatening diseases like #measles and #polio"-@DrTedros #VaccinesWork

"Even when services are operating, some parents & caregivers are avoiding taking their children to be vaccinated because of concerns about #COVID19. Myths & misinformation about vaccines are adding fuel to the fire, putting vulnerable people at risk"-@DrTedros #VaccinesWork

"Already, #polio vaccination campaigns have been put on hold, and in some countries, routine immunization services are being scaled back or shut down. With the start of the southern hemisphere #flu season, it‚Äôs vital that everyone gets their seasonal flu vaccine"-@DrTedros

"Every year, more than 116 million infants are vaccinated, or 86% of all children born globally. But there are still more than 13 million children around the world who miss out on vaccination. We know that that number will increase because of #COVID19"-@DrTedros #VaccinesWork

"This week is #WorldImmunizationWeek. Immunization is one of the greatest success stories in the history of global health. More than 20 diseases can be prevented with vaccines"-@DrTedros #VaccinesWork
"Children may be at relatively low risk from severe disease and death from #COVID19, but can be at high risk from other diseases that can be prevented with vaccines"-@DrTedros
"Although #COVID19 is taking a heavy toll, WHO is deeply concerned about the impact the pandemic will have on other health services, especially for children"-@DrTedros

"WHO played a key role in the development of the #Ebola vaccine & we‚Äôre doing the same for #COVID19. Developing a COVID-19 vaccine has been accelerated because of previous work WHO & partners have done over several years on vaccines for other coronaviruses"-@DrTedros

"The success in developing effective drugs and vaccines for #Ebola reminds us of the enormous value of these tools ‚Äì and the enormous power of nationals and international collaboration to develop them"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"And we‚Äôre hopeful that the Solidarity Trial will shortly help us to understand which therapeutics are the most safe and effective for treating patients. But ultimately, we will need a vaccine to control this virus"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"This initiative is a vital investment in the response, both for the short term and the long term. Diagnostics are helping us now to find cases and ensure people are isolated and get the right care"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"WHO is deeply grateful to the many world leaders and partners who have come together to ensure no-one misses out on life-saving vaccines, diagnostics or therapeutics. We look forward to more countries and stakeholders supporting this global collaboration"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"I‚Äôve said since the beginning that the most important resource in the fight against #COVID19 is solidarity. The launch of the Access to COVID-19 Tools Accelerator on Friday was a powerful demonstration of that solidarity"-@DrTedros

"First of all, we‚Äôre pleased to have interpretation services available in Portuguese today, and I‚Äôd like to welcome all Portuguese-speaking journalists. WHO remains committed to providing access to as much as information as possible, in as many languages as possible"-@DrTedros

As new evidence becomes available, WHO will update this scientific brief http://bit.ly/3bE1l9g WHO recommends that all individuals follow public health guidelines.

What we don't yet know is the level of protection or how long it will last. We are working with scientists around the world to better understand the body's response to #COVID19 infection. So far, no studies have answered these important questions.

Earlier today we tweeted about a new WHO scientific brief on "immunity passports". The thread caused some concern & we would like to clarify: We expect that most people who are infected with #COVID19 will develop an antibody response that will provide some level of protection.

"And I would especially like to thank Sir Andrew Witty and Dr Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala for agreeing to act as Special Envoys for the ACT Accelerator. We are facing a common threat, which we can only defeat with a common approach"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Each of us are doing great work, but we cannot work alone. We‚Äôre coming together to work in new ways to identify challenges and solutions together"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"This is a landmark collaboration to accelerate the development, production and equitable distribution of vaccines, diagnostics, and therapeutics for #COVID19"-@DrTedros

"Past experience has taught us that even when tools are available, they have been not been equally available to all. We cannot allow that to happen"-@DrTedros #COVID19

" we must coordinate not only to implement the plan, but also to raise resources, so they can be allocated to where they are needed most, not only in the immediate response itself, but also in strengthening the health system"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We‚Äôre all in this together. And we will only get through it together"-@DrTedros #COVID19 The full statement:

"Earlier today I spoke to health ministers from across the Eastern Mediterranean region. I assured them that we will stand in solidarity with them, as we will stand with all countries"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"With the holy month of #Ramadan starting tomorrow, I would like to wish all Muslims around the world Ramadan kareem. This is a season of reflection and community ‚Äì an opportunity for kindness and solidarity"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"We need to ensure these products reach those in need quickly, and we emphasize the importance of regulatory cooperation and international standards"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We also issued a call with the @wto, calling on countries to ensure the normal cross-border flow of vital medical supplies and other goods and services, and to resolve unnecessary disruptions to global supply chains"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"We‚Äôre calling on all telecommunications companies globally to join this initiative to help unleash the power of communication technology to save lives"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"This will help reach half of the 's population that doesn‚Äôt have internet access, starting in the Asia Pacific region & then rolling out globally"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"But we‚Äôre not alone. We work with partners to harness their expertise & networks. Earlier this week WHO & the @ITU announced that we‚Äôre partnering with telecommunications companies to reach people directly on their mobile phones with text messages about #COVID19"-@DrTedros

"In other words, there are still many gaps in the world‚Äôs defences, and no single country has everything in place. WHO will continue working with countries and the international community to close these gaps and build sustainable capacities for the future"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We still see many gaps: -Only 66% of countries have a clinical referral system in place to care for #COVID19 patients -Only 48% have a community engagement plan -Only 48% have an infection prevention & control programme & standards for , & hygiene in "-@DrTedros

"In addition to supporting countries, we also track progress . Among countries that have reported data to WHO, 78% have a preparedness & response plan in place 76% have surveillance systems in place to detect cases 91% have laboratory testing capacity for #COVID19"-@DrTedros
"We‚Äôve also brought in external support through our Global Outbreak Alert and Response Network and specialist Emergency Medical Teams"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"In addition, WHO has sent 70+ surge teams to countries to strengthen surveillance, and provide advice on infection prevention, how to treat patients, risk communication, lab capacity, data management, and much, much more"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"WHO has staff in 150 countries all over the world, working directly with governments, scientists and partners to coordinate national preparedness and response plans, and to implement them"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Through thousands of hours of discussion, we have exchanged first-hand experience and debated the science to generate the advice that we make available to all countries. We then work with countries to turn that guidance into action"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"One of WHO‚Äôs core functions is to provide evidence-based technical advice to countries. This is not something we do alone. We work with thousands of experts to collect, analyze & synthesize the best science & turn it into guidance that we give back to countries"-@DrTedros

"In less than 2 weeks, we received requests to translate the book into 100+ languages, and the book is now being used among Rohingya children in Cox‚Äôs Bazaar, and children in Syria, Yemen, Iraq, Greece and Nigeria"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"We‚Äôve also developed a free children‚Äôs book about #COVID19 with partners from @UNICEF, @Refugees, @ifrc & @UNESCO among others"-@DrTedros

"WHO is also working actively to address the impacts of the #COVID19 pandemic on #mentalhealth. Working with mental health experts around the world, WHO has produced technical guidance for individuals and health workers, recognizing the enormous strain they‚Äôre under"-@DrTedros

"There are disturbing reports in many countries, in all regions, about discrimination related to #COVID19. Stigma & discrimination are never acceptable anywhere at anytime & must be fought in all countries. This is a time for solidarity, not stigma"-@DrTedros
"WHO is committed to supporting all countries to save lives. And we are also committed to human rights, and to fighting stigma and discrimination wherever we see it"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Countries that don‚Äôt do these six central things, and do them consistently, will see more cases, and more lives will be lost. To be clear, WHO‚Äôs advice is to find & test every suspected case, not every person in a population"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"The same public health measures we have been advocating since the beginning of the pandemic must remain the backbone of the response in all countries. -Find, isolate, test & care for every case -Trace & quarantine every contact -Educate, engage & empower your people"-@DrTedros

"People understandably want to get on with their lives. That‚Äôs what WHO wants too & is working for, all day, every day. But the will not & cannot go back to the way things were. There must be a ‚Äúnew normal‚Äù ‚Äì a that is healthier, safer and better prepared"-@DrTedros

"One of the greatest dangers we face now is complacency. People in countries with #StayHome orders are understandably frustrated with being confined to their homes for weeks on end"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"Early evidence suggests most of the ‚Äôs population remains susceptible. That means epidemics can easily re-ignite"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"There‚Äôs no question that #StayHome orders and other physical distancing measures have successfully suppressed transmission in many countries. But this virus remains extremely dangerous"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"And some that were affected early in the pandemic are now starting to see a resurgence in cases. Make no mistake: we have a long way to go. This virus will be with us for a long time"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Most of the epidemics in Western Europe appear to be stable or declining. Although numbers are low, we see worrying upward trends in Africa, Central a& South America, & Eastern Europe. Most countries are still in the early stages of their epidemics"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"Globally, almost 2.5 million cases of #COVID19 have now been reported to WHO, and more than 160,000 deaths. We see different trends in different regions, and even within regions"-@DrTedros
Media briefing on #COVID19 with @DrTedros.

" we call on countries to implement proven public health measures aggressively: detect, test, isolate and care for every case, and trace and quarantine every contact"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"I'd like to leave you with 3 requests. #COVID19 response demands a whole-of-govt approach. As Ministers of health, you play a vital, central role, but you cannot do it alone so continuing with the whole-of-govt approach will be very important to beating this virus"-@DrTedros

"We are helping to consolidate lessons learned to adjust and fine-tune our collective response to the pandemic. The recently released #COVID19 preparedness and response strategy incorporates the most recent learning from country experiences from across the globe"-@DrTedros
"We are coordinating a vast range of research endeavours, including the Solidarity Trial, which is investigating different therapeutic options for the treatment of #COVID19"-@DrTedros

"WHO has produced multiple technical guidance documents on all aspects of the #COVID19 response & our online and remote trainings have been accessed by more than 2 million #healthworkers. And we will expand it to train millions more"-@DrTedros

"In spite of this clear progress, I am of course asking you to do more. As always, WHO is here to assist both at headquarters and regional levels and of course at the country level"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We've been impressed by the progress being made: -the active outreach to almost 70M people in through the national campaign -the rapid scaling up of testing in -the commitment to establishing temporary isolation units in -the use of polio assets in & in "-@DrTedros

"We know that many countries are facing acute shortages of personal protective equipment & WHO is working to increase supply. So far we have shipped diagnostic tests & almost 1M items of personal protective equipment to 15 countries in the region & more is on the way"-@DrTedros

"Protecting #healthworkers is one of the most important responsibilities of the health system. It‚Äôs vital to protect , esp those who work in conflict-affected areas. To do that, we must ensure they have the tools they need to do their jobs safely & effectively"-@DrTedros
"Home isolation should be considered as a last resort, as experience demonstrates that adherence is weak and transmission to other household members is common"-@DrTedros

"Confirmed patients who have mild #COVID19 or do not require hospitalization should be admitted to temporary isolation facilities managed properly with infection prevention and control measures in place"-@DrTedros
"Early isolation of ALL cases is perhaps the most important public health measure in controlling the spread of #COVID19"-@DrTedros

"All of us need to invest further in the collection, analysis and utilization of epidemiological data. Aggregated data should be shared with WHO, to inform country-specific advice and regional analysis and response"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"In places where people live in overcrowded conditions & where ppl must work every day to put food on the table, #StayHome orders may cause significant unintended harm. Govs must impose physical distancing restrictions carefully, adapting for each country & community"-@DrTedros

"From the experience of other countries, we've learned the value of physical distancing, incl. #StayHome orders & suspension of mass gatherings. This approach can prevent a handful of cases from becoming clusters & prevent clusters from becoming community transmission"-@DrTedros
"The proven public health measures of early detection, testing, isolation & treatment of #COVID19 cases, & tracing & quarantining of contacts should form the central pillar of the response"-@DrTedros

"The Eastern Mediterranean still has an opportunity to slow the transmission of #COVID19 ‚Äì but the window is rapidly closing. Slowing the spread is critical in order to give you time to mount a comprehensive response"-@DrTedros
"We‚Äôre especially concerned about the potential impact of the #coronavirus in countries that have suffered from years of conflict & fragility"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"The epidemic in #Iran now appears to be waning, but most other countries in the region are seeing increasing numbers of new infections every day"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"The #COVID19 pandemic is showing that no country or region is immune. Almost 140,000 cases and more than 6000 deaths have been reported to @WHOEMRO so far"-@DrTedros at the Eastern Mediterranean Region Ministerial Meeting on COVID-19

#IronDeficiency is the main cause of anaemia, which is the most prevalent nutritional deficiency, affecting 33% of non-pregnant women, 40% of pregnant women, and 42% of children worldwide https://bit.ly/34PjVsq
Iron is an essential element with important functions such as oxygen transport, DNA synthesis and muscle metabolism https://bit.ly/34PjVsq

Reducing anaemia is one of the components of our efforts to eradicate all forms of malnutrition. However, progress has been limited - there are still 614 million women and 280 million children globally who suffer from it https://bit.ly/34PjVsq

WHO shows how to best measure ferritin, an indicator of iron stores, to help determine iron deficiency or overload. Ferritin levels are low in iron-deficient individuals and high in iron-loaded individuals https://bit.ly/34PjVsq

Avoid having coffee and tea with your meals since they contain some elements that can inhibit the absorption of iron in foods. Wait 2 hours after your main meals to have your coffee or tea https://bit.ly/34PjVsq
Include citrus fruits with your meals. They contain vitamin C which helps you absorb the iron in these foods https://bit.ly/34PjVsq
New #OpenWHO online course to support #healthworkers during the #COVID19 response: learn how to prevent infections with good hand hygiene https://bit.ly/3eGx2AI
To help you prevent iron deficiency, eat iron-rich foods like: meat eggs legumes (like beans, lentils and chickpeas) dark leafy greens nuts and seeds https://bit.ly/34PjVsq
If you feel tired, lack energy and are pale without any apparent reason, you may have anaemia and specifically iron-deficiency anaemia. Go see your doctor for advice https://bit.ly/34PjVsq
In pregnant women, #IronDeficiency can cause anaemia, reduced birth weight and reduced gestation periods https://bit.ly/34PjVsq
In adults, #IronDeficiency can have negative effects including fatigue, impaired physical performance and decreased work productivity, as well as impacting social activities https://bit.ly/34PjVsq

The cognitive development of a child can also be affected if a mother is iron deficient during her third trimester of pregnancy https://bit.ly/34PjVsq

#IronDeficiency in children under two years of age can have significant and irreversible effects on brain development. This can lead to negative consequences on learning and school performance later in life https://bit.ly/34PjVsq
Detecting #IronDeficiency early during pregnancy and in young children is crucial https://bit.ly/34PjVsq

"Through April & May we intend to ship almost 180M surgical masks, 54M N95 masks & 3M+ protective goggles to countries that need them most. I also want to highlight the @foundation_ma‚Äôs donation of 100M masks, 1M N95 masks & 1M test kits to WHO"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"WHO has been working closely with the @WFP to deliver masks, goggles, test kits, face shields & other medical equipment to 40 countries. This is part of the overarching drive to keep supply chains moving & ensure key supplies reach 120 priority countries"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Solidarity flights continue to ship lifesaving medical supplies across Africa to protect #healthworkers, who are on the frontlines in the effort to save lives and slow the pandemic"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Working together with the @GlobalFund, @UNICEF & @UNITAID, we have now placed orders for 30M tests over the next 4 months. The first shipments of these tests will begin next week, through the @UN Supply Chain we have established with the @WFP & other partners"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"To achieve that, WHO has worked with @FINDdx and the @ClintonHealth Access Initiative, to identify and validate five tests that have been validated and can be manufactured in large quantities"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"One of WHO‚Äôs priorities is to work with partners to increase the production and equitable distribution of diagnostics to the countries that need them most"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"While antibody tests are important for knowing who has been infected, tests that find the virus are a core tool for active case finding, diagnosis, isolation and treatment"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"Early data from some of these studies suggest that a relatively small percentage of the population may have been infected, even in heavily affected areas"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We welcome the accelerated dev. & validation of tests to detect #COVID19 antibodies - helping us to understand the extent of infection in the population. WHO is providing technical, scientific & support for the rollout of sero-epidemiologic surveys across the "-@DrTedros

"So-called lockdowns can help to take the heat out of a country‚Äôs epidemic, but they cannot end it alone. Countries must now ensure they can detect, test, isolate and care for every case, and trace every contact"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We want to re-emphasize that easing restrictions is not the end of the epidemic in any country. Ending the epidemic will require a sustained effort on the part of individuals, communities and governments to continue suppressing and controlling the virus"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"We‚Äôve spoken previously about the factors countries must consider as they plan to start lifting so-called #COVID19 lockdown restrictions"-@DrTedros

"I also appreciate the statements of the G77 and the @NAM_ChairAZ expressing their strong support for WHO. WHO‚Äôs commitment is to science, solutions and solidarity. Our commitment is to supporting all countries to save lives"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Yesterday I had the honour of addressing health ministers from the @g20org countries. I appreciate the expressions of support from many countries for WHO‚Äôs coordinating role and our technical guidance"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"The event raised more than USD 127M to support several organizations responding to #COVID19, including USD 55M for WHO‚Äôs Solidarity Response Fund. The fund has now raised more than USD 194M from more than 270,000 individuals, corporations & foundations"-@DrTedros

"WHO is proud to have co-organized this event with @GlblCtzn and @ladygaga, and I also want to thank my colleague @PaulGarwood who came up with the idea and has worked incredibly hard for several weeks to make it happen"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #TogetherAtHome
"I‚Äôd like to start by thanking the many musicians, comedians and humanitarians who made Saturday‚Äôs ‚ÄúOne World, #TogetherAtHome‚Äù concert an enormous success"-@DrTedros

"Today is the first day our press conferences are being interpreted in all official @UN languages: Arabic, Chinese, French, Russian & Spanish. I‚Äôd like to welcome all journalists from around the , & I invite you to ask questions in any of the six UN languages"-@WHO #COVID19

"WHO is committed to leading the work requested by the @g20org leaders, in cooperation with our partners, to assess gaps in global preparedness, and to lay the foundations for the healthier, safer, fairer world we all want"-@DrTedros

"As the ministerial declaration recognizes, the current #COVID19 pandemic has highlighted weakness in health systems and global preparedness. We welcome the commitment you are making not only to combat the current crisis, but to ensure this never happens again"-@DrTedros
"The #COVID19 pandemic has reminded us of a simple truth: we are one humanity. We share the same planet. We share the same hopes and dreams. We share the same destiny"-@DrTedros

" we call on all @g20org countries to work together to increase the production and equitable distribution of essential supplies, and to remove trade barriers that put health workers and their patients at risk"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We echo President @CyrilRamaphosa‚Äôs appeal on behalf of the @_AfricanUnion to @g20org countries to support African countries with stimulus packages and debt relief so they can focus on fighting the pandemic"-@DrTedros #COVID19

" we are looking to the @g20org countries to continue to support the global response to #COVID19. We will soon publish a second Strategic Preparedness and Response Plan, with an estimate of the resources needed for the next phase of the response"-@DrTedros
"Today I have three requests: we urge each of your countries to continue to fight the pandemic with determination, guided by science and evidence"-@DrTedros #COVID19

Monitoring your health during is vital. You should: Check for common symptoms Keep your family/friends informed if you need assistance Seek medical care immediately, if you have difficulty breathing. first, if possible. #TogetherAtHome
"Through the @UN Supply Chain Task Force, we‚Äôre working with the @WFP and other partners to distribute personal protective equipment to countries all over the world"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"WHO is working with @iccwbo and the @b20 group of business leaders from @g20org countries to increase the production and equitable distribution of these life-saving tools"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"One of the biggest challenges we face in Africa and other countries is the critical shortage of supplies, and the ability to deliver them because of weak supply chains"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"More than USD 900 million has been pledged for our first Strategic Preparedness and Response Plan. That includes USD 150 million through the Solidarity Response Fund, from more than 247,000 individuals, corporations and foundations"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We‚Äôve provided training for more than 1.5 million #healthworkers. We‚Äôve launched the Solidarity Trial, to generate robust safety and efficacy data about the four drugs under trial. The international community has rallied in support of the global response"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We‚Äôve engaged thousands of scientists and experts all over the world to develop detailed technical guidance for countries. We‚Äôve shipped supplies of lab diagnostics and personal protective equipment to many countries, and expanded testing capacity"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"Since the beginning, WHO has sounded the alarm bell loud & clear. And we continue to fulfil our mandate to coordinate the global response, working with partners to save lives"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"Urgent support is needed, not only to support countries to respond to #COVID19, but to ensure other essential health services continue"-@DrTedros
"We are deeply concerned that the virus now appears to be gathering pace in countries that lack the capacity of many @g20org countries to respond to it"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"... To ensure they have the capacity to detect, test, isolate and care for every case, and trace every contact; And to ensure their health systems have the capacity to absorb any increase in cases"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Lifting so-called lockdown restrictions is not the end of the epidemic in any country; it‚Äôs just the beginning of the next phase. It‚Äôs vital in this next phase that countries educate, engage and empower their people to prevent and respond rapidly to any resurgence"-@DrTedros

"All of your countries have been affected, and you are all at different stages of the response. We are encouraged that several @g20org countries are now starting to plan how to ease social restrictions. It is critical that these measures are a phased process"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"We are all facing an unprecedented global health crisis. Not only are we confronting a new virus, we are also confronting the first pandemic in history caused by a #coronavirus"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"I would like to reiterate my appreciation to the @g20org, as expressed in their recent statement, committing to further strengthen WHO‚Äôs mandate in coordinating the international fight against the pandemic"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"I would also like to take this opportunity to thank you [ Kingdom] for your generous support ‚Äì the US$500 million you have announced. And thank you for bringing us together today at this critical time"-@DrTedros at G20 Health Ministers Meeting #COVID19

"I welcome the concrete actions the Kingdom is taking with the @g20org Glbl Innovation Hub for Improving Value in Health, the Digital Health Task Force & the Glbl Patient Safety Leaders Group & its strong commitment to #HealthForAll"-@DrTedros at G20 Health Ministers Meeting

A reporter asked a question about Taiwan. WHO experts responded
.@DrTedros clarified WHO‚Äôs position on ‚Äúwet markets‚Äù in today's media briefing. #COVID19
The full briefing on #COVID19 by @DrTedros

"I‚Äôm pleased to say that from Monday, we will be providing simultaneous interpretation for these press conferences in all official @UN languages: Arabic, Chinese, French, Russian & Spanish. We look forward to having more journalists join us from all over the world"-@DrTedros
"This week we launched Tamil, Sinhala, Bulgarian, Greek, Italian and Hungarian, and we plan to launch Polish and Bangla next week"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Finally, WHO is committed to keeping the world informed in as many ways as possible, in as many languages as possible. Our @Viber chatbot is now reaching 2.6 million people with reliable, evidence-based information, and is available in 16 languages"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"WHO has worked closely with the @OIEAnimalHealth & @FAO to develop guidance on the safe operation of markets. Because an estimated 70% of all new viruses come from animals, we also work together closely to understand & prevent pathogens crossing from animals to humans"-@DrTedros

"WHO‚Äôs position is that when these markets are allowed to reopen, it should only be on the condition that they conform to stringent food safety and hygiene standards. Governments must rigorously enforce bans on the sale and trade of wildlife for food"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"I would like to clarify WHO‚Äôs position on ‚Äúwet markets‚Äù. Wet markets are an important source of affordable food and livelihood for millions of people all over the world. But in many places, they have been poorly regulated and poorly maintained"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Today I also spoke to the President of the European Commission, @vonderleyen, and the Prime Minister of Finland, @MarinSanna, about continuing efforts across Europe to fight the #COVID19 pandemic and support lives and livelihoods"-@DrTedros

"I also spoke to the Prime Minister of #Barbados, @miaamormottley, and the current chair of Caribbean countries about the challenges faced by small island developing states in gaining access to test kits and other supplies. No country should be left behind"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Yesterday I spoke to President @EmmanuelMacron, @BillGates and other partners to discuss how to prevent another pandemic by getting vaccines from labs to people as fast as possible and as equitably as possible"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"In addition to tests, we‚Äôre also working hard to accelerate the development, production & equitable distribution of a #COVID19 vaccine"-@DrTedros

"To further strengthen support for Africa, earlier this afternoon I spoke with President @CyrilRamaphosa; @AUC_MoussaFaki, Chairperson @_AfricanUnion; @antonioguterres, @UN SG; @KGeorgieva, Managing Director of the IMF & @DavidMalpassWBG, President @WorldBank"-@DrTedros
"The @AfricaCDC announced yesterday that more than 1 million tests for #COVID19 will be rolled out across the continent starting next week"-@DrTedros

"With WHO support, most countries in Africa now have the capacity to test for #COVID19, but there are still significant gaps in access to testing kits. We‚Äôre working with partners to fill those gaps and help countries find the #coronavirus"-@DrTedros
"With the current challenge of obtaining testing kits, it‚Äôs likely that the real numbers are higher"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"But although we see encouraging signs in some countries, there are worrying trends in others. In the past week there has been a 51% increase in the number of reported cases in Africa and a 60% increase in the number of reported deaths"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"Yesterday we published our guidance on considerations in adjusting public health and social measures, which we encourage countries to read and apply"-@DrTedros
"We‚Äôve said previously that easing these measures must be a gradual process, and we‚Äôve spoken about the criteria that countries should consider"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"WHO is updating our guidance to include recommendations for caring for patients during their recovery period & after hospital discharge. We‚Äôre encouraged that several countries in Europe & North America are now starting to plan how to ease social restrictions"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"More than 2 million cases of #COVID19 have now been reported to WHO & more than 135,000 people have lost their lives. While we mourn for those we‚Äôve lost, we also celebrate those who have survived & the thousands of people who are now recovering"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"So far, the Solidarity Response Fund has generated USD 150M+ from 245K+ individuals, corporations & foundations. These funds are helping us to buy personal protective equipment, laboratory diagnostics & other essential supplies for the countries that need it most"-@DrTedros

"This is an opportunity to express our solidarity with frontline workers & to mobilize philanthropists, the private sector & governments to support the #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund, powered by the @unfoundation and the Swiss Philanthropy Foundation"-@DrTedros
"I would also like to thank @ladygaga‚Äôs mum Cynthia Germanotta @momgerm, who is our goodwill ambassador, who is doing a great job advocating for #mentalhealth around the world"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"This is the result of a close collaboration with my good friend @Hughcevans from @GlblCtzn & the inspirational @ladygaga, to bring entertainment, joy & hope into the homes of people all around the , whose lives have been turned upside down by the #COVID19 pandemic"-@DrTedros
"Tomorrow, WHO is joining forces with many of the world‚Äôs leading musicians, comedians and humanitarians for the ‚ÄúOne World, #TogetherAtHome‚Äù virtual global special"-@DrTedros #COVID19
Media briefing on #COVID19 with @DrTedros, @ladygaga and @GlblCtzn.

Eat plenty of fibre! Foods that are high in fibre keep your digestive system healthy and make you feel fuller for longer. Remember ‚Äì frozen fruit and vegetables contain a similar amount of nutrients to fresh produce but have a longer shelf-life. Stay #HealthyAtHome

Avoid consuming too much sugar. WHO recommends about 6 level teaspoons of free sugar a day. This includes sugars added to processed foods like breakfast cereals, sauces, sugar snacks & sweetened drinks. Stay #HealthyAtHome

Here are few photos from today's media briefing on #COVID19
The full briefing on #COVID19 by @DrTedros
"Since the beginning, WHO has been fighting the #COVID19 pandemic with every ounce of our soul and spirit. We will continue to do that until the end"-@DrTedros
"We will continue to work with every country and every partner, to serve the people of the world, with a relentless commitment to science, solutions and solidarity"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"This Saturday, some of the biggest names in music are coming together for the One World: #TogetherAtHome concert, to generate further funds for the #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund"-@DrTedros
"The Solidarity Response Fund has now generated almost USD 150 million from 240,000 individuals and organizations"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"I would like to thank the @_AfricanUnion, the governments of #UAE and #Ethiopia, the @foundation_ma and all our partners for their solidarity with African countries at this critical moment in history"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"Whether it is by land, sea or air, WHO staff are working around the clock to deliver for #healthworkers and communities everywhere"-@DrTedros

"The Solidarity Flight is part of a massive effort to ship lifesaving medical supplies to 95 countries across the globe, in conjunction with the @WFP & other agencies including @UNICEF, the @GlobalFund, @gavi, & the @UN Department of Operational Support"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"Yesterday the first @UN ‚ÄúSolidarity Flight‚Äù took off, transporting personal protective equipment, ventilators and laboratory supplies to many countries across Africa"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"Last week I announced the @UN Supply Chain Task Force, to scale up the distribution of essential medical equipment"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We are looking at oxygen use & ventilation strategies in patients. Any intervention that reduces the need for ventilation & improves outcomes for critically ill patients is important ‚Äì especially in low-resource settings"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"In addition to the Solidarity Trial, I am glad to say that WHO has convened groups of clinicians to look at the impact of corticosteroids and other anti-inflammatory drugs on treatment outcomes"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Three vaccines have already started clinical trials, more than 70 others are in development, and we‚Äôre working with partners to accelerate the development, production and distribution of vaccines"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We‚Äôre continuing to work with partners all over the to accelerate R&D. 90+ countries have joined or have expressed interest in joining the Solidarity Trial, and 900+ patients have now been enrolled, to evaluate the safety & efficacy of 4 drugs & drug combinations"-@DrTedros

"As a result of their [@ASEAN +3 countries] experience with SARS and avian influenza, these countries have put in place measures and systems that are now helping them to detect and respond to #COVID19"-@DrTedros

"Yesterday I had the honour of speaking to heads of state and government from the @ASEAN +3 nations. It was inspiring to hear their experiences, and their commitment to working together to secure a shared future"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"Our technical guidance brings together the most up-to-date evidence for health ministers, #healthworkers and individuals"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Every day we bring together thousands of clinicians, epidemiologists, educators, researchers, lab technicians, infection prevention specialists and others to exchange knowledge on #COVID19"-@DrTedros
"Today we launched a new course for #healthworkers on how to put on and remove personal protective equipment"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"There are more than 1.5 million enrolments in WHO‚Äôs online courses through http://OpenWHO.org, and we will continue to expand this platform to train many more"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"WHO is getting on with the job. We are continuing to study this #coronavirus every moment of every day, we are learning from many countries about what works, and we are sharing that information with the world"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"WHO is grateful to the many nations, organizations and individuals who have expressed their support and commitment to WHO in recent days, including their financial commitment. We welcome this demonstration of global solidarity"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"No doubt, areas for improvement will be identified and there will be lessons for all of us to learn. But for now, our focus ‚Äì my focus ‚Äì is on stopping the #coronavirus and saving lives"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"In due course, WHO‚Äôs performance in tackling the #COVID19 pandemic will be reviewed by WHO‚Äôs Member States and the independent bodies that are in place to ensure transparency and accountability. This is part of the usual process put in place by our Member States"-@DrTedros
"We are committed to serving the world‚Äôs people, and to accountability for the resources with which we are entrusted"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"Neither do we. This is a time for all of us to be united in our common struggle against a common threat. When we are divided, the #coronavirus exploits the cracks between us"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"#COVID19 does not discriminate between rich nations and poor, large nations and small. It does not discriminate between nationalities, ethnicities or ideologies"-@DrTedros

"Our commitment to public health, science and to serving all the people of the world without fear or favour remains absolute. Our mission and mandate are to work with all nations equally, without regard to the size of their populations or economies"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"WHO is reviewing the impact on our work of any withdrawal of funding and will work with our partners to fill any financial gaps we face and to ensure our work continues uninterrupted"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"We also work with countries to strengthen health systems and improve access to life-saving health services"-@DrTedros

"WHO is not only fighting #COVID19. We‚Äôre also working to address polio, measles, malaria, Ebola, HIV, tuberculosis, malnutrition, cancer, diabetes, mental health and many other diseases and conditions"-@DrTedros
"With support from the people and government of the , WHO works to improve the health of many of the world‚Äôs poorest and most vulnerable people"-@DrTedros

"That creed remains our vision today. The has been a longstanding and generous friend to WHO, and we hope it will continue to be so. We regret the decision of the @POTUS to order a halt in funding to WHO"-@DrTedros

"They expressed that desire in the @WHO constitution, which says that the enjoyment of the highest attainable standard of health is one of the fundamental rights of every human being, without distinction of race, religion, political belief, economic or social condition"-@DrTedros

"When the nations of the world met to form the @UN in 1945, one of the first things they discussed was establishing an organization to protect and promote the health of the world‚Äôs people"-@DrTedros

The full briefing on #COVID19 by @DrTedros

"In an editorial last week, development ministers from the , , , , , and calling on all countries to join this common endeavour. They said that tackling this disease together is our only option. I couldn‚Äôt agree more"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
"I would like to thank the for its generous contribution of ¬£200M to the global response to #COVID19. We greatly appreciate this demonstration of global solidarity"-@DrTedros

"Our global connectedness means the risk of re-introduction and resurgence of #COVID19 will continue. Ultimately, the development and delivery of a safe and effective vaccine will be needed to fully interrupt transmission"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"As the #COVID19 pandemic has spread, its public health and socioeconomic impacts have been profound, and have disproportionately affected the vulnerable. Many populations have already experienced a lack of access to routine, essential health services"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"Countries must balance between measures that address the mortality caused by #COVID19, and from other diseases due to overwhelmed health systems, as well as the social economic impacts"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

" communities are fully educated, engaged & empowered to adjust to the ‚Äúnew norm‚Äù. Every country should implement a comprehensive set of measures to slow down #COVID19 transmission & save lives, with the aim of reaching a steady state of low-level or no transmission"-@DrTedros

" outbreak risks are minimized in special settings like health facilities & nursing homes preventive measures are in place in workplaces, schools & other places where it‚Äôs essential for people to go importation risks can be managed"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"[The new strategy] It includes 6 criteria for countries as they consider lifting restrictions that: transmission is controlled health system capacities are in place to detect, test, isolate & treat every #COVID19 case & trace every contact"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"To support countries in making these decisions, WHO will tomorrow be publishing its updated strategic advice. The new strategy summarizes what we‚Äôve learned and charts the way forward"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"We also call on all countries to ensure that where #StayHome measures are used, they must not be at the expense of human rights. Each government must assess their situation, while protecting all their citizens & especially the most vulnerable"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"As I've said many times, physical distancing restrictions are only part of the equation & there are many other basic public health measures that need to be put in place"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"Meanwhile, schools have closed for an estimated 1.4 billion children. This has halted their education, opened some to increased risk of abuse, and deprived many of their primary source of food"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"How do you survive a lockdown when you depend on your daily labor to eat? News reports from around the world describe how many people are in danger of being left without access to food"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"In countries with large poor populations, the #StayHome orders & other restrictions used in high-income countries may not be practical. Many poor people, migrants & refugees are already living in overcrowded conditions with few resources & little access to health care"-@DrTedros

"But while some countries are considering how to ease restrictions, others are considering whether to introduce them ‚Äì especially many low- and middle-income countries in Africa, Asia and Latin America"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"That means control measures must be lifted slowly, and with control. It cannot happen all at once. Control measures can only be lifted if the right public health measures are in place, including significant capacity for contact tracing"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"We know that in some countries, #COVID19 cases are doubling every 3 to 4 days. However, while COVID-19 accelerates very fast, it decelerates much more slowly. In other words, the way down is much slower than the way up"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"We know that the #coronavirus can spread more easily in crowded environments like nursing homes. We know that early case-finding, testing, isolating caring for every case & tracing every contact is essential for stopping #COVID19 transmission"-@DrTedros

"Evidence from several countries is giving us a clearer picture about this virus, how it behaves, how to stop it & how to treat it. We know that #COVID19 spreads fast & we know that it is deadly ‚Äì 10 times deadlier than the virus responsible for the 2009 flu pandemic"-@DrTedros

"As we‚Äôve said many times before, this is a new virus & the first pandemic caused by a #coronavirus. We‚Äôre all learning, all the time & adjusting our strategy, based on the latest available evidence. We can only say what we know & we can only act on what we know"-@DrTedros

"In both cases, these decisions must be based first on foremost on protecting human health, and guided by what we know about the #coronavirus and how it behaves. Since the beginning, this has been an area of intense focus for WHO"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Some countries and communities have now endured several weeks of social and economic restrictions. Some countries are considering when they can lift these restrictions; others are considering whether and when to introduce them"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"Unfortunately, this means the government of #DRC will not be able to declare an end to the #Ebola outbreak on Monday, as hoped. But WHO remains on the ground & committed as ever to working with the government, affected communities & our partners to end the outbreak"-@DrTedros

"Today I convened a meeting of the Emergency Committee on #Ebola in #DRC. After 52 days without a case, surveillance and response teams on the ground have confirmed a new case of Ebola in DRC. We have been preparing for and expecting more cases"-@DrTedros

"Clearly the associated costs will be substantial. @WFP estimates it will need approximately USD 280M, simply to cover the costs of storing & moving supplies. The costs of procuring supplies will be much greater. We urge donors to support this vitally important system"-@DrTedros

"To move these supplies around the world, @WFP will deploy eight 747 aircraft, eight medium-sized cargo aircraft, and several smaller passenger planes to move humanitarian workers, technical staff, trainers and other personnel"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"Every month, we will need to ship at least: -100M medical masks & gloves -up to 25M N95 respirators, gowns & face-shields -up to 2.5M diagnostic tests -large quantities of oxygen concentrators & other equipment for clinical care"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"This system will consist of hubs in Belgium, China, Ethiopia, Ghana, Malaysia, Panama, South Africa & the United Arab Emirates. We estimate this supply chain may need to cover more than 30% of the world‚Äôs needs in the acute phase of the pandemic"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
"This initiative will be coordinated by WHO and @WFP, building on existing collaboration between multiple partners from within and outside the @UN"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"The new @UN Supply Chain Task Force, to coordinate & scale up the procurement & distribution of personal protective equipment, lab diagnostics & oxygen to the countries that need it most"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"To support countries, WHO has launched three tools to help managers and planners calculate the #healthworkers, supplies and equipment that will be needed for the increase in #COVID19 patients"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"The evidence shows: when #healthworkers wear personal protective equipment (PPE) the right way, infections can be prevented. That makes it even more important that health workers are able to access the masks, gloves, gowns & other PPE they need to do their jobs safely"-@DrTedros

"Within , common problems are the late recognition of #COVID19, or lack of training or inexperience in dealing with respiratory pathogens. Many #healthworkers are also being exposed to large numbers of patients in long shifts with inadequate rest periods"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"When #healthworkers are at risk, we‚Äôre all at risk. Evidence from is helping us to understand why this is happening & what we can do about it. It shows that some health workers are actually being infected outside , in their homes or communities"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We are particularly concerned by the large numbers of infections reported among #healthworkers. In some countries there are reports of up to 10% of health workers being infected. This is an alarming trend"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

" preventive measures are in place in workplaces, schools & other essential places importation risks can be managed communities are fully aware and engaged in the transition"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"WHO is working with affected countries on strategies for gradually & safely easing restrictions. Imp. factors to consider are that: transmission is controlled sufficient public health & medical services are available outbreak risks in spec settings are minimized"-@DrTedros
"At the same time, lifting restrictions too quickly could lead to a deadly resurgence. The way down can be as dangerous as the way up if not managed properly"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
"I know that some countries are already planning the transition out of #StayHome restrictions. WHO wants to see restrictions lifted as much as anyone"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"The recent meeting of the @g20org expressed strong support for Africa, which must be expedited even though the numbers in Africa are still relatively small but accelerating"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"As Dr @MoetiTshidi, the Regional Director for @WHOAFRO, said yesterday, this means countries need to localize the #COVID19 response, by urgently strengthening the existing public health and primary health care infrastructure in countries"-@DrTedros #coronavirus
"We anticipate severe hardship for already overstretched health systems, particularly in rural areas, which normally lack the resources of those in cities"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"At the same time, we‚Äôve seen an alarming acceleration in other countries. I want to take a moment to highlight Africa, where we are seeing the spread of the #coronavirus to rural areas. We are now seeing clusters of cases and community spread in more than 16 countries"-@DrTedros

"On a personal note, I was pleased to see my friend @BorisJohnson is no longer in intensive care. I wish him the best ‚Äì as I wish the best for everyone who is facing what he faced"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"Globally, nearly 1.5 million confirmed cases of #COVID19 have now been reported to WHO, and more than 92,000 deaths. In the past week, we‚Äôve seen a welcome slowing in some of the hardest-hit countries in Europe, like Spain, Italy, Germany and France"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"Thank you all for your commitment & support for harnessing the law to mitigate the current crisis & to work towards a healthier, safer, fairer . WHO‚Äôs commitment is to serving all people in all countries to promote health, keep the world safe & serve the vulnerable"-@DrTedros

"Last year, legislators from many countries at the @IPUparliament Congress in Belgrade pledged to leverage the power of parliaments to make progress towards universal health coverage"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #HealthForAll

"Around the world, more and more countries have enshrined the right to health in their constitutions. And more countries are enacting laws to make that right a reality"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #HealthForAll

"Countries with strong health systems are the best placed to protect their people and their economies from the effects of health emergencies. Here too, the rule of law has a central role to play"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #HealthForAll
"That is for WHO, there is no higher priority than universal health coverage, so that all people have access to essential health services, without financial hardship"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #HealthForAll

"One day, hopefully before too long, this crisis will be behind us. But billions of people will continue to face their own personal health crises every day of not having access to the essential health services they need & of not being able to pay for those services"-@DrTedros

"#COVID19 is disrupting our societies, but it cannot, and must not, shake our foundations. History will judge us not only on whether we get through this pandemic, but the manner in which we did so"-@DrTedros

"The restrictive measures governments are implementing are already having a massive impact on livelihoods. We must plan for & take appropriate measures to alleviate the economic impact of the #COVID19 pandemic"-@DrTedros

"Countries have to protect & support the elderly, refugees & other vulnerable groups. We‚Äôre esp concerned by reports of an increasing trend in domestic violence linked to the #StayHome measures. This must be an area of focus for all countries"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"It is critical that governments reassure the population that once the crisis is over, such measures will be discontinued and life can go back to normal"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"Governments should be transparent with their populations, inform them regularly on how measures are being implemented and on the intended duration of these measures"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"In implementing these measures, there is a need to respect human rights & dignity, as provided by the Intel Health Regulations, by the European Convention for the Protection of Human Rights & Fundamental Freedoms & by the Universal Declaration of Human Rights"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"In this time of crisis, these unprecedented measures are motivated by the desire to protect their populations by reducing the spread of the #coronavirus and thus ‚Äúflatten the curve‚Äù."-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Many countries have put in place very restrictive measures of physical distancing. These include closing borders, declaration of a national state of emergency, lockdowns of cities or entire countries, and closing schools and businesses"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Countries who have the heavy responsibility of accommodating these vulnerable populations must be given the necessary tools and resources to protect them and provide them with the support they need"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Populations in humanitarian settings are particularly at risk. They have few resources and little access to health care and basic infrastructure. Physical distancing and hand washing may not be possible, which puts whole communities at risk"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"The IHR provides an intl legal framework. In order to be effective & efficient, domestic laws & regulations must also frame the response. They should be clearly articulated, swiftly adopted & implemented, proportionate to the circumstances & limited in their duration"-@DrTedros

"Rule of law has a critical role to play in fighting #COVID19 pandemic. As countries work to contain and mitigate the virus, many social challenges are arising, which require legal, regulatory and ethical responses"-@DrTedros

"A key principle of the International Health Regulations is that they must be implemented with full respect for dignity, human rights and the fundamental freedom of persons. This is essential"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"The key purpose of the Intl Health Regulations is to prevent & respond to the intl spread of diseases, while minimizing interference with intl traffic, which in this case means supplies of medical goods, food & other essential items & personnel"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We need the rule of law not only in times of peace, but most especially in times of great uncertainty. At the level, the Intl Health Regulations provide a vital legal framework for bringing all WHO Member States together to confront global health emergencies"-@DrTedros

"The #COVID19 pandemic has placed new pressures and responsibilities on states, on communities and on individuals. The rule of law is what guarantees the functioning and stability of our countries, which together make up the international community"-@DrTedros

"We have just marked 100 days since we were first notified of the viral disease which has come to be known as #COVID19, and which has now spread across the world. Not only are we facing health severe consequences, but also major socio-economic disruptions"-@DrTedros

"I also express my sympathy to all those in who have lost someone they love to #COVID19 & my best wishes for all those who are now fighting for their lives"-@DrTedros addressing 's International Legal Forum

"Thank you for the opportunity of joining you today, and I‚Äôd like to express my gratitude to the Russian Federation for convening this very important event, under very difficult circumstances"-@DrTedros addressing 's International Legal Forum on #COVID19

"To stop #COID19 pandemic, we have to continue & improve on the kind of cooperation that you've already been demonstrating. We‚Äôre all in this together & we still have a long way to go. But with solidarity & determination, we will overcome this common threat together"-@DrTedros

"We'd like to invite all of you to participate in the Solidarity Trial, an international study that will show us which treatments are most effective. Many countries from throughout the world are already participating"-@DrTedros addressing @TurkicCouncil on #COVID19
" also deserves recognition for its support of is European neighbors by sending essential supplies"-@DrTedros addressing @TurkicCouncil on #COVID19

"I want to thank all Member States & partners who have responded to our first #COVID19 Strategic Preparedness & Response Plan. $800+M has been pledged or received. I especially thank the government & people of for their contribution of $5M"-@DrTedros at @TurkicCouncil

"Our second #COVID19 Strategic Preparedness and Response Plan, to be published in the coming days, will estimate the resources needed to implement national and international strategies during the next phase of the response"-@DrTedros addressing @TurkicCouncil

"These are the 5 areas WHO is focused on: -support countries to prepare & respond -provide epidemiological analysis & risk communication -coordinate the supply chain -provide technical expertise & mobilize #healthworkers -accelerate R&D, innovation & knowledge sharing"-@DrTedros
"National strategies must be supported at the international level in 5 key areas"-@DrTedros addressing @TurkicCouncil on #COVID19

"At the same time, equitable access to healthcare is critical, esp among vulnerable groups. In the #COVID19 era, access to essential health services must be ensured for all. Otherwise, the outbreak will be harder to control & puts everybody at risk"-@DrTedros at @TurkicCouncil

"Restrictive social measures alone only buy us time. Stopping the transmission of the #coronavirus requires a comprehensive strategy to find, test, isolate and care for every case, and trace every contact"-@DrTedros addressing @TurkicCouncil on #COVID19

"While each of your countries is in a different phase of the outbreak, all must have the same focus: to scale up efforts to minimize the impact of the epidemic on health systems, social services and economic activity"-@DrTedros addressing @TurkicCouncil on #COVID19

"The window for containing the #coronavirus at the subnational & national level is closing in many countries. Since the beginning of the #COVID19 outbreak, WHO has shipped personal protective equipment and testing kits to the @TurkicCouncil states"-@DrTedros
"We are yet to see the devastation #COVID19 could cause in more vulnerable countries. We‚Äôre committed to doing everything we can to prevent that from happening"-@DrTedros addressing @TurkicCouncil

"This pandemic is much more than a health crisis. It requires a whole-of government & whole-of-society response. In the last 100 days, #COVID19 has shown us the damage it can do in wealthy nations"-@DrTedros addressing @TurkicCouncil

" , the most affected so far of your countries, has suffered a dramatic increase in #COVID19 cases and deaths in the past week. WHO is suffering with you and stands ready to provide whatever support we can"-@DrTedros addressing @TurkicCouncil
"So far, the five Member States of the @TurkicCouncil have reported more than 36K cases of #COVID19 & 750 deaths"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"The fatality rate is estimated to be 10 times higher than influenza. More than 1.3 million people have been infected with #COVID19, and almost 80,000 people have lost their lives"-@DrTedros addressing @TurkicCouncil

"This is an example of the kind of cross-border cooperation we need to get through this pandemic. Since it first erupted 100+ days ago, the global spread of #COVID19 has overwhelmed health systems, disrupted the global economy & lead to widespread social disruption"-@DrTedros

"Since the beginning of the global spread of #COVID19, the Leaders of the @TurkicCouncil (TC) have been cooperating closely, incl on sharing hospital facilities, providing humanitarian aid & testing kits & exchanging clinical expertise and medical support"-@DrTedros addressing TC
"Our singular focus is on working to serve all people to save lives and stop the #COVID19 pandemic ‚Äì stop this dangerous enemy"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

So far WHO has: -shipped 2M individual items of protective gear to 75 countries that need it most -shipped 1.5M laboratory tests to more than 126 countries -developed 6 online courses in 43 languages to train #healthworkers, that reaching almost 1.2M enrolments #COVID19

To alleviate suffering & save lives, WHO is: -Supporting countries to prepare & respond -Providing accurate information & fight the infodemic -Ensuring supplies of medical equipment for #healthworkers -Training & mobilizing health workers -Accelerating R&D #COVID19
7 April 2020: #WorldHealthDay highlights the critical role played by nurses and midwives, who are at the forefront of the #COVID19 response globally.
6 April 2020: WHO updates advice on the use of masks during #COVID19
3 April 2020: IMF and WHO make joint call to protect lives & livelihoods

2 April 2020: WHO is provides advice to help people be #HealthyAtHome, with tips on staying physically active, looking after our mental health, quitting tobacco and healthy parenting. We invite everyone to share their ways of being healthy at home:
31 Mar 2020: WHO launches #coronavirus chatbot with @Viber

30 Mar 2020: WHO publishes updated operational planning guidelines to help countries balance the demands of responding to #COVID19 while maintaining essential health service delivery, protecting #healthworkers & mitigating the risk of system collapse.
26 Mar 2020: @DrTedros addresses Extraordinary Virtual @g20org Leaders‚Äô Summit on #COVID19, calling on G20 leaders to fight, unite, and ignite against the #coronavirus:
25 Mar 2020: #COVID19 Mission to #Egypt concludes With support from WHO and other partners, Egypt now has the capacity to conduct up to 200,000 tests.
25 Mar 2020: @UN launches #COVID19 Global Humanitarian Response Plan to Invest In Humanity
23 Mar 2020: WHO and @FIFAcom team up on campaign to kick out #coronavirus. #COVID19
20 Mar 2020: WHO Health Alert for #coronavirus launches on @WhatsApp. #COVID19
18 Mar 2020: WHO and partners launch SOLIDARITY trial to generate robust data from around the world to find the most effective treatments for #COVID19. http://bit.ly/2Ulg5Tj #coronavirus
17 Mar 2020: New guidance published on people affected by humanitarian crises during #COVID19. #coronavirus
16 Mar 2020: #TogetherAtHome online concert series begins, to promote physical distancing and taking action for global health, presented by WHO and @GlblCtzn.
15 Mar 2020: WHO #COVID19 Mission to #Iraq covers detection and response. #coronavirus
13 Mar 2020: WHO launches the #SafeHands Challenge to promote the power of clean hands to fight the #coronavirus.
13 Mar 2020: WHO, @unfoundation and partners launch first-of-its-kind #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund: http://bit.ly/COVID19Fund
12 Mar 2020: #COVID19 expert mission to #Iran concludes
12 Mar 2020: During a 5-day mission to #Azerbaijan, a team of WHO experts works with the national response committee on developing a national preparedness and response plan for #COVID19. #coronavirus

11 March 2020: WHO characterizes #COVID19 as a pandemic. 90% of cases are still in just four countries. 81 countries have not reported any cases, and 57 countries have reported 10 cases or less. #coronavirus

8 Mar 2020: WHO publishes Interim guidance on critical preparedness, readiness and response actions for 4 different #COVID19 transmission scenarios: -No cases -Sporadic cases -Clusters of cases -Community transmission #coronavirus
6 Mar 2020: WHO publishes draft R&D blueprint draft for #COVID19: https://bit.ly/2xgbwC4 #coronavirus
5 Mar 2020: WHO launches a social media campaign called Be Ready for #COVID19, urging people to be safe, smart and kind. #coronavirus

2 Mar 2020: Mission of WHO experts arrives in #Iran, aiming to identify #COVID19 transmission dynamics and at-risk populations, as well as provide guidance on strengthening and scaling up the response and readiness efforts. #coronavirus

24 Feb 2020: A team of experts from WHO and the @ECDC_EU travelled to #Italy to understand how #COVID19 developed there, learning from the Italian experience and supporting control and prevention efforts by the authorities. #coronavirus

16-24 Feb 2020: The WHO-#China Joint mission, including experts from spend time in Beijing & also travelled to Wuhan & two other cities. They speak with health officials, scientists & #healthworkers (while maintaining physical distancing). #COVID19 #coronavirus
21 Feb 2020: @DrTedros appoints six special envoys on COVID-19, to provide strategic advice and high-level political advocacy and engagement in different parts of the world.
12 Feb 2020: @UN activates WHO-led Crisis Management Team bringing together WHO, @UNOCHA, @UNmigration, @UNICEF, @icao, @WFP, @FAO, the @WorldBank and several UN Secretariat departments.
11-12 Feb 2020: WHO convenes a Research & Innovation Forum on #COVID19, attended by 400+ experts & funders from around the world. #coronavirus
5 Feb 2020: Global community asks for US$675 million to help protect vulnerable countries from #COVID19 outbreak. #coronavirus

Acknowledging that #COVID19 cases have been reported in 5 WHO regions in one month, the Committee notes that early detection, isolation & care, contact tracing & social distancing measures ‚Äì in line with the level of risk ‚Äì can all work to interrupt #coronavirus spread.

30 Jan 2020: @DrTedros declares #COVID19 a Public Health Emergency of International Concern ‚Äì WHO‚Äôs highest level of alarm ‚Äì following a second meeting of the Emergency Committee convened under the International Health Regulations. #coronavirus

While in Beijing, , @DrTedros agrees with Chinese government leaders that an international team of leading scientists will travel to #China to better understand the context, the overall response, and exchange information and experience.
28 Jan 2020: A senior WHO delegation led by @DrTedros travels to Beijing to meet #China‚Äôs leadership, learn more about China‚Äôs response, and to offer any technical assistance.

22- 23 Jan 2020: The committee, consisting of independent, international experts, is unable to reach a consensus based on the evidence available at the time. They ask to be reconvened within 10 days after receiving more information. #COVID19 #coronavirus

22- 23 Jan 2020: @DrTedros convenes an Emergency Committee under the International Health Regulations to assess whether the #COVID19 outbreak constitutes a public health emergency of international concern. #coronavirus

22 Jan 2020: WHO mission to #China issues a statement saying there is evidence of human-to-human transmission in Wuhan but more investigation is needed to understand the full extent of transmission. #COVID19 #coronavirus
20-21 Jan 2020: WHO experts from #China and @WHOWPRO offices conducted a brief field visit to Wuhan.

14 Jan 2020: Dr @mvankerkhove notes in a press briefing there may have been limited human-to-human transmission of the #coronavirus (in the 41 confirmed cases), mainly through family members & that there was a risk of a possible wider outbreak.
13 Jan 2020: Officials confirm case of #COVID19 in #Thailand, the first recorded case outside . #coronavirus
12 Jan 2020: #China shares the genetic sequence of #COVID19. #coronavirus

10 Jan 2020: Evidence at the time suggests ‚Äúno or limited human-to-human transmission.‚Äù Based on experience with SARS & MERS & known modes of transmission of respiratory viruses, infection & prevention control guidance for #healthworkers is published.

10 Jan 2020: WHO issues a comprehensive package of technical guidance with advice to all countries on how to detect, test & manage potential cases, based on what was known about the virus at the time. #COVID19 #coronavirus

5 Jan 2020: WHO publishes first Disease Outbreak News on the new virus. This is a flagship technical publication to the scientific and public health community as well as global media. #COVID19 #coronavirus
4 Jan 2020: WHO reports on social media a cluster of pneumonia cases ‚Äì with no deaths ‚Äì in Wuhan, Hubei province, . #COVID19 #coronavirus https://twitter.com/WHO/status/1213523866703814656s=20

31 Dec 2019: #China reported a cluster of cases of pneumonia in Wuhan, Hubei Province. 1 Jan 2020: WHO activates an Incident Management Support Team at HQ, regional & country level, putting the organization on an emergency footing for dealing with the outbreak. #COVID19
As we mark 100 days since the first case of what we now call #COVID19 now was notified to WHO, here is the timeline of key events and efforts taken to stop the #coronavirus from spreading.
