We apologize for sound issues at the beginning of the briefing today. Here you can watch the full statement on #COVID19 by @DrTedros
The full briefing on #COVID19 by @DrTedros
"We know that #COVID19 means billions of believers are not able to celebrate in the way they usually would. We wish everyone a safe and joyful Easter, Passover and Ramadan"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"Finally, this is a special time of year for Christians, Jews and Muslims around the world. Today WHO has published practical considerations & recommendations for faith-based communities"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"For the past 100 days our unwavering commitment has been to serve all people of the with equity, objectivity & neutrality. And that will continue to be our sole focus in the days, weeks and months ahead"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Throughout, our focus has been on working with countries & with partners to bring the together to confront this common threat. We are especially concerned with protecting the ‚Äôs poorest & most vulnerable, not just in the poorest countries, but in all countries"-@DrTedros

"These pillars will continue to be the foundation of our work. In the coming days, WHO will be releasing an updated strategy & a revised #COVID19 Strategic Preparedness & Response Plan, with an estimate of the financial needs for the next phase of the response"-@DrTedros

"Of course, WHO is not alone. Every day, we work with thousands of partners in government, the @UN, academia, the private sector, civil society & more. There are many, many other things WHO has done in the past 100 days that I haven‚Äôt mentioned"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"Today, 130 scientists, funders & manufacturers from around the world have signed a statement committing to work with WHO to speed the development of a vaccine against #COVID19"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"To better understand the transmission, epidemiology & clinical features of the #coronavirus, we've developed research protocols that are being used in 40+ countries, in a coordinated way. We‚Äôre working with @FINDdx to accelerate development & access to diagnostics"-@DrTedros

" we‚Äôve accelerated R&D. In Feb we brought 400+ of the ‚Äôs leading researchers together to identify & accelerate research priorities. We launched the Solidarity Trial, with 90+ countries working together to find effective therapeutics as soon as possible"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"Experts have been deployed around the world through WHO‚Äôs Global Outbreak Alert and Response Network and our Emergency Medical Teams platform"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
" we‚Äôre working to train and mobilize #healthworkers. More than 1.2M people have enrolled in 6 courses in 43 languages on our http://OpenWHO.org platform"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
"Today we are launching the @UN #COVID19 Supply Chain Task Force, to dramatically scale up the supply of these life-saving tools, and match supply with needs"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"We‚Äôve sent 1M+ diagnostic tests to 126 countries, in all regions & we‚Äôre sourcing more. But we know much more is needed. We‚Äôre working with the @iccwbo, @wef & others in the private sector to ramp up the production & distribution of essential medical supplies"-@DrTedros #COVID19

" we‚Äôre working hard to ensure supplies of essential medical equipment for frontline #healthworkers. So far, we‚Äôve shipped more than 2M items of personal protective equipment to 133 countries & we‚Äôre preparing to ship another 2M items in the coming weeks"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"And since we announced the One World: #TogetherAtHome concert with @ladygaga & @GlblCtzn on Monday, more TV networks and online platforms from around the world have contacted us offering to broadcast the concert"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"Just in the past 2 days we convened an online workshop to crowdsource ideas from 600+ experts, institutions & individuals on ways to combat the infodemic. We‚Äôve worked with @FIFAcom & some of the world‚Äôs biggest sports stars to promote #SafeHands & physical activity"-@DrTedros

"The @WhatsApp chatbot now has more than 12 million followers & is available in 7 languages, incl Hindi & Portuguese, which are launching today. The @Viber chatbot has more than 2 million followers, in three languages & four more to launch next week"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We‚Äôve worked with many media & tech companies: @Facebook, @Google, @instagram, @LinkedIn, @messenger, @Pinterest, @Snapchat, @TencentGlobal, @tiktok_uk, @Twitter, @Viber, @WhatsApp, @YouTube & more to counter myths & misinformation with reliable, evidence-based advice"-@DrTedros

"Through our daily situation reports & these regular press briefings, we‚Äôve kept the world informed about the latest data, information & evidence. We‚Äôve held regular briefings with our Member States, to answer their questions & learn from their experiences"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Our EPI-WIN team has adapted our advice for individuals & communities, #healthworkers, employers & workers, faith-based organizations & more about how to protect themselves & others"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"We activated our global expert networks to tap the world‚Äôs leading epidemiologists, clinicians, social-scientists, statisticians, virologists, risk communicators & others"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

" we‚Äôve worked with numerous partners to provide accurate information & fight the infodemic. We‚Äôve published 50 pieces of technical guidance for the public, #healthworkers & countries, providing evidence-based advice on every element of the #COVID19 response"-@DrTedros
"To ensure this money is used where it‚Äôs needed most, we‚Äôve set up an online portal, to help partners match needs with funds"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"That includes more than 140M dollars from more than 229,000 individuals & orgs raised through the #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund, exceeding all our expectations. I‚Äôd like to thank all donors for their support, including @Apple for its contribution of 10M dollars"-@DrTedros

"We issued a Strategic Preparedness & Response Plan, which identified the major actions countries need to take & the resources needed to carry them out. Govs & partners rose to the challenge. More than 800M dollars has been pledged or received for the response"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Through WHO‚Äôs network of 6 regional offices & 150 country offices, we‚Äôve worked closely with governments around the world to prepare their health systems for #COVID19 & to respond when cases arrive"-@DrTedros #coronavirus
"Since then, we have been working day & night in five key areas. we‚Äôve worked to support countries in building their capacity to prepare & respond"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
"In early February the @UN Crisis Management Team was activated, to coordinate the entire machinery the UN to support countries as effectively as possible"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"In February an intl team of experts from , , , , , , , and visited affected provinces in #China to learn more about the #coronavirus, the outbreak and the response, and to glean lessons for the rest of the world"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We convened the emergency committee on the 22 Jan & again a week later, after the first human-to-human transmission cases were reported outside & declared a PHEIC, our highest level of alarm. At the time there were 98 cases outside & no deaths"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"On the same day, we convened our strategic and technical advisory group on infectious hazards to review the situation. We have been engaging with journalists since the beginning, responding to media enquiries around the clock"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
"On the 10th of January, we issued a comprehensive package of guidance to countries on how to detect, test and manage potential cases, and protect #healthworkers"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
"On the 5th of January, WHO officially notified all Member States of this new outbreak, and published a disease outbreak news on our website"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"On the 1st of January, just hours after we were notified of the first cases, WHO activated its Incident Management Support Team, to coordinate our response at headquarters, regional and country level"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
"Today I‚Äôd like to give an overview of what WHO has done in the past 100 days, and what we will be doing in the near future to alleviate suffering and save lives"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"Tomorrow marks 100 days since WHO was notified of the first cases of ‚Äúpneumonia with unknown cause‚Äù in #China. It‚Äôs incredible to reflect on how dramatically the world has changed, in such a short period of time"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

Spread the word #OpenWHO has free #COVID19 training from WHO experts in 17 languages, with more courses added every week. Sign up today https://bit.ly/3bvlPAO
During #COVID19, masks should be used as part of a comprehensive package of interventions.
In the community during #COVID19, we recommend the use of medical masks by people who are sick and those who are caring for a sick person at home.
In health care facilities during #COVID19, WHO has provided guidance for the use of medical masks, respirators and other personal protective equipment for #healthworkers.
We encourage countries that are considering the use of masks for the general population to study their effectiveness so we can all learn from their experience. #COVID19
If masks are worn, they must be used safely and properly. WHO has advice on how to put on, take off and dispose of masks. #COVID19

WHO understands that some countries have recommended or are considering the use of both medical & non-medical masks in the general population to prevent #COVID19. On 6 April, WHO issued guidance & criteria for countries to use in making that decision

To the nurses and midwives of the world: Thank you for working round the clock to fight the #COVID19 pandemic. Thank you for the difference you are making, every day and everywhere. Happy #WorldHealthDay 2020, a day that we dedicate to YOU! http://bit.ly/SupportNursesAndMidwives

Let‚Äôs remember that 2020 also marks the 1st ever International Year of the Nurse and Midwife. Help us spread the word and make the #WorldHealthDay extra special in this very special year! #SupportNursesAndMidwives
#ThanksHealthHeroes #WorldHealthDay

Nurses rely on masks, goggles, gowns & gloves to protect themselves from the #coronavirus. On #WorldHealthDay , let‚Äôs reflect on what individual action we can take to support frontline health workers.

#SupportNursesAndMidwives: Investing in nursing leadership is vital for strengthening the workforce as a whole. Without this countries cannot win the battle against pandemics, or achieve the #GlobalGoals & universal health coverage by 2030 http://bit.ly/NursingReport2020 #WorldHealthDay
Thank you @Twitter users for all your questions on #COVID19 in the past few weeks. Here are some answers. #WorldHealthDay

Happy #WorldHealthDay! Nurses and midwives are already advocates & innovators in their: communities clinics hospitals health care system But they must be properly valued & represented in health leadership roles. #SupportNursesAndMidwives
"To every nurse and midwife, I say thank you, from the bottom of my heart. You have our deep admiration, respect and gratitude"-@DrTedros #ThanksHealthHeroes #WorldHealthDay

"We are committed to working with all countries to ensure that nurses & midwives receive: -the training they need -the recognition they deserve -decent conditions & salaries for their work"-@DrTedros #SupportNursesAndMidwives #WorldHealthDay

"We‚Äôre calling on countries with shortages of nurses to increase the number of nurses they graduate by an average of 8% each year & to implement measures to improve the employment & retention of nurses in the health system"-@DrTedros #SupportNursesAndMidwives #WorldHealthDay

"Although the number of nurses increased by 4.7M between 2013 & 2018, the world is facing a global shortfall of 5.9M nurses, especially in Africa, South East Asia, the Eastern Mediterranean & some parts of Latin America"-@DrTedros #SupportNursesAndMidwives #WorldHealthDay

"Today I‚Äôm proud to launch a new report by WHO, @NursingNow2020 & the @ICNurses on the State of the World‚Äôs Nursing. The report shows that 80% of the ‚Äôs nurses work in countries making up just half of the world‚Äôs population"-@DrTedros #SupportNursesAndMidwives #WorldHealthDay
"One of the lessons I hope the world learns from #COVID19 is that we must invest in nurses and midwives"-@DrTedros #SupportNursesAndMidwives #WorldHealthDay

"Meanwhile, babies are still being born. Midwives are still trying to provide care to make pregnancy and childbirth the safe and joyful experience it should be"-@DrTedros #SupportNursesAndMidwives #WorldHealthDay
"That‚Äôs why we must ensure that #healthworkers have the medical masks & other personal protective equipment they need"-@DrTedros #ThanksHealthHeroes #WorldHealthDay

"More than 3 000 #healthworkers have been infected & many have paid the ultimate price. When health workers are exposed or become sick, they have to go home & stay there for at least 2 weeks. Hospitals scramble to find replacements"-@DrTedros #ThanksHealthHeroes #WorldHealthDay

"I hear stories about nurses video-calling family members late in the night, so they can say goodbye to a dying relative. Because #healthworkers are on the front lines of the fight against #COVID19, they‚Äôre also among the most at risk"-@DrTedros #WorldHealthDay

"Nurses are doing the unthinkable. Because critical #COVID19 patients are isolated, the last human touch they may feel is that of a nurse‚Äôs hand. The kindness of caring strangers has never been more important"-@DrTedros #SupportNursesAndMidwives #WorldHealthDay
"They‚Äôre taking stock of equipment & lending it across units. They‚Äôre learning on the job with information that changes daily ‚Äì even hourly"-@DrTedros #SupportNursesAndMidwives #WorldHealthDay

"Every day, nurses are putting themselves at risk to alleviate suffering & save lives. They‚Äôre reorganizing wards to open more beds for #COVID19 patients, while continuing to provide care for other patients with urgent health needs, incl women in labour"-@DrTedros #WorldHealthDay

"It may not seem that there are many reasons for celebration. The world is in the grip of the most severe health crisis of our time. The #COVID19 pandemic is reminding us of the vital role nurses and midwives play"-@DrTedros #SupportNursesAndMidwives #WorldHealthDay

"Today and throughout 2020, we‚Äôre highlighting the vital role of nurses and midwives, as part of the International Year of the Nurse and the Midwife"-@DrTedros #SupportNursesAndMidwives #WorldHealthDay
"Today is WHO‚Äôs birthday. It was on the 7th of April 1948 that WHO came into being. It‚Äôs a day we mark every year as #WorldHealthDay"-@DrTedros

The full briefing on #COVID19 by @DrTedros
"One of the lessons I hope the world learns from #COVID19 is that we must invest in #healthworkers ‚Äì not only to protect lives, but also to protect livelihoods"-@DrTedros #SupportNursesAndMidwives

"Nurses & midwives are the backbone of every health system. They‚Äôre there from the first moments of life to the last. Tomorrow we are publishing our first report on the state of the ‚Äôs nursing, which highlights gaps & makes recommendations for all countries"-@DrTedros

"Tomorrow is WHO‚Äôs birthday ‚Äì a day we celebrate each year as #WorldHealthDay. This year, we‚Äôre paying tribute to the incredible contribution of all #healthworkers, especially nurses & midwives"-@DrTedros #SupportNursesAndMidwives

"Just as #healthworkers are putting themselves in danger to save lives from #COVID19, health workers in #DRC faced the double threat of fighting a deadly #Ebola virus in one of the world‚Äôs most dangerous and unstable regions"-@DrTedros
"This would not have been possible without the incredible #healthworkers who have put themselves at risk for more than 18 months to stop the #Ebola outbreak in #DRC"-@DrTedros

"We are nearing the end of the #Ebola outbreak in #DRC. If there are no more cases, the govt of could declare the outbreak over as early as this Sunday. We‚Äôre not there yet & we remain on full response mode. We‚Äôre continuing to investigate alerts & to test samples"-@DrTedros

"I call on all countries, companies and research institutions to support open data, open science and open collaboration so that all people can enjoy the benefits of science and research"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"I support this proposal, and we are working with #CostaRica to finalize the details. Poorer countries & fragile economies stand to face the biggest shock from the #COVID19 pandemic, & leaving anyone unprotected will only prolong the health crisis & harm economies more"-@DrTedros

"I also thank the President of #CostaRica, @CarlosAlvQ, & the Health Minister, Daniel Salas, for their proposal to create a pool of rights to tests, medicines & vaccines, with free access or licensing on reasonable & affordable terms for all countries"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"WHO is committed to ensuring that as & vaccines are developed, are shared equitably with all countries & people. I thank the @MedsPatentPool & @UNITAID for the initiative they announced last Friday to include & diagnostics for #COVID19 in their licensing pool"-@DrTedros

"More than 70 countries have joined WHO's Solidarity Trial to accelerate the search for an effective treatment. And about 20 institutions & companies are racing to develop a vaccine"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"Less than 100 days since WHO was notified about the new #coronavirus, research has accelerated at incredible speed. The viral genome was mapped in early January and shared globally, which enabled tests to be developed and vaccine research to start"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Mask or no mask, there are proven things all of us can do to protect ourselves and others ‚Äì keep your distance, clean your hands, cough or sneeze into your elbow, and avoid touching your face"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"There is no black or white answer, and no silver bullet. Masks alone cannot stop the #COVID19 pandemic. Countries must continue to find, test, isolate and treat every case and trace every contact"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"We encourage countries that are considering the use of masks for the general population to study their effectiveness so we can all learn. Most importantly, masks should only ever be used as part of a comprehensive package of interventions"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"If masks are worn, they must be used safely and properly. WHO has guidance on how to put on, take off and dispose of masks. What is clear is that there is limited research in this area"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"For example, countries could consider using masks in communities where other measures such as cleaning hands and physical distancing are harder to achieve because of lack of water or cramped living conditions"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"WHO has been evaluating the use of medical and non-medical masks for #COVID19 more widely. Today, WHO is issuing guidance and criteria to support countries in making that decision"-@DrTedros #coronavirus
"In the community, we recommend the use of medical masks by people who are sick & those who are caring for a sick person at home"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"In health care facilities, WHO continues to recommend the use of medical masks, respirators & other personal protective equipment for #healthworkers"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We are concerned that the mass use of medical masks by the general population could exacerbate the shortage of these specialized masks for the people who need them most. In some places, these shortages are putting #healthworkers in real danger"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"First and foremost, medical masks must be prioritized for #healthworkers on the front lines of the response. We know medical masks can help to protect health workers, but they‚Äôre in short supply globally"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"We understand that some countries have recommended or are considering the use of both medical and non-medical masks in the general population to prevent the spread of #COVID19"-@DrTedros
"As the #COVID19 pandemic continues, we recognise that individuals and governments want to do everything they can to protect themselves & others. So do we"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"Now we‚Äôre working with @ladygaga & @GlblCtzn to take this concept and make it even bigger, through the ‚ÄúOne World: #TogetherAtHome virtual global special on Saturday, the 18th of April. I‚Äôd like to thank them for their partnership and leadership"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Today I‚Äôm delighted to be joined by one of the biggest names in entertainment - @ladygaga & by my friend @Hughcevans, the founder & CEO of @GlblCtzn. WHO has been working with Global Citizen for several weeks on the #TogetherAtHome‚Äù concert series"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We have said consistently that we‚Äôre all in this together, and we can only succeed together. We need an all-of-society approach, with everyone playing their part. That includes people in the entertainment industry"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"The #COVID19 pandemic continues to take a heavy toll on families, communities and nations the world over. But it‚Äôs also giving rise to incredible acts of generosity, solidarity and cooperation"-@DrTedros #coronavirus
Media briefing on #COVID19 with @DrTedros. #coronavirus

The full briefing on #COVID19 by @DrTedros

"We still have a long way to go in this fight. WHO is working every day with all countries and partners to save lives, and to mitigate the social and economic impact of the #COVID19 pandemic"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"I‚Äôm also pleased to announce that I have invited @UNICEF to join the #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund. Unicef has extensive experience both in fundraising & in implementing programmes & our partnership will help us to work together closely to save lives"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"I‚Äôd like to thank , which today is becoming one of the largest donors, with a total of USD 60M. WHO‚Äôs Solidarity Response Fund has now raised over USD 127M from over 219K individuals & orgs. I‚Äôd like to thank @TencentGlobal for its contribution of USD 10M"-@DrTedros

"I‚Äôm delighted to say that almost 690 million dollars has now been pledged or received. Of this amount, 300 million has been given to support WHO‚Äôs work, and the rest has been given on a bilateral basis, or to other organizations involved in the response"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"The global response to #COVID19 would not be possible without the generosity of countries & partners. Two months ago, WHO issued its Strategic Preparedness and Response Plan, with an initial ask of 675 million U.S. dollars to support the response"-@DrTedros
"There is never any excuse for violence. We abhor all violence of all forms, at all times"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #EndViolence

"Make a plan to protect yourself & your children any way you can. This could include having a neighbour, friend, relative, or shelter identified to go to should you need to leave the house immediately"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #EndViolence
"If you are experiencing or at risk of domestic violence, speak to supportive family & friends, seek support from a hotline, or seek out local services for survivors"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #EndViolence

"Women may have less contact with family & friends who may provide support & protection from violence. We call on countries to include services for addressing domestic violence as an essential service that must continue during the #COVID19 response"-@DrTedros #EndViolence

"Women in abusive relationships are more likely to be exposed to violence, as are their children, as family members spend more time in close contact, and families cope with additional stress and potential economic or job losses"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #EndViolence

"Sadly, there are reports from some countries of an increase in domestic violence since the #COVID19 outbreak began. As people are asked to #stayhome, the risk of intimate partner violence is likely to increase"-@DrTedros #EndViolence

"The Global Polio Eradication Initiative is working to ensure that once it is safe to do so, countries can be supported to rapidly restart polio vaccination campaigns. While all our energy may be focused on #COVID19 now, our commitment to #EndPolio is unshakeable"-@DrTedros

"To reduce this risk, we will support countries to maintain essential immunization for all vaccine preventable diseases. WHO has published guidance for countries on how to maintain essential health services even while responding to this crisis"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"To reduce the risk of increasing transmission of #COVID19, the #polio oversight board has made the hard decision to suspend house-to-house vaccination campaigns, knowing that this may lead to an increase in polio cases"-@DrTedros
"Many of those #healthworkers are now supporting the #COVID19 response. They are tracing contacts, finding cases and providing public health information to communities"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"In recent years we have driven #polio to the brink of eradication. This has been a massive global effort, started by @Rotary, supported by many other partners, and led by thousands of #healthworkers, vaccinating children in some very difficult and dangerous areas"-@DrTedros
"The #COVID19 pandemic is also having an effect on the fight against other diseases, like polio"-@DrTedros
"This may be particularly important for refugees, internally displaced persons, migrants and the homeless"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"Suspending user fees should be supported with measures to compensate providers for the loss of revenues. Govs should also consider using cash transfers to the most vulnerable households to overcome barriers to access"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"Several countries are suspending user fees & providing free testing and care for #COVID19, regardless of a person‚Äôs insurance, citizenship, or residence status. We encourage these measures. This is in an unprecedented crisis, which demands an unprecedented response"-@DrTedros

" we call on all countries to remove financial barriers to care. If people delay or forego care because they can‚Äôt afford it, they not only harm themselves, they make the #COVID19 pandemic harder to control and put society at risk"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

" we also call on countries and partners to strengthen the foundations of health systems. That means #healthworkers must be paid their salaries, and health facilities need a reliable supply of funding to purchase essential medical supplies"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"There are 3 main areas for countries to focus on. we call on all countries to ensure core public health measures are fully funded, including case-finding, testing, contact tracing, collecting data, and communication and information campaigns"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"If countries rush to lift restrictions quickly, the #coronavirus could resurge & the economic impact could be more severe & prolonged. Financing the health response is an essential investment not just in saving lives, but in the longer-term social & economic recovery"-@DrTedros

"The best way for countries to end restrictions & ease their economic effects is to attack the #coronavirus, with the aggressive & comprehensive package of measures that we've spoken about many times before: find, test, isolate & treat every case & trace every contact"-@DrTedros

"For some countries, debt relief is essential to enable them to take care of their people & avoid economic collapse. This is an area of cooperation between WHO, the IMF and the @WorldBank"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
"In the short term, countries can ease the burden on their populations through social welfare programs to ensure people have food & other life essentials"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"The restrictions many countries have put in place to protect health are taking a heavy toll on the income of individuals & families, & the economies of communities & nations. We are in a shared struggle to protect both lives & livelihoods"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"More than 1 million confirmed cases of #COVID19 have now been reported to WHO, including more than 50,000 deaths. But we know that this is much more than a health crisis. We are all aware of the profound social and economic consequences of the pandemic"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"We‚Äôre delighted to be joined today by @KGeorgieva, the Managing-Director of the International Monetary Fund (IMF). Kristalina will say more in a few mins about the economic impact of the #COVID19 pandemic & what the IMF is doing to support countries & the economy"-@DrTedros
Media briefing on #COVID19 with @DrTedros. #coronavirus

People with #disability can reduce their potential exposure to #COVID19 by: ‚Ä¢ Avoiding crowded environments ‚Ä¢ Disinfecting assistive products frequently ‚Ä¢ Working from home ‚Ä¢ Gathering urgent items such as food, cleaning supplies, medication or medical supplies #coronavirus

Depending on their health condition, people with #disability may have risks of developing more severe cases of #coronavirus because #COVID19 exacerbates existing health conditions, particularly related to respiratory functions, immune system, heart disease or diabetes.

People with #disability may be at greater risk of contracting #COVID19 because: ‚Ä¢ Physical barriers to use basic hygiene facilities ‚Ä¢ Need to touch things ‚Ä¢ Difficulty in enacting social distancing ‚Ä¢ Barriers to accessing public health & #coronavirus information

#COVID19 home care for people with suspected or confirmed #coronavirus: When coughing or sneezing, cover mouth & nose with flexed elbow or use disposable tissue & discard after use. If you experience difficulty breathing, call your healthcare facility immediately

#COVID19 home care for people with suspected or confirmed #coronavirus: Stay in separate room from others, but if not possible wear a medical mask & keep a distance of min. 1 meter (3 feet) from other people. Keep the room well-ventilated & if possible use a dedicated bathroom
#COVID19 home care for people with suspected or confirmed #coronavirus: Stay at home Do not attend work, school or public places. Rest, drink plenty of fluids and eat nutritious food

The full briefing on #COVID19 by @DrTedros
"But what doesn‚Äôt change is WHO‚Äôs commitment to protecting the health of all people, based on the best science, without fear or favour"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
"This is still a very new virus, and we are learning all the time. As the pandemic evolves, so does the evidence, and so does our advice"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"In these circumstances, masks are only effective when combined with other protective measures. WHO continues to gather all available evidence & continues to evaluate the potential use of masks more broadly to control #COVID19 transmission at the community level"-@DrTedros
"There‚Äôs an ongoing debate about the use of masks at the community level. WHO recommends the use of medical masks for people who are sick and those caring for them"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
"That‚Äôs why we are continuing to work with governments and manufacturers to step up the production and distribution of personal protective equipment"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"We‚Äôre also continuing to study the evidence about the use of masks. WHO‚Äôs priority is that frontline #healthworkers are able to access essential personal protective equipment, including medical masks and respirators"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"As of this morning, more than 200 patients had been randomly assigned to one of the study arms. Each new patient who joins the trial gets us one step closer to knowing which drugs work"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"There has been an extraordinary response to our call for countries to join the Solidarity trial, which is comparing four drugs and drug combinations. So far, 74 countries have either joined the trial or are in the process of joining"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
"We‚Äôre also working hard with researchers all over the to generate the evidence about which medicines are most effective for treating #COVID19"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"Together with @UNICEF & @ifrc, we‚Äôve published new guidance for improving access to #handwashing. The guidance recommends that countries set up handwashing stations at the entrance to public buildings, offices, bus stops and train stations"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"We recommend #handwashing & physical distancing, but we recognize this can be a practical challenge for those who lack access to clean , or who live in cramped conditions"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
"We constantly review & update our guidance as we learn more & we are working to adapt it for specific contexts"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"WHO develops guidance based on the totality of evidence collected from around the world. Every day, our staff talk to thousands of experts around the world to collect and distil that evidence and experience"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"3 months ago, we knew almost nothing about this #coronavirus. Collectively, we have learned an enormous amount. And every day, we learn more. WHO is committed to serving all people everywhere with the best evidence to protect their health"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Many developing countries will struggle to implement social welfare programs of this nature. For those countries, debt relief is essential to enable them to take care of their people and avoid economic collapse"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"In #India, for example, Prime Minister @narendramodi has announced a $24 billion package, incl free food rations for 800 million disadvantaged people, cash transfers to 204 million poor women & free cooking gas for 80 million households for the next 3 months"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"I have called on governments to put in place social welfare measures to ensure vulnerable people have food & other life essentials during this crisis"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"Many countries are asking people to stay at home and shutting down population movement, which can help to limit transmission of the #coronavirus, but can have unintended consequences for the poorest and most vulnerable people"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"It is critical that we ensure these countries are well equipped to detect, test, isolate and treat #COVID19 cases, and identify contacts ‚Äì I am encouraged to see that this is occurring in many countries, despite limited resources"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"While relatively lower numbers of confirmed #COVID19 cases have been reported from Africa, and from Central and South America, we realize that COVID-19 could have serious social, economic and political consequences for these regions"-@DrTedros #coronavirus
"The number of deaths has more than doubled in the past week. In the next few days we will reach 1 million confirmed #COVID19 cases, and 50 thousand deaths"-@DrTedros #coronavirus
"Over the past 5 weeks, we have witnessed a near exponential growth in the number of new #COVID19 cases, reaching almost every country, territory and area"-@DrTedros #coronavirus
"As we enter the 4th month since the start of the #COVID19 pandemic, I am deeply concerned about the rapid escalation and global spread of infection"-@DrTedros #coronavirus
Media briefing on #COVID19 with @DrTedros. #coronavirus
